Umineko Project (UP): The four of us cousins were shooting the breeze over all kinds of topics.

Umineko Project (UP): After all, there are both girls and guys here, plus, we've got people over a wide spread of ages: adult, high school, and elementary school.
Steam (ST): Anyway, there were both girls and guys here. Plus, we had people over a wide spread of ages: adult, high school, and elementary school.

Umineko Project (UP): All each of us had to do was talk about ourselves, and it would be of great interest to the other three.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though everyone was only telling his or her personal story, the other three were listening attentively.

Vietnamese (VI): Chỉ cần mỗi đứa kể chuyện về bản thân mình là đã đủ làm mấy đứa còn lại thấy thú vị rồi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 僅僅是每個人都說一說自己經歷過的事情，就會引起另外三人的強烈興趣。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "I think I'm finally getting used to all this. I mean, Jessica and Maria, you've both grown more than I could've imagined over the past six years. So, to be honest, I was feeling a bit uncomfortable, but talking like this, I guess that on the inside, nothing's really changed since back then."
Steam (ST): "I think I'm finally getting used to all this. Jessica and Maria have grown more than I could've imagined in the past six years. To be honest, I was feeling a bit uncomfortable, but talking like this, I guess that on the inside, nothing's really changed since back then."

Thành thật mà nói thì lúc đầu em còn hơi ngại một chút, nhưng khi trò chuyện bên nhau thế này, em cảm thấy bên trong mọi người chẳng thay đổi gì so với ngày xưa cả."

Dürüst olmak gerekirse kendimi biraz rahatsız hissediyordum ama böyle sohbet edince sanırım içten içe o zamandan bu yana hiçbir şey değişmemiş."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "I realize now, it really didn't feel like a proper gathering of cousins without Battler‐kun in our group, did it? These six years have been kinda lonely."
Steam (ST): "As I thought, without Battler-kun in our little quartet, this group of cousins just didn't feel complete. These six years have been kind of lonely."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "As I thought, without Battler-kun in our little quartet, it just didn't feel like all the cousins were here. These six years have been kinda lonely."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「やっぱり、戦人くんも揃って４人で集まらないと、いとこが集合した気がしなかったね。この６年は、やっぱり寂しかったよ」

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「果然少了戰人，就沒有堂兄妹們相聚的感覺了啊。這六年還真是挺寂寞的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「果然少了战人，就没有堂兄妹们相聚的感觉了啊。这六年还真是挺寂寞的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Sekarang aku sadar, rasanya bukan pertemuan keluarga yang lengkap tanpa Battler-kun dalam grup kita, ya? Enam tahun ini agak sepi."
Italian (IT): "Come pensavo, senza Battler-kun a comporre il nostro quartetto, il gruppo dei cugini non poteva definirsi al completo. Sono stati sei anni alquanto deprimenti."
Turkish (TR): "Şimdi fark ediyorum da, Battler-kun'un grubumuzda olmadığı bir kuzenler buluşması gerçekten de doğru dürüst bir buluşma gibi hissettirmiyordu. Bu altı yıl biraz yalnız geçti."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...That's true. We weren't able to goof off like this. Still, we did have some pretty constructive conversations, don'tcha think? Stuff about preparing for our future, exam‐taking, or finding jobs."
Steam (ST): "...That's true. We didn't really goof off like this. Still, we did have have some pretty constructive conversations, right? Stuff about preparing for our future, exam-taking, finding jobs."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...That's true. We weren't able to goof off like this. Still, we did have have some pretty constructive conversations, don'tcha think? Stuff about preparing for our future, exam-taking, or finding jobs."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…そうだなー。こういうふざけた話にはならなかったな。でも建設的な話はできてたと思ったぜ？　将来に対する心構えとか、受験とか就職とかよー。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…そうだなー。こういうふざけた話にはならなかったな。でも建設的な話はできてたと思ったぜ？　将来に対する心構えとか、受験とか就職とかよー」
Russian (RU): "...Действительно. Давненько мы так не дурачились. Вместо этого мы вели серьёзные разговоры. О планах на будущее, например, об окончании учёбы, о том, кто и куда пойдёт работать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Isso é verdade. Nós não éramos capazes de nos divertirmos dessa forma. Ainda assim, nós tínhamos conversas bem construtivas, não acha? Coisas sobre nos prepararmos para o futuro, vestibulares, encontrar empregos."
Vietnamese (VI): "...Chuẩn luôn đó. Anh em mình lúc đó không chém gió thoải mái được như này. Nhưng bù lại thì cũng nói được nhiều chuyện nghiêm túc đó chứ? Như chuyện chuẩn bị cho tương lai nè, thi cử nè, hay tìm việc ấy."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊。以前可從沒像今天這麼瞎聊過。不過我覺得以前談的話題都很有建設性哦。那時候聊的都是對將來的思想準備啊，考試啊，就業啊什麼的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊。以前可从没像今天这么瞎聊过。不过我觉得以前谈的话题都很有建设性哦。那时候聊的都是对将来的思想准备啊，考试啊，就业啊什么的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Benar juga. Kita tidak bisa bermain-main seperti ini. Tapi kita tetap punya obrolan yang cukup membangun, kan? Tentang persiapan masa depan, ujian, atau cari kerja."
Italian (IT): "...È vero. Non abbiamo mai scherzato in questo modo. Invece abbiamo avuto delle conversazioni costruttive, non trovi? Tipo prepararci per il futuro, studiare per gli esami o trovare un lavoro."

Indonesian (IDN): "Tidak, tidak! Kamu tidak bisa menerima semua yang dikatakan Battler-kun begitu saja, oke? Karena itu semua hanya lelucon. Ayo, kita pergi."
Italian (IT): "Non si fa, non si fa! Non prendere sul serio tutto quel che dice Battler-kun, va bene? Sta sempre a scherzare. Su, su, andiamo."
Turkish (TR): "Hayır, hayır! Battler-kun'un söylediği her şeyi ciddiye alamazsın, tamam mı? Çünkü hepsi şaka. Hadi, gidelim."

Umineko Project (UP): Under Shannon‐chan's guidance, we headed towards the mansion.
Steam (ST): Under Shannon-chan's guidance, we headed towards the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Under Shannon-chan's guidance we headed towards the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺たちは紗音ちゃんに先導され、お屋敷へ向かうのだった。
Russian (RU): Следуя за Шаннон‐чан, мы направились в сторону особняка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sob a orientação da Shannon‐chan, nós fomos em direção à mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們跟隨著紗音前往大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们跟随着纱音前往大屋。
Indonesian (IDN): Di bawah bimbingan Shannon-chan, kami menuju rumah besar.
Italian (IT): Sotto la guida di Shannon-chan, ci dirigemmo verso la villa.
Turkish (TR): Shannon-chan'ın rehberliğinde malikaneye doğru yola çıktık.

Umineko Project (UP): Met once again by the magnificent rose garden, we continued onward as it came into view: .........the imposing mansion of the Ushiromiya main family.
Steam (ST): Met once again by the magnificent rose garden, we continued onward...as the intimidating mansion of the Ushiromiya Head Family came into view.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Met once again by the magnificent rose garden, we continued onward as it came into view...the intimidating mansion of the Ushiromiya Head Family.
PC Japanese (JP): 再び立派な薔薇庭園に迎えられ、さらに進むと見えてくるのが、………迫力ある、右代宮本家のお屋敷である。
Russian (RU): Снова встреченные розарием, мы продолжили идти дальше, пока перед нами не возник......... внушительный особняк главы семьи Уширомия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nos encontrando mais uma vez com o maravilhoso jardim de rosas, nós continuamos até avistarmos.........a imponente mansão da família Ushiromiya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再度經過美麗的玫瑰庭園，又走了一段路，……莊嚴肅穆的右代宮本家大屋映入眼簾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再度经过美丽的玫瑰庭园，又走了一段路，……庄严肃穆的右代宫本家大屋映入眼帘。
Indonesian (IDN): Bertemu lagi dengan taman mawar megah, kami melanjutkan saat itu muncul dalam pandangan: .........rumah besar keluarga utama Ushiromiya yang megah.
Italian (IT): Accolti ancora una volta dal meraviglioso roseto, la visuale che si presentò a noi una volta che proseguimmo... era l'impressionante villa della famiglia Ushiromiya.
Turkish (TR): Görkemli gül bahçesi bizi bir kez daha karşıladıktan sonra yolumuza devam ettik: .........ve Ushiromiya baş ailesinin heybetli malikanesi.

Umineko Project (UP): It had apparently been built shortly after the war, so you could feel the dignity of almost a half‐century hanging about it.
Steam (ST): It had apparently been built shortly after the war, so you could feel the dignity of almost a half-century hanging about it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had apparently been built shortly after the war, so you could feel the dignity of almost a half century hanging about it.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦後すぐに建てられたらしいから、すでに半世紀近くを経た貫禄を漂わせている。
Russian (RU): Судя по всему, он был построен вскоре после войны, поэтому вы сразу можете ощутить почтенный возраст дома, стоящего уже около полувека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente, ela foi construída pouco depois da guerra, por isso você consegue sentir toda a dignidade de quase meio século que ela transmite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它似乎建於戰後不久，因此歷經了近半世紀的風霜，顯得威嚴十足。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它似乎建于战后不久，因此历经了近半世纪的风霜，显得威严十足。
Indonesian (IDN): Rumah itu rupanya dibangun tak lama setelah perang, jadi kamu bisa merasakan martabat hampir setengah abad tergantung di sana.
Italian (IT): Sembrava che fosse stata costruita subito dopo la guerra, perciò emanava un'aura di imponenza, che ha persistito per quasi mezzo secolo.
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre savaştan kısa bir süre sonra inşa edilmişti, bu nedenle neredeyse yarım asırlık bir asaleti hissedebiliyordunuz.

Umineko Project (UP): On the surface, the building was gorgeous, but being as old as it was, it was seemingly lacking in modern amenities like air conditioning.
Steam (ST): The building was gorgeous on the surface, but old as it was, equipment such as its AC and heating were apparently quite frail.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the surface, the building was gorgeous, but being as old as it was, the equipment such as the AC seemed quite frail.
PC Japanese (JP): 見てくれは確かにゴージャスだが、古い建物だけあり、空調などの設備が今ひとつ弱いらしい。
Russian (RU): Снаружи само здание смотрелось великолепно, но поскольку, как уже упоминалось, новым его назвать было нельзя, то оборудование внутри него, такое как, например, кондиционеры, работало не всегда хорошо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por fora, o prédio era grandioso, mas ao mesmo tempo era velho, e aparentemente ele não possuía as comodidades modernas, como ar‐condicionados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然外觀很豪華，但畢竟是老房子了，聽說空調之類的設備都已老化。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然外观很豪华，但毕竟是老房子了，听说空调之类的设备都已老化。
Indonesian (IDN): Di permukaan, bangunannya indah, tapi karena sudah tua, tampaknya kurang fasilitas modern seperti AC.
Italian (IT): A guardarla, la struttura era meravigliosa, ma essendo un vecchio edificio, l'impianto di riscaldamento sembrava abbastanza obsoleto.
Turkish (TR): Görünüşte bina görkemliydi, ancak bu kadar eski olduğu için klima gibi modern olanaklardan yoksun görünüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): According to Jessica, midwinter was especially tough, what with all the drafts.
Steam (ST): According to Jessica, midwinter was especially tough, what with all the drafts.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to Jessica, midwinter was especially tough, what with all the drafts.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香の話によれば、特に真冬は隙間風に悩まされるそうだ。
Russian (RU): По словам Джессики, в разгар зимы из‐за сквозняков было особенно тяжело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Segundo a Jessica, o inverno é especialmente difícil, por causa do frio que entra pelas janelas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 聽朱志香說，冬天透進來的涼風最是煩人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 听朱志香说，冬天透进来的凉风最是烦人。
Indonesian (IDN): Menurut Jessica, pertengahan musim dingin terutama berat, dengan semua angin yang masuk.
Italian (IT): Stando a quanto diceva Jessica, in pieno inverno erano particolarmente colpiti dagli spifferi...
Turkish (TR): Jessica'ya göre, kış ortaları hava akımları yüzünden özellikle zor geçiyormuş.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Well, it's not like they couldn't just take the {c:86ef9c:kotatsu} out.
Steam (ST): ...Haven't these people ever heard of a kotatsu?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It's not like they couldn't just take the {c:86EF9C:kotatsu} out.
PC Japanese (JP): …コタツでも出しゃあいいのにな。
Russian (RU): ...Ну, что им стоило просто вытащить и разложить {c:86ef9c:котацу}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Bem, não é como se eles não pudessem pegar um {c:86ef9c:kotatsu}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …躲進被爐裡不就好了嘛？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …躲进被炉里不就好了嘛？
Indonesian (IDN): ...Yah, bukan berarti mereka tidak bisa mengeluarkan {c:86ef9c:kotatsu}.
Italian (IT): Ma non sarebbe meglio un kotatsu?
Turkish (TR): ...{c:86ef9c:Kotatsu}'ları çıkaramayacak değiller ya.

Umineko Project (UP): As we entered the entrance hall, an aged servant greeted us.{n}Now him I remembered.
Steam (ST): As we entered the entrance hall, an aged servant greeted us. Now him, I remembered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As we entered the entrance hall, an aged servant greeted us. Now him I remembered.
PC Japanese (JP): 玄関を入ると、老いた使用人が迎えてくれた。彼はさすがに俺の記憶にも残ってる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 玄関を入ると、老いた使用人が迎えてくれた。{n}彼はさすがに俺の記憶にも残ってる。
Russian (RU): Как только мы вошли в вестибюль, нас встретил пожилой слуга.{n}Вот его я помнил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao entrarmos, um serviçal, já com certa idade, nos cumprimentou.{n}Agora eu me lembro dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 走進大門，一位老傭人迎了上來。{n}我倒是還記得他。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 走进大门，一位老佣人迎了上来。{n}我倒是还记得他。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat kami memasuki aula pintu masuk, seorang pelayan tua menyambut kami.{n}Nah dia yang kuingat.
Italian (IT): Entrati all'ingresso, ci accolse un anziano domestico. Era esattamente come me lo ricordavo.
Turkish (TR): Girişe girdiğimizde bizi yaşlı bir hizmetkâr karşıladı.{n}Onu şimdi hatırladım.

Umineko Project (UP): As the most senior member of the staff, Genji‐san ({p:0:源次}) served as the head of the servants.
Steam (ST): Genji-san ({p:0:源次}), who had been working here longer than anyone, filled the role of head servant.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the most senior member of the staff, Genji-san ({p:0:源次}) served as the head of the servants.
PC Japanese (JP): 最古参で、使用人の長を勤める源次さんだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 最古参で、使用人の長を務める源次さんだ。
Russian (RU): Как самый старший из слуг, Генджи‐сан ({p:0:源次}) служил в качестве главы прислуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como o mais antigo dos empregados, o Genji‐san ({p:0:源次}) é o chefe de todos os serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他是傭人中資歷最老的，傭人長{ruby:Genji:源次}。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他是佣人中资历最老的，佣人长{ruby:Genji:源次}。
Indonesian (IDN): Sebagai anggota staf paling senior, Genji-san ({p:0:源次}) bertugas sebagai kepala pelayan.
Italian (IT): Genji ({p:0:源次}) è il domestico più anziano, ed è il capo della servitù.
Turkish (TR): Personelin en kıdemli üyesi olan Genji-san ({p:0:源次}) hizmetkârların başı olarak görev yapıyordu.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "............Battler‐sama, we have not met in a long while."
Steam (ST): ".........Battler-sama, it has been quite some time since last we met."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Battler-sama, we have not met in a long while."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………戦人さま、お久しゅうございます。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………戦人さま、お久しゅうございます」
Russian (RU): "............Баттлер‐сама, прошло много времени с вашего последнего визита."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Battler‐sama, já faz um longo tempo que não nos encontramos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………戰人少爺，好久不見。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………战人少爷，好久不见。」
Indonesian (IDN): "............Battler-sama, sudah lama tidak bertemu."
Italian (IT): "...Signorino Battler, è da molto tempo che non ci incontriamo."
Turkish (TR): "............Battler-sama, uzun zamandır görüşmemiştik."

Umineko Project (UP): As our eyes met, he saluted us with a composed voice.
Steam (ST): As our eyes met, he greeted me with a calm, composed voice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 俺と目が合うと、落ち着きある声で挨拶してくれた。
Russian (RU): Стоило нашим глазам встретиться, он сдержанным голосом поприветствовал нас.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando nossos olhos se encontraram, ele me cumprimentou com uma voz serena.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一與我雙目相對，他便用沉穩的聲音向我打招呼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一与我双目相对，他便用沉稳的声音向我打招呼。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat mata kami bertemu, dia memberi hormat dengan suara tenang.
Italian (IT): Come i nostri occhi si incontrarono, mi salutò con un tono di voce rilassato.
Turkish (TR): Gözlerimiz buluştuğunda, sakin bir sesle bizi selamladı.

Umineko Project (UP): He didn't give quite as refined a bow as Gohda's, but it was a bow that had feeling, even if it wasn't polished to the same degree.
Steam (ST): His bow wasn't as graceful or refined as Gohda's, but despite its simplicity, it communicated his feelings very well.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He didn't give quite as refined a bow as Gohda's, but even so, and even though it felt rustic, it was a bow that had feeling.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田さんのお辞儀を優雅だと例えるなら、そこまで洗練されていないが、無骨だけれども気持ちが伝わるお辞儀だった。
Russian (RU): Его поклон был не так подобострастен, как у Годы, но пусть даже это и выглядело простовато, он совершил его со всем уважением.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A forma como ele se curvou não era tão refinada quanto a do Gohda, mas transmitia o mesmo sentimento, mesmo que não fosse tão polida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果將鄉田的行禮形容為優雅，那源次的行禮可以說是雖沒有那麼老練，甚至還略顯粗獷，卻能感受到他的用心。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果将乡田的行礼形容为优雅，那源次的行礼可以说是虽没有那么老练，甚至还略显粗犷，却能感受到他的用心。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia tidak memberikan sungkem yang sehalus Gohda, tapi itu sungkem yang memiliki perasaan, meski tidak dipoles sampai tingkat yang sama.
Italian (IT): In confronto all'eleganza dell'inchino di Gouda, non era altrettanto rifinito, ma aveva trasmesso i suoi sentimenti, nonostante la rozzezza.
Turkish (TR): Gohda'nınki kadar zarif bir selam değildi, ama aynı derecede olmasa da hissi olan bir karşılamaydı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Genji‐san, it's been absolutely ages! You look well."
Steam (ST): "Genji-san, it really has been a while! You look well."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Genji-san, it really has been a while! You look well."
PC Japanese (JP): 「源次さん、本当にお久しぶりっす！　お元気そうですね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「源次さん、本当にお久しぶりっす！　お元気そうですね」
Russian (RU): "Генджи‐сан, прошло действительно много времени! Ты хорошо выглядишь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Genji‐san, realmente já faz muito tempo! Você parece bem."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「源次，真的好久不見了！看起來挺硬朗的嘛。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「源次，真的好久不见了！看起来挺硬朗的嘛。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Genji-san, sudah lama sekali! Kamu terlihat sehat."
Italian (IT): "Genji-san, è da un sacco che non ci si vede! Ti vedo in forma."
Turkish (TR): "Genji-san, çok uzun zaman oldu! İyi görünüyorsun."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you, I have been quite well... ......And you, Battler‐sama, I see have become a splendid young man yourself. .........I would even say you have grown to somewhat resemble the Master during his youth."
Steam (ST): "Thank you. I have been quite well... ...And Battler-sama, you have become a splendid young man. .........You are beginning to resemble the Master in his youth."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Thank you, I have been quite well.........Battler-sama, you have become a splendid young man. .........You have grown to resemble the Master in his youth."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お陰様で健やかに過ごさせていただいております…。……戦人さまこそ、ご立派になられました。………お館様の若き日に、少し似てこられましたな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お陰様で健やかに過ごさせていただいております…。……戦人さまこそ、ご立派になられました。………お館様の若き日に、少し似てこられましたな」
Russian (RU): "Благодарю вас, я весьма признателен... ......Баттлер‐сама, вы стали превосходным молодым человеком. .........Вы так похожи на господина в молодости."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigado, eu tenho passado bem... ......E você, Battler‐sama, vejo que se tornou um esplêndido homem. .........Eu poderia até dizer que você se parece um pouco com o Mestre em seus dias de juventude."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「托您的福身體一直很健康…。……戰人少爺才是，已是一表人才了。………變得有些像老爺年輕時候的樣子了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「托您的福身体一直很健康…。……战人少爷才是，已是一表人才了。………变得有些像老爷年轻时候的样子了。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Terima kasih, aku cukup baik... ......Dan kamu, Battler-sama, kulihat sudah menjadi pemuda yang luar biasa. .........Bahkan bisa kukatakan kamu agak mirip Tuan saat muda."
Italian (IT): "Fortunatamente, sono sempre rimasto in salute... Signorino Battler, lei è diventato uno splendido giovanotto... Assomiglia sempre di più al padrone negli anni della sua gioventù."
Turkish (TR): "Teşekkür ederim, oldukça iyiyim... ......Ve siz, Battler-sama, görüyorum ki siz de muhteşem bir genç adam olmuşsunuz. .........Hatta Efendi'nin gençliğine benzediğinizi bile söyleyebilirim."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm looking like Grandfather? I guess that means Grandfather was pretty popular when he was young, ihihi!"
Steam (ST): "I look like Grandfather? Guess that means Grandfather was pretty popular with the ladies when he was young, ihihi!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I'm looking like Grandfather? I guess that means that Grandfather was pretty popular when he was young, Ihihi!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「俺が祖父さまに？　ってことは、さぞや祖父さまは若い頃モテたろうなぁ、いっひっひ！」
Russian (RU): "Я похож на дедушку? Я так думаю, что дедуля пользовался популярностью, когда был молод, и‐хи‐хи!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu me pareço com o vovô? Acho que ele era bem popular quando era jovem, ihihi!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我像爺爺年輕時候的樣子？這麼說來，爺爺年輕時也挺受歡迎的嘍？嘿嘿嘿！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我像爷爷年轻时候的样子？这么说来，爷爷年轻时也挺受欢迎的喽？嘿嘿嘿！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Aku mirip Kakek? Kalau begitu berarti Kakek cukup populer saat muda, ihihi!"
Italian (IT): "Io assomiglio al nonno? Immagino voglia dire che il nonno da giovane fosse un gran fustacchione, ihihih!"
Turkish (TR): "Büyükbabama mı benziyorum? Sanırım bu, Büyükbabanın gençken oldukça popüler olduğu anlamına geliyor, ihihi!"

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): ".........From here on, I shall take Shannon's place and accompany you. Please, come this way."
Steam (ST): ".........From here on, I shall take Shannon's place and accompany you. Please, come this way."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………ここからは紗音に代わって私がご案内申し上げます。どうぞこちらへ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………ここからは紗音に代わって私がご案内申し上げます。どうぞこちらへ」
Russian (RU): ".........Теперь же я займу место Шаннон и провожу вас. Пожалуйста, прошу следовать за мной."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........A partir daqui, eu vou assumir o lugar da Shannon e acompanhá‐los. Por favor, venham por aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………從這裡開始由我代紗音給大家帶路。請往這邊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………从这里开始由我代纱音给大家带路。请往这边。」
Indonesian (IDN): ".........Dari sini, aku akan menggantikan Shannon dan menemani kalian. Silakan, lewat sini."
Italian (IT): "...Da qui in avanti, spetterà a me accompagnarvi al posto di Shannon. Prego, da questa parte."
Turkish (TR): ".........Bu andan itibaren Shannon'un yerini alıp size eşlik edeceğim. Lütfen, bu taraftan gelin."

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon‐chan bowed deeply and saw us off.
Steam (ST): Shannon-chan bowed deeply and watched us leave.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon-chan bowed deeply and saw us off.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音ちゃんは深々とお辞儀をして俺たちを見送る。
Russian (RU): Шаннон‐чан низко поклонилась и проводила нас взглядом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon‐chan se curvou e se retirou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音向我們深深行了一禮，目送我們離去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音向我们深深行了一礼，目送我们离去。
Indonesian (IDN): Shannon-chan membungkuk dalam dan melepas kami.
Italian (IT): Shannon-chan fece un profondo inchino, e ci osservò mentre ci allontanavamo sempre più.
Turkish (TR): Shannon-chan derin bir selam verdi ve bizi uğurladı.

Umineko Project (UP): Leaving the entrance hall, we headed to the dining hall under Genji‐san's guidance.
Steam (ST): After that, we headed towards the dining room under Genji-san's guidance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Leaving the entrance hall, we headed to the dining room under Genji-san's guidance.
PC Japanese (JP): ここからは源次さんの案内で食堂へ向かっていった。
Russian (RU): Покинув вестибюль, мы направились в столовую, следуя за Генджи‐саном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Deixando o hall de entrada, nós fomos em direção à sala de jantar, sendo levados pelo Genji‐san.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從這裡開始，由源次帶我們向餐廳走去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从这里开始，由源次带我们向餐厅走去。
Indonesian (IDN): Meninggalkan aula pintu masuk, kami menuju ruang makan di bawah bimbingan Genji-san.
Italian (IT): Da quel momento in poi, Genji-san ci guidò in direzione della sala da pranzo.
Turkish (TR): Girişi geride bırakarak Genji-san'ın rehberliğinde yemek salonuna yöneldik.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐san, just like Kumasawa‐san, stood in stark contrast to us young people who had grown beyond recognition over the last six years.
Steam (ST): Genji-san, just like Kumasawa-san, stood in stark contrast to us young people who had grown beyond recognition over the last six years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san, just like Kumasawa-san, stood in stark contrast to us young people who had grown beyond recognition over the last six years.
PC Japanese (JP): 若者勢がこの６年で見違えるほど成長したのに比べれば、源次さんは熊沢さんと同じでまったく逆。
Russian (RU): Генджи‐сан, как и Кумасава‐сан, резко выделялся на фоне таких молодых людей, как мы, которые до неузнаваемости выросли за эти прошедшие шесть лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Genji‐san, assim como a Kumasawa‐san, contrastava conosco, que havíamos mudado bastante nos últimos seis anos, enquanto ele continuava o mesmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 六年間，我們年輕一輩都已成長得讓人認不出來了。與之相比，源次卻跟熊澤婆婆一樣，與我們截然相反。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 六年间，我们年轻一辈都已成长得让人认不出来了。与之相比，源次却跟熊泽婆婆一样，与我们截然相反。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji-san, seperti Kumasawa-san, sangat kontras dengan kami anak muda yang tumbuh tidak bisa dikenali selama enam tahun terakhir.
Italian (IT): Se confrontato con noi giovani, che in questi sei anni eravamo cresciuti al punto da sembrare delle persone diverse, nel caso di Genji-san era l'esatto opposto, proprio come per Kumasawa-san.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san, tıpkı Kumasawa-san gibi, son altı yılda tanınmayacak kadar büyümüş olan biz gençlerle tam bir çelişki oluşturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): His figure was exactly the same as in my memories of six years ago.{n}It seemed like time had stopped since the last we met.
Steam (ST): His appearance was exactly the same as in my memories from six years ago. It was as though time had stopped since the last time we met.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): His figure was exactly the same as in my memories of six years ago. It seemed like time had stopped since the last we met.
PC Japanese (JP): ６年前の記憶とまったく姿が変わらない。時間を止めたまま再会したかのようだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ６年前の記憶とまったく姿が変わらない。{n}時間を止めたまま再会したかのようだった。
Russian (RU): Его фигура осталась всё такой же, как в моих воспоминаниях шестилетней давности.{n}Как будто с момента нашей последней встречи время просто остановилось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua aparência era exatamente a mesma que nas minhas memórias de seis anos atrás. Parece que o tempo parou desde a última vez que nos encontramos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 和我六年前的記憶相比，他一點也沒有變。{n}就像是時間凝固在了六年前一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 和我六年前的记忆相比，他一点也没有变。{n}就像是时间凝固在了六年前一样。
Indonesian (IDN): Sosoknya persis sama seperti dalam ingatanku enam tahun lalu.{n}Sepertinya waktu berhenti sejak terakhir kami bertemu.
Italian (IT): Il suo aspetto era rimasto immutato da quello dei miei ricordi di sei anni fa.{n}Era come se, sino al momento della nostra riunione, il tempo fosse rimasto fermo.
Turkish (TR): Görünüşü altı yıl önceki anılarımdakiyle tamamen aynıydı.{n}Son karşılaşmamızdan bu yana zaman durmuş gibiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐san was a silent and diligent person.{n}He was like Grandfather's close aide or caregiver, ......in fact, you could even go so far as to say he was Grandfather's right‐hand man.
Steam (ST): Genji-san was an extremely quiet and diligent person. He was basically Grandfather's close aide or caregiver, ...and you might even call him Grandfather's companion of many years.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san was a silent and diligent person. He was like Grandfather's close aide or caregiver, ......in fact, you could even go so far as to say he was Grandfather's right-hand man.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんは非常に寡黙で真面目な人だ。祖父さまの側近というか、介護者というか、……考えようによっては女房役とまで言えたかもしれない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次さんは非常に寡黙で真面目な人だ。{n}祖父さまの側近というか、介護者というか、……考えようによっては女房役とまで言えたかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Генджи‐сан был немногословным и прилежным человеком.{n}Его можно было принять за ближайшего помощника дедушки или его опекуна......... по факту, можно сказать, что он является правой рукой дедушки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Genji‐san é uma pessoa silenciosa e diligente.{n}Ele é como o assessor ou cuidador do vovô, ......você pode dizer que ele é a pessoa mais próxima do meu avô, como o seu braço direito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次是個沉默寡言，做事非常認真的人。{n}該說是爺爺的親信，還是說是看護人呢，……換個角度來說，說他是爺爺的妾侍都行。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次是个沉默寡言，做事非常认真的人。{n}该说是爷爷的亲信，还是说是看护人呢，……换个角度来说，说他是爷爷的妾侍都行。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji-san adalah orang yang pendiam dan rajin.{n}Dia seperti ajudan atau pengasuh dekat Kakek, ......bahkan, kamu bisa mengatakan dia adalah tangan kanan Kakek.
Italian (IT): Genji-san era una persona estremamente taciturna e diligente. Era come una sorta di assistente personale del nonno, o un suo badante... In base a come la si vedeva, si potrebbe persino dire che fosse il suo compagno fidato.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san sessiz ve çalışkan bir insandı.{n}Büyükbabamın yakın yardımcısı ya da bakıcısı gibiydi, ......hatta Büyükbabamın sağ kolu olduğunu söyleyecek kadar ileri gidebilirsiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): Actually, it seems that he was by Grandfather's side more than my late Grandmother was.
Steam (ST): In fact, it seems he was by Grandfather's side even more often than my late Grandmother was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Actually, it seems that he was by Grandfather's side more than my late Grandmother was.
PC Japanese (JP): 実際、死んだ祖母さまよりも常に側に控えさせていたらしい。
Russian (RU): Даже больше — похоже, что он знал дедушку раньше, чем наша покойная бабушка.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na verdade, parece que ele é mais próximo do meu avô do que a minha falecida avó era.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 實際也是如此，比起死去的奶奶，好像他待在爺爺身邊的時間反而要更長一些。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 实际也是如此，比起死去的奶奶，好像他待在爷爷身边的时间反而要更长一些。
Indonesian (IDN): Sebenarnya, sepertinya dia lebih sering berada di sisi Kakek daripada almarhum Nenek.
Italian (IT): A dire il vero, sembrava che stesse sempre al fianco del nonno, anche più della mia defunta nonna.
Turkish (TR): Aslında Büyükbabamın yanında rahmetli büyükannemden daha fazla olduğu anlaşılıyor.

Umineko Project (UP): According to Jessica, Grandfather trusts him more than any of his blood relatives.
Steam (ST): According to Jessica, Grandfather trusted him more than any of his blood relatives.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to Jessica, Grandfather trusted him more than any of his blood relatives.
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香に言わせると、祖父さまはどんな肉親たちよりも信頼しているという。
Russian (RU): По словам Джессики, дедушка доверял ему гораздо больше, чем кому‐либо из своих близких родственников.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com a Jessica, o vovô confia mais nele do que em qualquer um de seus parentes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 用朱志香的話來說，爺爺信任他甚於信任其他任何血親。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 用朱志香的话来说，爷爷信任他甚于信任其他任何血亲。
Indonesian (IDN): Menurut Jessica, Kakek mempercayainya lebih dari siapa pun dari kerabat darahnya.
Italian (IT): Ascoltando quello che diceva Jessica, il nonno si fidava più di lui che dei suoi stessi consanguinei.
Turkish (TR): Jessica'ya göre, Büyükbabam ona diğer akrabalarından daha çok güveniyormuş.

Umineko Project (UP): But I wonder how long he's served.{n}I've never asked for details, but I think I heard he's been here since the beginning, when this mansion was constructed.
Steam (ST): But I wonder how long he's served. I never got the details, but I heard something about him being here since the very beginning, when this mansion was first constructed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But I wonder how long he's served. I've never heard the details, but I'm pretty sure he's been here since the beginning, when this mansion was constructed.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし勤めてどのくらいになるんだろう。詳しく聞いたことはないが、この屋敷が建てられた当初からいる、みたいな話を聞いたこともある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし勤めてどのくらいになるんだろう。{n}詳しく聞いたことはないが、この屋敷が建てられた当初からいる、みたいな話を聞いたこともある。
Russian (RU): Но мне интересно, сколько времени он уже служит.{n}Мне так и не довелось узнать подробности, но я уверен, что он был здесь с самого начала, когда только был построен этот особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas eu me pergunto há quanto tempo ele vem servindo o vovô.{n}Eu nunca perguntei os detalhes, mas acho que já ouvi falarem que foi desde o início, quando a mansão foi construída.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過他究竟幹了有多久了呢。{n}具體的倒是沒問過，不過卻有聽聞，好像這房子建成時他就在這裡了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过他究竟干了有多久了呢。{n}具体的倒是没问过，不过却有听闻，好像这房子建成时他就在这里了。
Indonesian (IDN): Tapi sudah berapa lama dia melayani.{n}Aku tidak pernah meminta detail, tapi kurasa aku dengar dia sudah di sini sejak awal, ketika rumah besar ini dibangun.
Italian (IT): Però mi chiedevo da quanto tempo lavorasse qui... Non conoscevo i dettagli, ma ho sentito storie su come lui fosse qui sin dall'inizio, durante la costruzione della villa...
Turkish (TR): Ama ne kadar süredir hizmet ettiğini merak ediyorum.{n}Ayrıntıları hiç sormadım ama sanırım en başından beri, bu malikane inşa edildiğinden beri burada olduğunu duydum.

Umineko Project (UP): ...That is to say, he's dedicated half of his life to serving here. ...No wonder Grandfather trusts him.
Steam (ST): ...Which would mean that he's dedicated half of his life to serving here. ...It's easy to see why he's so trusted.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...That is to say, he had dedicated half of his life to serving here. ...In other words, he's both trustworthy and faithful.
PC Japanese (JP): …ということは、半生を奉公に捧げてるってことになる。…そりゃあ、信頼も厚いわけだぜ。
Russian (RU): ...То есть, фактически половину жизни он провёл здесь на службе. ...Не удивительно, что дедушка так ему доверяет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Visto isso, ele dedicou metade de sua vida apenas servindo aqui. ...Por isso o vovô confia tanto nele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如此算來，他也為爺爺服務了有半輩子了。…也難怪他那麼受爺爺的信任啊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如此算来，他也为爷爷服务了有半辈子了。…也难怪他那么受爷爷的信任啊。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Artinya, dia mendedikasikan separuh hidupnya untuk melayani di sini. ...Tidak heran Kakek mempercayainya.
Italian (IT): Ciò vorrebbe dire che ha offerto i suoi servigi per metà della sua vita... In altre parole, è sia affidabile che fedele.
Turkish (TR): ...Yani hayatının yarısını burada hizmet etmeye adamış. ...Büyükbabamın ona güvenmesine şaşmamalı.

Umineko Project (UP): As we cut through the open‐ceilinged hall behind Genji‐san,
Steam (ST): As we passed through a massive hall that extended up into the second story of the mansion with no separating floor...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As we cut through the open-ceilinged hall behind Genji-san,
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂に向かうため、源次さんの先導で吹き抜けのホールを通り抜ける時。
Russian (RU): Вслед за Генджи‐саном мы вступили в просторный коридор.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): À medida que passamos pela sala com o pé direito mais alto, atrás do Genji‐san,
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 跟著源次穿過挑空的門廳走向餐廳的時候。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 跟着源次穿过挑空的门厅走向餐厅的时候。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat kami melewati aula berlantai terbuka di belakang Genji-san,
Italian (IT): Con la guida di Genji-san, mentre proseguivamo lungo il corridoio dell'atrio, verso la sala da pranzo...
Turkish (TR): Genji-san'ın arkasından açık tavanlı salondan geçerken,

Umineko Project (UP): ......I found something I had no memory of from six years ago.
Steam (ST): ...I spotted something that hadn't existed in my memory of six years ago.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……俺は６年前の記憶にないものを見つける。
Russian (RU): ......И тут я сразу приметил одну вещь, воспоминаний о которой не было в моей памяти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......eu me deparei com algo que não fazia parte das minhas memórias de seis anos atrás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我看到了六年前記憶中沒有的東西。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我看到了六年前记忆中没有的东西。
Indonesian (IDN): ......aku menemukan sesuatu yang tidak kuingat dari enam tahun lalu.
Italian (IT): Notai qualcosa che non ricordavo ci fosse sei anni fa.
Turkish (TR): ......Altı yıl öncesine ait hiç hatırlamadığım bir şey buldum.

Umineko Project (UP): It was an awfully big portrait hung right in front of the stairs that rose to the second floor.
Steam (ST): It was an awfully big portrait hanging right in front of the stairs that rose to the second floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was an awfully big portrait hung right in front of the stairs that rose to the second floor.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、２階に上がる階段の真正面に飾られた、とても大きな肖像画だった。
Russian (RU): Это был довольно большой портрет, повешенный прямо напротив лестницы, ведущей на второй этаж.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um retrato extremamente grande, pendurado em frente às escadas que davam para o segundo piso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是裝飾在上二樓台階正前方的一幅，非常大的肖像畫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是装饰在上二楼台阶正前方的一幅，非常大的肖像画。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu adalah potret sangat besar yang digantung tepat di depan tangga yang naik ke lantai dua.
Italian (IT): Era un gigantesco ritratto, esposto esattamente di fronte alle scale che portavano al primo piano.
Turkish (TR): Bu, ikinci kata çıkan merdivenlerin hemen önünde asılı duran çok büyük bir portreydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Without thinking, I stopped walking, under its spell...{n}Since I'd suddenly stopped, Maria, who was following behind me, ran into my back.
Steam (ST): Without thinking, I stopped walking, captivated by it... Since I'd stopped so fast, Maria, who was following behind me, ran into my back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Without thinking, I stopped walking, under its spell... Since I'd suddenly stopped, Maria, who was following behind me, ran into my back.
PC Japanese (JP): その迫力に、思わず足を止めてしまう…。急に俺が立ち止まったので、後に続く真里亞が俺の背中に激突する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その迫力に、思わず足を止めてしまう…。{n}急に俺が立ち止まったので、後に続く真里亞が俺の背中に激突する。
Russian (RU): Ни о чём не думая, я остановился, словно околдованный...{n}Стоило мне остановиться, Мария, которая шла за мной, тут же врезалась мне в спину.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sem pensar, eu parei de andar, sob seu feitiço...{n}Como eu parei de repente, a Maria, que estava vindo atrás de mim, esbarrou nas minhas costas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那股懾人的氣勢，讓我不由自主地停住了腳步…。{n}由於我突然停了下來，走在我身後的真里亞重重地撞到了我背上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那股慑人的气势，让我不由自主地停住了脚步…。{n}由于我突然停了下来，走在我身后的真里亚重重地撞到了我背上。
Indonesian (IDN): Tanpa berpikir, aku berhenti berjalan, terpesona...{n}Karena tiba-tiba berhenti, Maria, yang mengikutiku dari belakang, menabrak punggungku.
Italian (IT): Dinanzi a tale fascino, mi bloccai senza rendermene conto... Siccome mi ero fermato di colpo, Maria, che era dietro di me, urtò contro la mia schiena.
Turkish (TR): Hiç düşünmeden, onun büyüsüne kapılarak yürümeyi bıraktım...{n}Aniden durduğum için arkamdan gelen Maria sırtıma çarptı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Uu?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うー？」
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Indonesian (IDN): [=UP]
Italian (IT): "Uuh?"
Turkish (TR): [=UP]

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......Aah, sorry. ...Hey, Jessica. Did that picture use to be there?"
Steam (ST): "......Aah, sorry. ...Hey, Jessica. Has that picture always been there?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Aah, sorry. ...Hey, Jessica. Did that picture used to be there?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……あぁ悪ぃ。…なぁ朱志香ぁ。あんな絵、前はあったっけ？」
Russian (RU): "......Ах, извини. ...Слышь, Джессика. А разве эта картина там раньше висела?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Aah, desculpa. ...Ei, Jessica. Esse quadro costumava ficar aqui?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊抱歉………我說啊朱志香。這幅畫以前就有嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊抱歉………我说啊朱志香。这幅画以前就有吗？」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Aah, maaf. ...Hei, Jessica. Apakah gambar itu dulu ada di sana?"
Italian (IT): "...Ah, scusa... Ehi, Jessica. C'era già quel quadro?"
Turkish (TR): "......Aah, pardon. ...Hey, Jessica. Bu resim eskiden burada mıydı?"

Umineko Project (UP): I pointed at the large and conspicuous portrait hanging in the hall.{n}Everyone else stopped too.
Steam (ST): I pointed at the big, prominently-displayed portrait in the hall. Everyone else stopped too.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I pointed at the big portrait that caught the eye, hanging in the hall. Everyone else stopped too.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はホールに掲げられた目立つ大きな肖像画を指差す。みんなも足を止めた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 俺はホールに掲げられた目立つ大きな肖像画を指差す。{n}みんなも足を止めた。
Russian (RU): Я указал на крупный портрет, который попался мне на глаза, будучи повешенным в коридоре.{n}Все остальные тоже остановились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu apontei para o grande e notável retrato que estava pendurado no hall.{n}Todos pararam também.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我指著掛在門廳中那幅大得顯眼的肖像畫。{n}大家都停住了腳步。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我指着挂在门厅中那幅大得显眼的肖像画。{n}大家都停住了脚步。
Indonesian (IDN): Aku menunjuk potret besar dan mencolok yang tergantung di aula.{n}Yang lain juga berhenti.
Italian (IT): Indicai il grande ritratto affisso nel corridorio, che saltava all'occhio. Anche gli altri si fermarono.
Turkish (TR): Koridorda asılı duran büyük ve dikkat çekici portreyi işaret ettim.{n}Diğer herkes de durdu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...Ahh...right. When you last came here, that hadn't been hung yet, had it? When was it again..."
Steam (ST): "...Oh, ...right. When you last came here, that hadn't been hung yet, had it? When was it again..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Aah, ...Right. When you last came here, that hadn't been hung yet, had it? When was it again..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…あぁ、…そっか。戦人が来てた頃にはアレは掛けられてなかったっけ。いつからだったかな…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…あぁ、…そっか。戦人が来てた頃にはアレは掛けられてなかったっけ。いつからだったかな…」
Russian (RU): "...А‐ах... верно. Когда ты был здесь в последний раз, его ещё не было. Когда же это было..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Ahh...é mesmo. Quando você veio aqui pela última vez, isso ainda não havia sido pendurado, certo? Quando foi mesmo...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…啊，…對了。戰人以前來的時候還沒掛在那兒。是什麼時候來著…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…啊，…对了。战人以前来的时候还没挂在那儿。是什么时候来着…」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Ahh...benar. Terakhir kali kamu ke sini, itu belum digantung, kan? Kapan ya..."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "............You are correct. In April of the year before last, the Master had this painting put on display, which he had instructed an artist to paint for him some time prior."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............You are correct. In April of the year before last, as it had been arranged, the Master ordered an artist to paint it and it was put on display over there."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………左様でございます。一昨年の４月に、お館様が兼ねてより画家に命じて描かせていたものをあそこに展示なされたのでございます。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………左様でございます。一昨年の４月に、お館様が兼ねてより画家に命じて描かせていたものをあそこに展示なされたのでございます」
Russian (RU): "............Вы совершенно правы. В апреле позапрошлого года, по предварительной договорённости, господин заказал художнику написать эту картину и затем её вывесили в этом месте."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Correto. Foi em abril do ano retrasado, o Mestre providenciou e instruiu um artista para pintá‐la e expô‐la aqui, há algum tempo atrás."

Italian (IT): "...È proprio come dice lei. Nell'aprile di due anni fa, il padrone lo fece mettere qui in mostra, dopo aver ordinato ad un pittore di dipingerlo."
Turkish (TR): "............Haklısınız. Geçen yılın Nisan ayında Efendi, bir süre önce bir ressama kendisi için resmetmesi talimatını verdiği bu tabloyu astırdı."

Steam (ST): "Grandfather did that? So, he paid to have it painted just for him, huh...?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あの祖父さまがねぇ。わざわざ描かせてか…」

Umineko Project (UP): The portrait depicted a woman in an elegant dress, who gave off a sense of refinement, and who seemed to suit the Western style of this mansion.
Steam (ST): The portrait suited this Western mansion, and that woman in the elegant dress gave off a sense of refinement.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The portrait was appropriate for this western style mansion, and that woman wearing an elegant dress gave off a sense of refinement.
PC Japanese (JP): 肖像画には、この洋風屋敷に相応しい、優雅なドレスを着た気品を感じさせる女性が描かれていた。
Russian (RU): Портрет весьма соответствовал этому особняку в западном стиле, а эта женщина в элегантном платье выглядела весьма изысканно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O retrato de uma mulher, em um elegante vestido, que exalava uma sensação de refinamento, e que parecia combinar harmonicamente com o estilo ocidental da mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 肖像畫中畫著一位與這洋風建築相稱的，身著優雅禮服，氣質不凡的女性。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 肖像画中画着一位与这洋风建筑相称的，身着优雅礼服，气质不凡的女性。
Indonesian (IDN): Potret itu menggambarkan seorang wanita dalam gaun elegan, yang memberikan kesan kecanggihan, dan yang tampaknya cocok dengan gaya Barat rumah besar ini.
Italian (IT): Il ritratto si addiceva allo stile occidentale della villa, e la donna raffigurata indossava un abito elegante che trasmetteva un senso di nobiltà...
Turkish (TR): Portrede, zarif bir elbise giymiş, incelik hissi veren ve bu malikanenin Batılı tarzına uygun görünen bir kadın resmedilmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): .........I couldn't have guessed her age, but the sharpness and obvious strength of will in her eyes gave me the impression of youth.
Steam (ST): ......I couldn't have guessed her age, but her sharp eyes and the strong will she seemed to possess made her look youthful.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........I couldn't have guessed her age, but judging by her obvious strength of will and the sharpness in her eyes, she radiated youth.
PC Japanese (JP): ………歳はわからないが、目つきにやや鋭さと意志の強さを感じさせるため、若そうな印象を受けた。
Russian (RU): .........Я не мог точно определить её возраст, но благодаря силе воли, читавшейся в её взгляде, и остроте этого взгляда, она излучала молодость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Não havia como adivinhar sua idade, mas a nitidez e a força do traço em seu olhar passavam a impressão de juventude.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………雖不知她的年齡，但那銳利的眼神中流露出了些許強韌的意志，因而感覺她挺年輕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………虽不知她的年龄，但那锐利的眼神中流露出了些许强韧的意志，因而感觉她挺年轻。
Indonesian (IDN): .........Aku tidak bisa menebak usianya, tapi ketajaman dan kekuatan kemauan yang jelas di matanya memberiku kesan kemudaan.
Italian (IT): Non avrei saputo dire quanti anni avesse, ma mi dava l'impressione di essere una persona giovane, poiché il suo sguardo comunicava un certo acume e forza di volontà.
Turkish (TR): .........Yaşını tahmin edemedim ama gözlerindeki keskinlik ve bariz irade gücü bana genç olduğu izlenimini verdi.

Umineko Project (UP): It was a different feeling than the composed mood of middle‐aged women that are often in famous pictures.
Steam (ST): She seemed somehow different from the composed, middle-aged women you often see in famous pictures.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a different feeling than the composed mood of middle-aged women that are often in famous pictures.
PC Japanese (JP): よく名画にあるような中年女性の余裕ある雰囲気とは違う気がする。
Russian (RU): В женщине, изображённой на портрете, чувствовалось нечто иное, отличное от спокойной собранности женщин средних лет, которых часто изображали на знаменитых картинах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Passava um sentimento diferente das pinturas com mulheres de meia‐idade, que podem ser vistas em pinturas famosas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與名畫中經常出現的那種，中年女性給人的從容不迫的氣氛不太一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与名画中经常出现的那种，中年女性给人的从容不迫的气氛不太一样。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu perasaan yang berbeda dari suasana tenang wanita paruh baya yang sering ada dalam gambar terkenal.
Italian (IT): Era una sensazione diversa da quella della compostezza delle donne di mezz'età, che appaiono spesso nei quadri famosi.
Turkish (TR): Bu, ünlü resimlerde sıkça görülen orta yaşlı kadınların sakin ruh halinden farklı bir duyguydu.

Umineko Project (UP): If this woman had normal black hair, I might have thought it was a portrait of my long‐deceased grandmother in her prime.
Steam (ST): If she'd had normal black hair, I might've assumed it was a portrait of my long-deceased Grandmother in her prime.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If this woman had normal black hair, I might have thought it was a portrait of my long-deceased Grandmother in her prime.
PC Japanese (JP): この女性が普通に黒い髪だったなら、すでに亡くなって久しい祖母さまの若き日の肖像画かもしれないと思っただろう。
Russian (RU): Будь у этой женщины нормальные тёмные волосы, я бы, возможно, подумал, что это портрет моей давно почившей бабушки в самом расцвете лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se essa mulher tivesse cabelos pretos, eu teria pensado que era o retrato da minha já falecida avó em seu auge.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這位女性要是留有一頭普通的黑髮，我多半會以為，這是去世已久的奶奶年輕時的肖像畫吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这位女性要是留有一头普通的黑发，我多半会以为，这是去世已久的奶奶年轻时的肖像画吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Jika wanita ini memiliki rambut hitam normal, aku mungkin mengira itu potret almarhum nenekku di masa jayanya.
Italian (IT): Se questa donna avesse avuto dei normali capelli neri, avrei pensato che fosse un ritratto della mia ormai defunta nonna nel fiore dei suoi anni.
Turkish (TR): Eğer bu kadının normal siyah saçları olsaydı, bunun uzun zaman önce ölmüş olan büyükannemin en güzel zamanlarındaki bir portresi olduğunu düşünebilirdim.

Umineko Project (UP): However, the woman in the portrait had beautiful golden hair, and didn't look Japanese at all.
Steam (ST): However, she had beautiful blonde hair and didn't look Japanese at all.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the woman in the portrait had beautiful blonde hair and didn't look Japanese at all.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、肖像画の女性は美しい黄金の髪で、日本人的でない容姿を感じさせた。
Russian (RU): Однако женщина на портрете имела красивые светлые волосы и вообще была не похожа на японку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, a mulher no retrato tinha um lindo cabelo dourado, e não parecia nem um pouco japonesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，肖像畫中的女性卻留著一頭美麗的金髮，容貌也不像是日本人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，肖像画中的女性却留着一头美丽的金发，容貌也不像是日本人。
Indonesian (IDN): Namun, wanita dalam potret itu memiliki rambut emas yang indah, dan tidak terlihat seperti orang Jepang sama sekali.
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, la donna nel ritratto aveva dei bellissimi capelli biondi, e il suo aspetto non sembrava quello di una ragazza giapponese.
Turkish (TR): Ancak portredeki kadının güzel altın sarısı saçları vardı ve hiç de Japon gibi görünmüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): So, only a harbor and the site around the mansion were set up to be lived in; beyond that, the island remained as untouched as it was when it was still uninhabited.
Steam (ST): So, only the harbor and the area around the mansion were set up to be lived in. Beyond that, the island remained as untouched as when it was uninhabited.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, only a harbor and the site around the mansion were set up to be lived in. Beyond that, the island remained as untouched as it was when it was still uninhabited.
PC Japanese (JP): だから住めるよう整地されているのは、船着場と屋敷の周りの敷地だけで、後はこの島が無人島だった時代から手付かずのままになっている。
Russian (RU): Поэтому для проживания на острове были построены лишь гавань и особняк. В целом же, остров до сих пор остаётся нетронутым, как и в то время, когда он был необитаемым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, apenas o atracadouro e a área em volta da mansão são habitadas; fora isso, a ilha permanece intocada e inabitada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此為了生活方便而整地施工過的，只有碼頭和大屋周圍的一片地皮，後面的土地還是和最先無人島的時候一樣，沒有被人工干涉過。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此为了生活方便而整地施工过的，只有码头和大屋周围的一片地皮，后面的土地还是和最先无人岛的时候一样，没有被人工干涉过。
Indonesian (IDN): Jadi, hanya pelabuhan dan area sekitar rumah besar yang disiapkan untuk dihuni; di luarnya, pulau itu tetap tak tersentuh seperti saat masih tidak berpenghuni.
Italian (IT): Perciò, solo il porto e l'area attorno alla villa erano state costruite per essere agibili, e le zone restanti erano rimaste inviolate sin dai tempi in cui l'isola era disabitata.
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, sadece bir liman ve malikanenin etrafındaki alan yaşanacak şekilde elden geçirilmiştir; Bunun dışında, ada hala ıssız olduğu zamanlardaki gibi bırakılmıştır.

Umineko Project (UP): To understand just how dangerous a vast and empty forest with no lamplight, phones or people passing through it at all actually is, you need to shift your urban assumptions a little.
Steam (ST): The vast and empty forest had absolutely no lights, phones, or people passing through. To understand how dangerous that is, you need to forget your common sense as a city dweller.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The vast and empty forest had no lamplight, phones or people passing through at all. To understand how dangerous it is, you needed to throw off all your street smarts from the city.
PC Japanese (JP): 一切の明かりもなく電話もなく通行人もいない無人の広大な森が、どれほど危険なものかを理解するには、都会的な常識を少し外す必要がある。
Russian (RU): В огромном и пустом лесу нет освещения, телефона и совсем никаких людей. Чтобы понять, насколько это опасно, вам необходимо полностью перестать думать о городской жизни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para entender como uma floresta vasta e vazia, sem telefones, iluminação e pessoas transitando por ela, pode ser perigosa, você precisa esquecer aquilo que você sabe sobre as ruas de uma cidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是一大片沒有燈光、沒有電話，當然也沒有行人的廣袤森林。要理解這片森林的危險，必須先拋開一些城市裡的常識。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是一大片没有灯光、没有电话，当然也没有行人的广袤森林。要理解这片森林的危险，必须先抛开一些城市里的常识。
Indonesian (IDN): Untuk memahami betapa berbahayanya hutan luas dan kosong tanpa lampu, telepon atau orang yang lewat sama sekali, kamu perlu menggeser asumsi perkotaanmu sedikit.
Italian (IT): Per capire quanto fosse pericolosa la vasta foresta priva di ogni illuminazione, di telefoni o di passanti, bisogna distaccarsi da qualsiasi preconcetto della vita in città.
Turkish (TR): Işığın, telefonun ya da içinden geçen insanların olmadığı uçsuz bucaksız ve boş bir ormanın aslında ne kadar tehlikeli olduğunu anlamak için, kentsel varsayımlarınızı biraz değiştirmeniz gerekiyor.

Umineko Project (UP): You see, if by any chance you fell down a hole in the depths of the forest and sprained your ankle...cry or scream, no one would come save you.
Steam (ST): After all, if you happened to fall down a hole in the depths of the forest and sprain your ankle, no one would come save you, no matter how much you cried or screamed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Anyway, if by any chance you fell down a hole in the depths of the forest and sprained your ankle, you could cry or scream, but no one would come save you.
PC Japanese (JP): 何しろ、万が一、森の奥深くで穴にでも落ちて捻挫したら、泣こうが喚こうが誰も助けに来てくれないのだ。
Russian (RU): В любом случае, если бы глубоко в лесу вы свалились в яму и растянули лодыжку... хоть вы плачьте, хоть кричите, но никто не явится вам на помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por exemplo, se você cair em um buraco profundo no meio da floresta e torcer seu tornozelo...mesmo que você chore ou grite, ninguém vai vir te salvar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畢竟，要是一個不小心掉進森林深處的洞穴扭傷了腳，哪怕是大哭大叫也不會有人來救。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毕竟，要是一个不小心掉进森林深处的洞穴扭伤了脚，哪怕是大哭大叫也不会有人来救。
Indonesian (IDN): Begini, jika kamu jatuh ke lubang di kedalaman hutan dan keseleo...menangis atau berteriak, tidak akan ada yang datang menyelamatkanmu.
Italian (IT): Ad ogni modo, se per qualche caso fortuito cadeste in un fosso nel bel mezzo della foresta, e subiste qualche infortunio, per quanto possiate piangere od urlare, nessuno verrebbe a salvarvi.
Turkish (TR): Eğer bir şans eseri ormanın derinliklerindeki bir çukura düşüp bileğinizi burkarsanız...ister ağlayın isterseniz çığlık atın, kimse sizi kurtarmaya gelmez.

Umineko Project (UP): If it then got dark, the forest, where there are no streetlights, would become enshrouded in complete darkness.
Steam (ST): Then, once the sun went down, the forest would be wrapped in complete darkness, since there were no streetlights.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If it got dark, the forest, where there were no streetlights, was wrapped up in complete darkness.
PC Japanese (JP): そのまま暗くなれば電柱の一本もない森は真の暗黒に包まれる。
Russian (RU): Когда стемнеет, в лесу, где нет уличного освещения, всё погрузится в кромешную тьму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em seguida, ao escurecer, a floresta, que não possui iluminação pública, ficaria envolta pela escuridão completa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當天色變暗後，半盞路燈也沒有的森林就會被黑暗完全吞沒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当天色变暗后，半盏路灯也没有的森林就会被黑暗完全吞没。
Indonesian (IDN): Jika kemudian gelap, hutan, di mana tidak ada lampu jalan, akan diselimuti kegelapan total.
Italian (IT): Allo stato attuale, se si facesse buio, la foresta verrebbe avvolta dalla più totale oscurità, non essendoci pali della luce.
Turkish (TR): Eğer hava kararırsa, sokak lambalarının olmadığı orman tamamen karanlığa gömülür.

Umineko Project (UP): Also, since there obviously aren't any guideposts here, it's easy to get lost and lose your sense of direction in the dark forest.
Steam (ST): And, since there were no signs, it'd be easy to get lost and confused, losing your sense of direction inside that dark forest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And also, since it didn't have any guideposts, it would be easy to get confused and lost, losing your sense of direction inside the dark forest.
PC Japanese (JP): また、道標があるわけでもないから迷いやすく、暗い森の中は方向感覚も見失いやすいのだ。
Russian (RU): И ещё, поскольку там отсутствуют всякие указатели, то заблудиться и потеряться, лишившись способности ориентироваться в тёмном лесу, становится проще простого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além disso, como obviamente não tem nenhuma placa, é muito fácil você perder o senso de direção e se perder.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再加上森林中沒有路標因此很容易迷路，夜幕時的森林那更是會讓人迷失方向感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再加上森林中没有路标因此很容易迷路，夜幕时的森林那更是会让人迷失方向感。
Indonesian (IDN): Juga, karena jelas tidak ada rambu penunjuk di sini, mudah tersesat dan kehilangan arah di hutan gelap.
Italian (IT): E inoltre, dato che non vi sono cartelli all'interno della selva oscura, sarebbe facile perdersi e smarrire il senso dell'orientamento.
Turkish (TR): Ayrıca, burada herhangi bir yol tabelası da olmadığı için, karanlık ormanda kaybolmak ve yön duyunuzu kaybetmek kolaydır.

Umineko Project (UP): Nowadays, most people see a forest as a peaceful place, but to the people of bygone eras, before the light of civilization drove out the night, forests were like oceans on land, geographically separating one culture from another.
Steam (ST): Nowadays, most people see a forest as a peaceful place, but to the people of bygone eras, before the light of civilization drove out the night, forests were as geographically separated from civilization as the sea.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nowadays, most people see a forest as a peaceful place, but to the people of the bygone eras, before the light of civilization drove out the night, forests were as geographically separated from civilization as the ocean. Like an ocean above the ground.
PC Japanese (JP): 現在でこそ、森というと憩いのイメージを感じるが、文明の光が夜を駆逐するまでの前時代の人類にとって、森は海同様に文化を地理的に隔離する、地上の海同然だったのである。
Russian (RU): В настоящее время большинство людей рассматривает лес как мирное место, но для людей ушедших эпох, до того как свет цивилизации вытеснил ночь, леса были географически изолированными от цивилизации, как и океан. Совсем как океан, но только над землёй.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nos dias de hoje, a maioria das pessoas veem a floresta como um lugar tranquilo, mas para as pessoas de eras passadas, antes que as luzes da civilização iluminassem a noite, florestas eram como oceanos de terra, geograficamente separando uma cultura da outra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 到了現代，森林才變得給人一種是休閑去處的印象。在文明之光驅散黑夜的時代來臨以前，對人類而言，森林就好比陸地上的海洋，地理性地隔絕了文化的交流。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 到了现代，森林才变得给人一种是休闲去处的印象。在文明之光驱散黑夜的时代来临以前，对人类而言，森林就好比陆地上的海洋，地理性地隔绝了文化的交流。
Indonesian (IDN): Sekarang, kebanyakan orang melihat hutan sebagai tempat yang damai, tapi bagi orang-orang zaman dulu, sebelum cahaya peradaban mengusir malam, hutan seperti lautan di darat, secara geografis memisahkan satu budaya dari yang lain.
Italian (IT): Al giorno d'oggi si ha un'immagine della foresta come un luogo tranquillo, ma per i popoli delle civiltà antiche, prima che la luce della civiltà dissipasse la notte, le foreste erano praticamente dei mari in superficie che isolavano geograficamente le civiltà, esattamente come faceva l'oceano.
Turkish (TR): Günümüzde çoğu insan ormanı huzurlu bir yer olarak görmektedir, ama geçmiş çağların insanları için, uygarlığın ışığı geceyi kovmadan önce, ormanlar karadaki okyanuslar gibiydi ve coğrafi olarak bir kültürü diğerinden ayırıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Just as fishermen who go out into the ocean occasionally have their lives put in danger despite their technical knowledge...
Steam (ST): They were oceans above the ground.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just like how fishermen who go out into the ocean are threatened despite their technical knowledge...
PC Japanese (JP): 海に出る漁師たちが、専門的な知識を有してなお命を脅かされることもあるように。
Russian (RU): Точно так же, как и рыбаки, выходящие в океан и подвергающиеся риску, несмотря на накопленный багаж технических знаний...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim como um pescador, que vai para o mar, ocasionalmente expondo a sua vida ao perigo, mesmo tendo o conhecimento técnico...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像出海的漁夫，即使有專業的知識也還會冒有生命危險一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像出海的渔夫，即使有专业的知识也还会冒有生命危险一样。
Indonesian (IDN): Sama seperti nelayan yang pergi ke laut terkadang mempertaruhkan nyawa mereka meski memiliki pengetahuan teknis...
Italian (IT): I pescatori che uscivano in mare mettevano a rischio le loro vite, nonostante le loro conoscenze specifiche...
Turkish (TR): Tıpkı okyanusa açılan balıkçıların teknik bilgilerine rağmen zaman zaman hayatlarının tehlikeye girmesi gibi...

Umineko Project (UP): ...technical knowledge was also demanded of hunters who went out into the forest, and their lives were occasionally put in danger just the same.
Steam (ST): Fishermen who go out into the ocean are putting their lives at risk, despite their technical knowledge... In the same way, hunters who go out to the forest are in danger, despite having specialized knowledge of their own.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hunters who go out to the forest have technical knowledge as well, yet are also in danger.
PC Japanese (JP): 森に出る猟師たちにも専門的な知識が求められ、同じく命を脅かされることもあったのだ。
Russian (RU): ... охотники, отправляющиеся в лес, также имеют необходимые технические знания, и даже это не спасает их от опасности.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...conhecimento técnico também é necessário para caçadores que adentram a floresta e, ocasionalmente, eles também colocam a sua vida em risco.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 進入森林打獵的獵人也同樣需要具備專業的知識，同樣冒有生命危險。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 进入森林打猎的猎人也同样需要具备专业的知识，同样冒有生命危险。
Indonesian (IDN): ...pengetahuan teknis juga dituntut dari pemburu yang pergi ke hutan, dan nyawa mereka terkadang dipertaruhkan dengan cara yang sama.
Italian (IT): Anche i cacciatori che si addentravano nella foresta necessitavano di conoscenze specifiche, e mettevano a rischio le loro vite nello stesso modo...
Turkish (TR): ...ormana çıkan avcılardan da teknik bilgi talep edilirdi, ve hayatları zaman zaman aynı şekilde tehlikeye giriyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...If a child were to go play in that dangerous forest, something terrible might happen.
Steam (ST): ...If children were to go play in such a dangerous forest, something terrible might happen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If children go play in that dangerous forest, something terrible might happen.
PC Japanese (JP): …そんな危険な森に、子供が遊びに行ったら大変なことになるかもしれない。
Russian (RU): ...Случись детям играть в том опасном лесу, то с ними вполне может приключиться что‐нибудь ужасное.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se uma criança for brincar em uma floresta perigosa, algo muito ruim pode acontecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …小孩要是去了如此危險的森林裡玩，搞不好就會出大事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …小孩要是去了如此危险的森林里玩，搞不好就会出大事。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Jika seorang anak pergi bermain di hutan berbahaya itu, sesuatu yang mengerikan mungkin terjadi.
Italian (IT): ‘Se dei bambini andassero a giocare in una foresta così pericolosa, potrebbe succedere qualcosa di terribile’.
Turkish (TR): ...Eğer bir çocuk o tehlikeli ormanda oynamaya giderse, korkunç bir şey olabilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): Some parent must have had that thought. ...Maybe my Grandmother, or possibly, the man himself, my grandfather might have said it.
Steam (ST): Someone's parents must have thought so. ...Maybe Grandmother first said it, or maybe it was Grandfather himself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Someone's parents must have thought so. ...Maybe my Grandmother, or possibly anybody else other than Grandfather might have said that.
PC Japanese (JP): そう思った親の誰か。…祖母さまか、あるいは他でもない、祖父さまが言い出したのかもしれない。
Russian (RU): Возможно, чьи‐нибудь родители так и думали. ...Быть может, моя бабушка или, может быть, ещё кто‐нибудь, кроме дедушки, говорил об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Alguns pais pensariam isso. ...Talvez minha avó, ou, possivelmente, o meu avô, tenha dito algo assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也許這傳言，就是從某位如此認為的長輩那裡開始傳起的。…或許是奶奶吧，甚至也有可能是爺爺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也许这传言，就是从某位如此认为的长辈那里开始传起的。…或许是奶奶吧，甚至也有可能是爷爷。
Indonesian (IDN): Beberapa orang tua pasti memikirkan itu. ...Mungkin Nenekku, atau mungkin, pria itu sendiri, kakekku mungkin mengatakannya.
Italian (IT): Qualcuno dei nostri genitori doveva aver pensato questo... Forse a suggerirlo è stata mia nonna, o forse è stato il nonno in persona.
Turkish (TR): Bazı ebeveynler bunu düşünmüş olmalı. ...Belki büyükannem, belki de bizzat kendisi, Büyükbabam söylemiş olabilir.

Umineko Project (UP): Or maybe it was a story handed down on this island from long, long ago.
Steam (ST): Or perhaps the story's been passed down on this island since ancient times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Or maybe it's been handed down in this island from long, long ago.
PC Japanese (JP): さもなくば、はるか大昔からこの島に語り継がれているのか。
Russian (RU): Или возможно на этом острове есть старинная легенда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou talvez seja uma história proferida nesta ilha há muito, muito tempo atrás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 抑或許從很久以前開始就是這麼流傳下來的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 抑或许从很久以前开始就是这么流传下来的。
Indonesian (IDN): Atau mungkin itu cerita yang diturunkan di pulau ini dari zaman dahulu kala.
Italian (IT): Oppure la storia è stata tramandata in quest'isola sin da tempi più remoti...
Turkish (TR): Ya da belki de bu adada uzun, çok uzun zaman önce anlatılan bir hikayeydi.

Umineko Project (UP): {i:.........There's a terrible witch in the forest, so you must not go in.}
Steam (ST): .........There's a terrible witch in the forest, so you must not go in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........There's a terrible witch in the forest, so you must not go in.
PC Japanese (JP): ………森には恐ろしい魔女がいるから立ち入ってはならない。
Russian (RU): {i:.........В лесу живёт страшная ведьма, поэтому туда запрещено ходить.}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {i:.........Existe uma terrível bruxa na floresta, por isso você não deve ir lá.}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): “………森林裡住著可怕的魔女，所以不能靠近。”
Chinese Simplified (CN): “………森林里住着可怕的魔女，所以不能靠近。”
Indonesian (IDN): {i:.........Ada penyihir mengerikan di hutan, jadi kamu tidak boleh masuk.}
Italian (IT): {i:Nella foresta viveva una strega spaventosa, perciò era proibito accedervi.}
Turkish (TR): {i:.........Ormanda korkunç bir cadı var, bu yüzden ormana girmemelisin.}

Umineko Project (UP): Thus, Rokkenjima's ghost story was born.{n}That is the legend of the witch of Rokkenjima.
Steam (ST): At some point, this ghost story of Rokkenjima was born. This is the legend of Rokkenjima's witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thus, Rokkenjima's ghost story was born. That is the legend of the witch of Rokkenjima.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな六軒島の怪談が生まれたのである。それが、六軒島の魔女伝説である。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そんな六軒島の怪談が生まれたのである。{n}それが、六軒島の魔女伝説である。
Russian (RU): Таким образом и возникла история о призраке Роккенджимы.{n}Та самая легенда о ведьме Роккенджимы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim nasceu a história do fantasma de Rokkenjima.{n}A lenda da bruxa de Rokkenjima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是，便誕生了這樣的六軒島怪談。{n}而這，就是六軒島魔女傳說。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是，便诞生了这样的六轩岛怪谈。{n}而这，就是六轩岛魔女传说。
Indonesian (IDN): Demikianlah, cerita hantu Rokkenjima lahir.{n}Itulah legenda penyihir Rokkenjima.
Italian (IT): E così nacque la storia dell'orrore di Rokkenjima. Questa... era la leggenda della Strega di Rokkenjima.
Turkish (TR): Böylece Rokkenjima'nın hayalet hikayesi doğdu.{n}İşte Rokkenjima cadısının efsanesi budur.

Umineko Project (UP): So, when we say "witch" on this island, we're referring to the master of the vast and savage forest.
Steam (ST): That's why, when we talk about a witch on this island, we're referring to the master of that vast and savage forest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's why, if we say 'witch' in this island, we're referring to the master of the vast and savage forest.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、この島で魔女と言ったら、それは広大な未開の森の主を指す。
Russian (RU): Вот поэтому, когда мы говорим "ведьма" этого острова, мы говорим про хозяйку обширного и дикого леса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, quando nós falamos "bruxa" nesta ilha, nós nos referimos a governante desta vasta e selvagem floresta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，若說到這個島上的魔女，那就是指那片未被開發過的，廣袤森林地區的主人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，若说到这个岛上的魔女，那就是指那片未被开发过的，广袤森林地区的主人。
Indonesian (IDN): Jadi, ketika kami mengatakan "penyihir" di pulau ini, kami merujuk pada penguasa hutan luas dan liar.
Italian (IT): Perciò, quando si parlava di una ‘strega’ su quest'isola, si faceva riferimento alla sovrana della foresta vasta e selvaggia.
Turkish (TR): Yani, bu adada "cadı" dediğimizde, uçsuz bucaksız ve vahşi ormanın efendisinden bahsediyoruz.

Umineko Project (UP): Which reminds me, when I was little and stayed at this mansion, during the eerie nights where the wind and rain struck the windows, stories like "the witch of the forest is roaming around in search of a sacrifice" would scare the heck out of me...
Steam (ST): Come to think of it, when I stayed at this mansion as a little kid, during those eerie nights when the wind and rain pounded on the windows, I remember being terrified by a story of the forest witch, who roamed around searching for human sacrifices...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Which reminds me, when I was little and stayed at this mansion, during the eerie nights where the wind and rain struck the windows, I got terrified by a story that the witch of the forest was roaming around searching for a sacrifice...
PC Japanese (JP): そういえば小さかった頃、この屋敷に泊まり、風雨が窓を叩く不気味な夜には、森の魔女が生贄を求めて彷徨っているというような話にだいぶ怯えたもんさ…。
Russian (RU): Тут мне вспомнилось, что когда я ещё был ребёнком и оставался в этом особняке, в жуткие ночи, когда ветер на пару с дождём стучались в окна, на меня нагоняла страх история о ведьме из леса, бродящей вокруг в поисках жертвы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que me lembra que, quando eu era pequeno e dormia aqui, durante as noites misteriosas, quando o vento e a chuva batiam na janela, histórias como "a bruxa da floresta está perambulando por aí em busca de sacrifícios" me assustavam muito...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "...Riiight. Still, I completely forgot that the witch of that legend had an elegant name like {f:5:Beatrice}. ......Goddamn, don't tell me Grandfather went out of his way to have her depicted in this painting just because us grandchildren refused to believe him?"

PC Japanese (JP): 「…なるほどなぁ。しかし、あの魔女伝説の魔女に、ベアトリーチェなんてオシャレな名前が付いてたとは、とんと忘れてたぜ。……祖父さまめ、孫たちが信じないもんだから、わざわざ絵に描きやがったかぁ？」
Russian (RU): "...Точно. Однако я совсем забыл, что у ведьмы из легенды было такое изящное имя, как {f:5:Беатриче}. ......Поскольку мы, внуки, не очень верили дедушке, он прибегнул к оригинальному способу, запечатлев её образ на картине."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Entendo. Ainda assim, eu tinha esquecido completamente da lenda da bruxa que tem um nome tão elegante como {f:5:Beatrice}. ......Não me diga que o vovô fez isso só porque seus netos se recusavam a acreditar nele?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…原來如此。說起來，這魔女傳說裡的魔女居然是叫貝阿朵莉切這種時髦名字，我還真是全給忘了。……這臭爺爺，就因為孫子們不信，還專程找人去畫了一幅嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…原来如此。说起来，这魔女传说里的魔女居然是叫贝阿朵莉切这种时髦名字，我还真是全给忘了。……这臭爷爷，就因为孙子们不信，还专程找人去画了一幅吗？」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Benaaar. Tapi, aku benar-benar lupa bahwa penyihir legenda itu punya nama elegan seperti {f:5:Beatrice}. ......Sialan, jangan-jangan Kakek sengaja menyuruh orang menggambarkannya dalam lukisan ini hanya karena kami cucunya menolak mempercayainya?"
Italian (IT): "...Capisco. Però non ricordavo per niente che la strega di quella leggenda avesse un nome di classe come {f:5:Beatrice}... Il nonnetto si è preso la briga di far dipingere questo ritratto perché i suoi nipoti non credono in lei?"
