PC Japanese (JP): 船で来る途中、洋上の鎮守の社が落雷で失われたということを知った時に感じたある種の違和感と不吉さが少しだけ蘇る。
Russian (RU): То слабое, зудящее ощущение надвигающейся беды, которое я почувствовал, когда узнал, что храм Бога‐покровителя поразила молния, вновь слегка ожило во мне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele sentimento inquietante e sinistro que senti durante a viagem de barco, quando eu soube que o santuário havia sido destruído por um raio, foi revivido em mim por um instante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在乘船過來的途中，我聽聞了海上的鎮守之社被雷劈碎的消息。那時我所感到的某種不諧與不吉，此刻又有一絲甦醒了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在乘船过来的途中，我听闻了海上的镇守之社被雷劈碎的消息。那时我所感到的某种不谐与不吉，此刻又有一丝苏醒了。
Indonesian (IDN): Perasaan tidak menyenangkan yang mengerikan itu yang kurasakan di perjalanan kapal, ketika tahu kuilnya disambar petir, hidup lagi sedikit dalam diriku.
Italian (IT): Rivivetti quella sensazione di sconforto che avevo provato mentre eravamo sul battello, quando seppimo che l'altare per la divinità protettrice era andato perduto a causa di un fulmine.
Turkish (TR): Tekne gezisinde, tapınağa yıldırım düştüğünü öğrendiğimde hissettiğim o tedirgin edici uğursuz duygu içimde biraz canlandı.

Umineko Project (UP): At that time, Kumasawa‐san had tried to tell an ominous story about Rokkenjima and had been stopped by Jessica.
Steam (ST): And I remembered that Kumasawa-san tried to tell an ominous story about Rokkenjima...before Jessica stopped her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, Kumasawa-san had tried to tell an ominous story about Rokkenjima and had been stopped by Jessica.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてあの時、熊沢さんは六軒島について何か不吉な話をしようとして、それを朱志香に止められたことも。
Russian (RU): В тот раз Кумасава‐сан попыталась рассказать зловещую историю о Роккенджиме и была остановлена Джессикой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela hora, a Kumasawa‐san estava tentando contar alguma história sinistra sobre Rokkenjima e foi impedida pela Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 同樣甦醒了的，還有那時熊澤婆婆正想就六軒島講些什麼不吉的話題，卻被朱志香制止了的那段記憶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 同样苏醒了的，还有那时熊泽婆婆正想就六轩岛讲些什么不吉的话题，却被朱志香制止了的那段记忆。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat itu, Kumasawa-san mencoba menceritakan kisah mengerikan tentang Rokkenjima dan dihentikan Jessica.
Italian (IT): In quel momento, Kumasawa-san cercò di raccontare una storia inquietante su Rokkenjima, ed era stata fermata da Jessica...
Turkish (TR): O sırada Kumasawa-san Rokkenjima hakkında uğursuz bir hikaye anlatmaya çalışmış ve Jessica tarafından sözü kesilmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): .........I didn't know what she had tried to tell us about this island.
Steam (ST): ...I don't know what she was planning to tell us about this island.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………この島の何を話そうとしたのかはわからない。
Russian (RU): .........Я так и не узнал, что она попыталась поведать нам об этом острове.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Eu não sei o que ela estava tentando dizer sobre a ilha naquela hora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我不知道她究竟想說這個島的什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我不知道她究竟想说这个岛的什么。
Indonesian (IDN): .........Aku tidak tahu apa yang dia coba ceritakan tentang pulau ini.
Italian (IT): Non sapevo cosa stesse per raccontarci riguardo quest'isola.
Turkish (TR): .........Bu ada hakkında bize ne anlatmaya çalıştığını bilmiyordum.

Umineko Project (UP): But, there was one thing I did know.{n}...Rokkenjima's ruler was not the Ushiromiya family.
Steam (ST): But I do know one thing. ...It isn't the Ushiromiya family that rules Rokkenjima.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But, there was one thing I did know....Rokkenjima's ruler was not the Ushiromiya family.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、ひとつわかることがある。…六軒島の支配者は、右代宮家じゃない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): でも、ひとつわかることがある。{n}…六軒島の支配者は、右代宮家じゃない。
Russian (RU): Но одну вещь я знал точно.{n}...Власть на Роккенджиме принадлежала не семье Уширомия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas agora tem uma coisa que eu sei.{n}...Aquele que governa Rokkenjima não é a família Ushiromiya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我唯一知道的是，{n}…六軒島的支配者，不是右代宮家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我唯一知道的是，{n}…六轩岛的支配者，不是右代宫家。
Indonesian (IDN): Tapi, ada satu hal yang aku tahu.{n}...Penguasa Rokkenjima bukan keluarga Ushiromiya.
Italian (IT): Ma c'era una cosa che sapevo... Non era la famiglia Ushiromiya a governare su Rokkenjima.
Turkish (TR): Ama bildiğim bir şey vardı.{n}...Rokkenjima'nın hükümdarı Ushiromiya ailesi değildi.

Umineko Project (UP): It was the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}Yes. ......Because this was the witch's island.
Steam (ST): It's the witch, {f:5:Beatrice}. That's right. ......After all, this is the witch's island.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the witch, Beatrice. Yes. ......Because this was the witch's island.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女、ベアトリーチェなんだ。そう。……ここは、魔女の島なのだから。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 魔女、ベアトリーチェなんだ。{n}そう。……ここは、魔女の島なのだから。
Russian (RU): Она принадлежала ведьме {f:5:Беатриче}.{n}Да. ......Потому что это был остров ведьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E sim a bruxa, {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}Sim. ......Porque esta é a ilha da bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而是魔女，貝阿朵莉切。{n}沒錯。……因為這裡，是屬於魔女的島。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而是魔女，贝阿朵莉切。{n}没错。……因为这里，是属于魔女的岛。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu adalah penyihir, {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}Ya. ......Karena ini adalah pulau penyihir.
Italian (IT): Ma la strega, {f:5:Beatrice}. Già. Perché questa... era l'isola della strega.
Turkish (TR): Cadı {f:5:Beatrice}'di.{n}Evet. ......Çünkü burası cadının adasıydı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "Battlerrr! Uu, slooww!"
Steam (ST): "Battler! Uu-, you're slooow!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Battler! Uu-, slo-ow!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「戦人ー！　うー、遅いー！」
Russian (RU): "Баттлер‐р‐р! У‐у, не тормози‐и!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Battlerrr! Uu, lentooo!"
Indonesian (IDN): "Battlerrr! Uu, lelet!"
Italian (IT): "Battler! Uuh, sei lentooo!!"
Turkish (TR): "Battlerrr! Uu, yavaşsıın!"

Umineko Project (UP): When I looked around, everyone was already heading towards the dining hall.{n}I hurriedly chased after them...
Steam (ST): When I looked around, everyone was already heading towards the dining room. I hurriedly chased after them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I looked around, everyone was already heading towards the dining room. I hurriedly chased after them...
PC Japanese (JP): 見ればみんなはもう食堂へ向かっていた。俺は慌ててその後を追うのだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 見ればみんなはもう食堂へ向かっていた。{n}俺は慌ててその後を追うのだった…。
Russian (RU): Когда я оглянулся, то увидел, что все уже направлялись в столовую.{n}Я быстро последовал за ними...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu olhei em volta, todos já haviam indo em direção à sala de jantar.{n}Eu me apressei para alcançá‐los...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 抬頭一看大家都已經走向了餐廳。{n}我慌忙跟在他們身後追了上去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 抬头一看大家都已经走向了餐厅。{n}我慌忙跟在他们身后追了上去…。
Indonesian (IDN): Ketika aku melihat sekeliling, semua orang sudah menuju ruang makan.{n}Aku buru-buru mengejar mereka...
Italian (IT): Vidi che tutti gli altri si stavano già dirigendo verso la sala da pranzo. Mi affrettai a seguirli subito dopo...
Turkish (TR): Etrafıma baktığımda herkes çoktan yemek salonuna doğru gidiyordu.{n}Aceleyle peşlerinden gittim...

Umineko Project (UP): We walked up to the huge double doors that led to the dining hall.
Steam (ST): We walked up to the huge double doors that led to the dining room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We walked up to the huge double doors that led to the dining room.
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂の大きな観音扉の前までやって来る。
Russian (RU): Мы подошли к огромным двойным дверям, ведущим в обеденный зал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós caminhamos até uma grande porta dupla, que dava para a sala de jantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 來到餐廳那扇碩大的雙開門前。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 来到餐厅那扇硕大的双开门前。
Indonesian (IDN): Kami berjalan ke pintu ganda besar yang menuju ruang makan.
Italian (IT): Camminammo fino all'enorme doppio portone che conduceva alla sala da pranzo.
Turkish (TR): Yemek salonuna açılan büyük çift kapıya doğru yürüdük.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐san knocked.
Steam (ST): Genji-san knocked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-san knocked.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次さんがノックする。
Russian (RU): Генджи‐сан постучал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Genji‐san bateu na porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次敲了敲門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次敲了敲门。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji-san mengetuk.
Italian (IT): Genji-san bussò.
Turkish (TR): Genji-san kapıyı çaldı.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "......I have brought the children. If you will excuse me..."
Steam (ST): "...I have brought the children. Please pardon the intrusion..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お子様方をお連れいたしました。失礼いたします…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お子様方をお連れいたしました。失礼いたします…」
Russian (RU): "......Я привёл детей. Теперь прошу меня извинить..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu trouxe as crianças. Com sua licença..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……少爺小姐們已經帶到。失禮了…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……少爷小姐们已经带到。失礼了…」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Aku sudah membawa anak-anak. Permisi..."
Italian (IT): "...Ho accompagnato i ragazzi. Vogliate scusarmi..."
Turkish (TR): "......Çocukları getirdim. İzninizle..."

Umineko Project (UP): The door was opened and we were invited inside.
Steam (ST): The doors were opened, and we were invited inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 扉が開けられ、中へ招かれる。
Russian (RU): Двери открылись, и мы оказались внутри.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A porta foi aberta, nos convidando para entrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 門被打開，我們也被招呼了進去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 门被打开，我们也被招呼了进去。
Indonesian (IDN): Pintu dibuka dan kami diundang masuk.
Italian (IT): La porta si aprì, e fummo invitati ad entrare.
Turkish (TR): Kapı açıldı ve içeri davet edildik.

Umineko Project (UP): The dining hall, which screamed "filthy rich", featured a super‐long table which was obviously designed with no other purpose than to make the guests conscious of their rank, and our parents were already seated at it in accordance with that ordering.
Steam (ST): The dining room, which looked exactly like you'd imagine a rich person's dining room to be, had a super-long table that was obviously positioned with no purpose other than to make the guests conscious of their rank. Our parents were already sitting in accordance with that ordering.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The dining room, everything in the room looking clearly expensive, was set up with a super-long table which was obviously positioned with no other purpose than to make the guests conscious of their rank. Our parents were already sitting in accordance to that ordering.
PC Japanese (JP): 如何にも大金持ちーって感じの食堂には、来客に序列を思い知らせるのが目的としか思えない超長いテーブルが置かれ、その序列に従い、もう親たちが着席していた。
Russian (RU): В обеденном зале, чьё внутреннее убранство выглядело неприятно дорого, стоял невероятно длинный обеденный стол, явно поставленный здесь с целью дать гостям ощутить разницу в их статусе. Наши родители уже расположились за ним, следуя установленному порядку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na sala de jantar, tudo parecia ser extremamente caro e tinha uma mesa superlonga, que claramente havia sido projetada com uma única proposta, fazer com que os visitantes tomassem consciência de seus patamares. Nossos pais já estavam sentados de acordo com essa ordem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一看就是大富豪的餐廳，擺著張怎麼想都是為了讓來客明白尊卑序列的超長桌子。照著這個序列，長輩們已經入座了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一看就是大富豪的餐厅，摆着张怎么想都是为了让来客明白尊卑序列的超长桌子。照着这个序列，长辈们已经入座了。
Indonesian (IDN): Ruang makan, yang berteriak "kaya raya", menampilkan meja super panjang yang jelas dirancang tanpa tujuan lain selain membuat tamu sadar akan pangkat mereka, dan orang tua kami sudah duduk di sana sesuai pengaturan itu.
Italian (IT): Nella sala da pranzo, che trasmetteva un'enorme sfarzosità, vi era un tavolo incredibilmente lungo, che sembrava disposto con il preciso scopo di rendere i visitatori consci del proprio rango, e i nostri genitori erano già seduti in base a tale gerarchia.
Turkish (TR): "Pis zengin" dermişcesine bağıran yemek salonunda, konukların rütbelerinin bilincinde olmalarını sağlamaktan başka bir amaçla tasarlanmadığı belli olan süper uzun bir masa vardı, ve ailelerimiz buna uygun olarak çoktan oturmuşlardı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "You're late, brats. Hurry up and take your seats."
Steam (ST): "You're late, brats. Hurry up and take a seat."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You're late, brats. Hurry up and take a seat."
PC Japanese (JP): 「遅ぇぞ、ガキども。早く席につけよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「遅ぇぞ、ガキども。早く席につけよ」
Russian (RU): "Вы опаздываете, оболтусы. Быстрее занимайте места."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Estão atrasados, pirralhos. Se apressem e sentem logo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「太慢了，小鬼們。快點坐自己位子上去。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「太慢了，小鬼们。快点坐自己位子上去。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kalian terlambat, bocah-bocah. Cepat duduk."
Italian (IT): "Siete in ritardo, marmocchi. Sbrigate a sedervi."
Turkish (TR): "Geç kaldınız veletler. Acele edin ve yerlerinize oturun."

Umineko Project (UP): The old bastard pressed us to sit.
Steam (ST): The old bastard pressed us to sit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): クソ親父が着席を促す。
Russian (RU): Этот старикан поторопил нас рассесться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O velho desgraçado nos pressionou para sentarmos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 混蛋老爸催促我們快點坐下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 混蛋老爸催促我们快点坐下。
Indonesian (IDN): Si tua brengsek mendesak kami untuk duduk.
Italian (IT): Il vecchiaccio ci incitò a prendere posto.
Turkish (TR): Yaşlı piç oturmamız için bizi zorladı.

Umineko Project (UP): Only the places where we would sit were empty at the long table, which only made us feel our tardiness all the more.
Steam (ST): The only gaps in that group of people were the spots we were supposed to sit, which only made us feel our tardiness all the more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only the places where we would sit were empty at the long table, which only made us feel our tardiness all the more.
PC Japanese (JP): 長いテーブルの、自分たちが座る場所だけがぽっかりと空いていて、一層、遅刻した感を煽った。
Russian (RU): За длинным столом пустовали лишь те места, где полагалось сидеть нам, что заставило нас ещё больше ощутить факт своего опоздания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas os lugares onde deveríamos sentar estavam vazios, o que fez nós nos sentirmos mais do que apenas atrasados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 長桌子旁的座位上就只有我們的位置空著，更加突顯了我們遲到的氛圍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 长桌子旁的座位上就只有我们的位置空着，更加突显了我们迟到的氛围。
Indonesian (IDN): Hanya tempat di mana kami akan duduk yang kosong di meja panjang, yang hanya membuat kami semakin merasakan keterlambatan kami.
Italian (IT): In tutto il lungo tavolo, solo i nostri posti erano rimasti vuoti, il che accentuò ancor di più il nostro ritardo.
Turkish (TR): Uzun masada sadece bizim oturacağımız yerlerin boş olması geç kaldığımızı daha çok hissettiriyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The seat at the very head of the table, which you might call the seat of honor, was for the most highly ranked, and reserved for Grandfather.
Steam (ST): The seat at the head of the table, called the Incipient's Chair, was for the most highly ranked, reserved for Grandfather.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The seat at the head of the table, called the Incipient's Chair, was for the most highly ranked, reserved for Grandfather.
PC Japanese (JP): 一番奥正面のいわゆるお誕生席が最上位の席、祖父さまの指定席だ。
Russian (RU): Место во главе стола, называемое местом основателя, предназначалось для дедушки, стоящего на самой высокой ступени созданной им иерархии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O assento na ponta da mesa, que você poderia chamar de assento de honra, que é para a pessoa com maior importância, era reservado ao nosso avô.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 最裡頭面向正面的上座，是爺爺的專用座位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 最里头面向正面的上座，是爷爷的专用座位。
Indonesian (IDN): Tempat duduk di ujung paling kepala meja, yang bisa kamu sebut kursi kehormatan, diperuntukkan bagi yang paling tinggi pangkatnya, dan disediakan untuk Kakek.
Italian (IT): La sedia più in fondo al tavolo, la cosiddetta sedia del capotavola, era per il rango più alto, riservata al nonno.
Turkish (TR): Masanın en başındaki koltuk, ki buna onur konuğu koltuğu da diyebilirsiniz, en yüksek rütbeliler içindi ve Büyükbabaya ayrılmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): It was still empty.{n}...He was probably planning to come in last to make himself look important.
Steam (ST): It was still empty. ...He probably wanted to show up last for dramatic effect.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was still empty....He was probably planning to come in last to ham it up.
PC Japanese (JP): そこはまだ空席だった。…もったいぶって最後に来るつもりなんだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そこはまだ空席だった。{n}…もったいぶって最後に来るつもりなんだろう。
Russian (RU): Оно пустовало.{n}...Он, наверное, как плохой актёр, планирует заявиться в последнюю очередь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele ainda estava vazio.{n}...Ele provavelmente planeja vir por último, para fazê‐lo parecer mais importante.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那裡還是空席。{n}…他大概是想擺擺架子，等到最後再來吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那里还是空席。{n}…他大概是想摆摆架子，等到最后再来吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu masih kosong.{n}...Dia mungkin berencana datang terakhir untuk membuat dirinya terlihat penting.
Italian (IT): Era ancora vuota... Probabilmente voleva essere l'ultimo ad arrivare per mettersi in mostra.
Turkish (TR): Hâlâ boştu.{n}...Muhtemelen kendini önemli göstermek için en son gelmeyi planlıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The seating order, as you faced the seat of honor, went from left to right in rows of two, with the ranking being lower the further you were from it.
Steam (ST): From the perspective of someone facing the Incipient's Chair head on, the seating order went from left to right, with the lower ranking seats progressing in rows of two further away from it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The seating order, looking at the Incipient's Chair at the head of the table, went from left to right with the lower ranking seats progressing in rows of two further away from it.
PC Japanese (JP): 席順の序列は、お誕生席を正面奥に見ながら、左・右と序列が続き、序列の順位が低いほどお誕生席から遠のいていく。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 席順の序列は、お誕生席を正面奥に見ながら、左右と序列が続き、序列の順位が低いほどお誕生席から遠のいていく。
Russian (RU): Порядок, в котором людям полагалось рассаживаться за этим столом, брал начало от места основателя. Если смотреть на стол с этого места, то ранг остальных мест, стоящих в ряд по два места друг напротив друга, начинал убывать слева направо, и так до другого конца стола.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A ordem dos assentos, a partir do assento de honra, ia da esquerda para a direita, em duas fileiras, com menor importância, aqueles que ficavam mais longe dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 座位的序列，從正對面的上座所在的位置開始，左右左右地排下來，序列越低的就離上座越遠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 座位的序列，从正对面的上座所在的位置开始，左右左右地排下来，序列越低的就离上座越远。
Indonesian (IDN): Urutan tempat duduk, saat kamu menghadap kursi kehormatan, berjalan dari kiri ke kanan dalam barisan dua, dengan pangkat semakin rendah semakin jauh darinya.
Italian (IT): Dalla prospettiva di qualcuno posto di fronte alla sedia del capotavola, l'ordine dei posti proseguiva da sinistra a destra, dove il rango diminuiva man mano che ci si allontanava dalla sedia a capotavola.
Turkish (TR): Oturma düzeni, onur konuğu koltuğuna bakarken soldan sağa doğru ikişerli sıralar halinde ilerliyordu ve koltuktan uzaklaştıkça rütbe düşüyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): So, on the left‐hand side of the row closest to the seat of honor was the second‐ranked seat, belonging to the eldest of the adult siblings—Uncle Krauss.
Steam (ST): So, the left-hand side of the first row, closest to the Incipient's Chair, was where Uncle Krauss should have sat, since he was the second highest in rank.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, on the left-hand side of the first row, closest to the Incipient's Chair, was where Krauss oji-san, ranked at number two, should have sat.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、お誕生席に一番近い第１列目の左席、序列第２位の席は親兄弟の長兄の蔵臼伯父さんの席。
Russian (RU): Таким образом, место в первом ряду, находящееся слева от места основателя, полагалось занимать дяде Крауссу, являвшемуся номером два по дедушкиному табелю о рангах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ao lado esquerdo, mais próximo do assento de honra, estava o segundo da sucessão, o mais velho dos irmãos — o tio Krauss.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，離上座最近的第一列的左席，是序列排在第二位的長子藏臼伯父的座位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，离上座最近的第一列的左席，是序列排在第二位的长子藏臼伯父的座位。
Indonesian (IDN): Jadi, di sisi kiri barisan terdekat dengan kursi kehormatan adalah kursi peringkat kedua, milik anak tertua dari saudara dewasa—Paman Krauss.
Italian (IT): In altre parole, il posto a sinistra della prima fila, quella più vicino alla sedia del capotavola, era quello di zio Klaus, il secondo più alto di rango e il più grande dei fratelli...
Turkish (TR): Dolayısıyla, onur konuğu koltuğu en yakın sıranın sol tarafında, kardeşlerin en büyüğü olana ait ikinci sıradaki koltuk vardı—yani Krauss Amca'ya.

Umineko Project (UP): .........It looked like he hadn't arrived yet either, so that seat was empty.
Steam (ST): .........It looked like he hadn't arrived yet, so that seat was empty.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........It looked like Oji-san hadn't arrived yet, so that seat was empty.
PC Japanese (JP): ………伯父さんもまだ来てないようで空席だった。
Russian (RU): .........Судя по всему, дядя ещё не успел прийти, так как его место пустовало.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Parece que ele ainda não havia chegado, por isso o assento estava vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………伯父還沒來，所以也還是空席。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………伯父还没来，所以也还是空席。
Indonesian (IDN): .........Sepertinya dia juga belum datang, jadi kursi itu kosong.
Italian (IT): A quanto pareva, anche lo zio non era ancora arrivato, e il suo posto era vuoto.
Turkish (TR): .........O da henüz gelmemiş gibi görünüyordu, bu yüzden o koltuk boştu.

Umineko Project (UP): And then opposite him, on the right‐hand side of the first row, sat the eldest daughter of the family, Auntie Eva, ranked at number three.
Steam (ST): Across from his chair, on the right side of the first row, sat the eldest daughter of the family, Aunt Eva, who was the third highest in rank.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And then to his opposite, on the right side of the first row sat the eldest daughter of the family, Eva oba-san, ranked at number three.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてその向かいの、第１列目の右席には、序列第３位で親兄弟の長女の絵羽伯母さんが座る。
Russian (RU): И далее, справа в первом ряду, напротив места, где должен был сидеть Краусс, сидела самая старшая дочь в семье, тётя Ева — номер три по табелю о рангах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E no lado oposto, à direita, na primeira cadeira, senta a filha mais velha da família, a tia Eva, classificada como terceira.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後在這對面，即第一列的右席，是序列排在第三位的座位，上面坐著長女繪羽姑母。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后在这对面，即第一列的右席，是序列排在第三位的座位，上面坐着长女绘羽姑母。
Indonesian (IDN): Dan kemudian di seberangnya, di sisi kanan barisan pertama, duduk putri tertua keluarga, Bibi Eva, peringkat ketiga.
Italian (IT): E zia Eva, la figlia più grande della famiglia e terza di rango, sedeva alla parte opposta.
Turkish (TR): Onun karşısında, ilk sıranın sağ tarafında, ailenin en büyük kızı Eva Teyze oturuyordu ve üçüncü sıradaydı.

Umineko Project (UP): The left‐hand side of the second row was for number four.{n}There sat the old bastard, Rudolf, as the third of the siblings.
Steam (ST): The left-hand side of the second row was for the fourth highest in rank. There sat my damned dad, Rudolf, the third of the siblings.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The left-hand side of the second row was for number four. There sat my old bastard, Rudolf, as one of the three siblings already present.
PC Japanese (JP): 第２列目の左席は序列第４位。親兄弟の３人目ということでうちのクソ親父、留弗夫が座る。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 第２列目の左席は序列第４位。{n}親兄弟の３人目ということでうちのクソ親父、留弗夫が座る。
Russian (RU): Левая сторона во втором ряду предназначалась четвёртому номеру.{n}Там расселся мой старикан‐папаша Рудольф, как один из присутствующих братьев и сестёр.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na segunda cadeira do lado esquerdo estava o número quatro.{n}O lugar do velho desgraçado, Rudolf, que era o terceiro dos irmãos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 第二列的左席是序列排在第四位的座位。{n}那裡坐著三兒子，也就是我那混蛋老爸，留弗夫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 第二列的左席是序列排在第四位的座位。{n}那里坐着三儿子，也就是我那混蛋老爸，留弗夫。
Indonesian (IDN): Sisi kiri barisan kedua untuk peringkat keempat.{n}Di sana duduk si tua brengsek, Rudolf, sebagai anak ketiga.
Italian (IT): Il quarto di rango si trovava nella seconda fila, a sinistra. Lì sedeva Rudolf, il mio vecchiaccio, e il terzo tra i fratelli.
Turkish (TR): İkinci sıranın sol tarafı dört numaraya ayrılmıştı.{n}Orada kardeşlerin üçüncüsü olarak yaşlı piç Rudolf oturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Opposite him sat number five, the youngest sibling, Auntie Rosa.
Steam (ST): Across from him, on the right side of the second row, sat Aunt Rosa, the youngest sibling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Opposite him sat number five, the youngest sibling, Rosa oba-san.
PC Japanese (JP): その向かいの第２列目右席、序列第５位は、親兄弟の末っ子の楼座叔母さんの席。
Russian (RU): Напротив него, под номером пять, сидела самая младшая из братьев и сестёр — тётя Роза.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Oposta a ele, no quinto assento, a mais nova dos irmãos, a tia Rosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這對面，第二列的右席，序列排在第五位的，是小女兒樓座姑母的座位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这对面，第二列的右席，序列排在第五位的，是小女儿楼座姑母的座位。
Indonesian (IDN): Di seberangnya duduk peringkat kelima, anak bungsu, Bibi Rosa.
Italian (IT): Di fronte a lui si trovava il posto di zia Rosa, la quinta di rango e la più piccola fra loro.
Turkish (TR): Onun karşısında ise beş numara, en küçük kardeş Rosa Teyze oturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Going like this, you might think that the next ones to come would be their husbands and wives, but...guess again, because the left‐hand seat in the following third row, meaning rank number six, was actually Jessica's seat.
Steam (ST): At this point, you might expect their husbands and wives to come next, but nope, the left-hand seat in the third row, rank number six, belonged to Jessica.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Going like this, you might think that the next ones to come would be their husbands and wives, but... It's weird, but the next left-hand seat in the third row, meaning number six, was Jessica's seat.
PC Japanese (JP): こう来れば、次は親たちの配偶者が来るだろうと思うかもしれないが、ところがどっこい、次の第３列目左席、つまり序列第６位は朱志香の席だったりする。
Russian (RU): Если и дальше следовать такому порядку, то можно предположить, что далее должны последовать их мужья и жёны, вот только... следующее место слева в третьем ряду под номером шесть принадлежало Джессике.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seguindo essa ordem, você deve imaginar que os próximos seriam os maridos e esposas, mas...novamente, ao lado direito, na terceira cadeira, o número seis, era, na verdade, o lugar da Jessica.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家可能會想，接下來該是我爸他們的配偶的座位了吧？可惜錯了，接下來第三列的左席，也就是序列排在第六位的是朱志香的座位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家可能会想，接下来该是我爸他们的配偶的座位了吧？可惜错了，接下来第三列的左席，也就是序列排在第六位的是朱志香的座位。
Indonesian (IDN): Berlanjut seperti ini, kamu mungkin berpikir yang berikutnya adalah suami dan istri mereka, tapi...tebak lagi, karena kursi kiri di barisan ketiga berikutnya, berarti peringkat keenam, sebenarnya adalah kursi Jessica.
Italian (IT): Continuando di questo passo si sarebbe potuto pensare che i prossimi fossero i loro consorti, ma... la sedia successiva, situata nella terza fila a sinistra, era invece di Jessica, ossia la sesta di rango.
Turkish (TR): Bu şekilde devam edersek, sıradakilerin kocaları ve karıları olacağını düşünebilirsiniz ama...bir daha düşünün, çünkü bir sonraki üçüncü sıradaki sol koltuk, yani altı numara, aslında Jessica'nın koltuğuydu.

Umineko Project (UP): Opposite her was George‐aniki.
Steam (ST): Opposite her was George-aniki.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Opposite her was George-aniki.
PC Japanese (JP): その向かい席は譲治兄貴。
Russian (RU): Напротив неё сидел Джордж‐аники.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado oposto, o George‐aniki.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對面的座位是讓治大哥的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对面的座位是让治大哥的。
Indonesian (IDN): Di seberangnya adalah George-aniki.
Italian (IT): Di fronte a lei c'era il fratellone George.
Turkish (TR): Onun karşısında George-aniki oturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Then, the seat next to Jessica was me, and opposite me was Maria.
Steam (ST): I sat next to Jessica, ...and Maria sat across from me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, next to Jessica, was me, And opposite me was Maria.
PC Japanese (JP): そして朱志香の隣の席は俺で、その向かいは真里亞となる。
Russian (RU): Рядом с Джессикой сидел я, а напротив меня расположилась Мария.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em seguida, do lado da Jessica, eu, e, sentada à minha frente, ficava a Maria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後緊鄰朱志香的座位是我的，我對面是真里亞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后紧邻朱志香的座位是我的，我对面是真里亚。
Indonesian (IDN): Lalu, kursi sebelah Jessica adalah aku, dan di seberangku adalah Maria.
Italian (IT): Dopodiché, io ero accanto a Jessica... e Maria mi era seduta di fronte.
Turkish (TR): Jessica'nın yanındaki koltukta da ben oturuyordum, ve karşımda Maria vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): And next to me, on the left‐hand side of the fifth row, all the way down at number ten, finally came Aunt Natsuhi.
Steam (ST): Then, finally, next to me on the left-hand side of the fifth row, sat Aunt Natsuhi, the tenth highest in rank.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, finally, next to me on the left-hand side of the fifth row was number ten, Natsuhi oba-san.
PC Japanese (JP): そして俺の隣、つまり第５列目左席の序列第１０位まで来てようやく夏妃叔母さんなのである。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして俺の隣、つまり第５列目左席の序列第１０位まで来てようやく夏妃伯母さんなのである。
Russian (RU): И, наконец, в пятом ряду слева и рядом со мной, под десятым номером сидела тётя Нацухи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em seguida, ao meu lado, na quinta cadeira da direita, chegamos ao número dez, a tia Natsuhi.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後我旁邊，也就是第五列的左席，按序列排在第十位的座位，總算是輪到了夏妃伯母。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后我旁边，也就是第五列的左席，按序列排在第十位的座位，总算是轮到了夏妃伯母。
Indonesian (IDN): Dan di sebelahku, di sisi kiri barisan kelima, jauh di peringkat kesepuluh, akhirnya datang Bibi Natsuhi.
Italian (IT): E finalmente, al decimo posto della gerarchia, seduta accanto a me sulla sedia di sinistra della quinta fila, vi era la zia Natsuhi...
Turkish (TR): Ve benim yanımda, beşinci sıranın sol tarafında, on numarada, nihayet Natsuhi Teyze vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Opposite her was Uncle Hideyoshi, and next to Aunt Natsuhi, in the sixth and final row on the left‐hand side, was Kyrie‐san.
Steam (ST): ...Opposite her was Uncle Hideyoshi. Next to Aunt Natsuhi, in the sixth row and the final seat on the left-hand side, sat Kyrie-san.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Opposite her was Hideyoshi oji-san. Next to Natsuhi oba-san, in the sixth row and in the final seat on the left-hand side, was Kyrie-san.
PC Japanese (JP): …その向かいが秀吉伯父さんで、夏妃叔母さんの隣の第６列目、一番手前の左席が霧江さんである。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …その向かいが秀吉伯父さんで、夏妃伯母さんの隣の第６列目、一番手前の左席が霧江さんである。
Russian (RU): ...Напротив неё сидел дядя Хидэёши. Далее, на последнем месте в шестом ряду слева и рядом с тётей Нацухи расположилась Кирие‐сан.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Sentado à sua frente estava o tio Hideyoshi, e ao lado da tia Natsuhi, na sexta e última cadeira, do lado direito, estava a Kyrie‐san.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …她的對面是秀吉姑父，而夏妃伯母旁邊所在的第六列，也即最靠外面的左席是霧江姐的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …她的对面是秀吉姑父，而夏妃伯母旁边所在的第六列，也即最靠外面的左席是雾江姐的。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Di seberangnya adalah Paman Hideyoshi, dan di sebelah Bibi Natsuhi, di barisan keenam dan terakhir di sisi kiri, adalah Kyrie-san.
Italian (IT): Di fronte a lei c'era lo zio Hideyoshi. Accanto a Zia Natsuhi, seduta a sinistra nella sesta e ultima fila, vi era Kirie-san.
Turkish (TR): ...Onun karşısında da Hideyoshi Amca vardı, Natsuhi Teyze'nin yanında, sol taraftaki altıncı ve son sırada Kyrie-san oturuyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The seat opposite to Kyrie‐san had been laid out like the others, but was empty.
Steam (ST): The seat opposite to Kyrie-san was empty, even though silverware had been set there and everything.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The seat opposite to Kyrie-san was empty even though everything had been set out.
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江さんの向かいの席にも食事の支度がされていたが空席だった。
Russian (RU): Место напротив Кирие‐сан пустовало, хотя и было сервировано вместе с остальными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O assento oposto ao da Kyrie‐san, havia sido colocado, mas estava vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 霧江姐的對面雖然也擺好了餐具，不過還是空席。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 雾江姐的对面虽然也摆好了餐具，不过还是空席。
Indonesian (IDN): Kursi di seberang Kyrie-san telah disiapkan seperti yang lain, tapi kosong.
Italian (IT): La tavola era stata apparecchiata anche nel posto di fronte a Kirie-san, ma la sedia era vuota.
Turkish (TR): Kyrie-san'ın karşısındaki koltuk da diğerleri gibi düzenlenmişti ama boştu.

Umineko Project (UP): According to this ranking system, that spot was the seat where Auntie Rosa's husband should be sitting.
Steam (ST): According to this ranking system, that spot was where Aunt Rosa's husband should be sitting.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to this ranking system, that spot was the seat where Rosa oba-san's husband should be sitting.
PC Japanese (JP): 序列的に言うなら、そこは楼座叔母さんの旦那さんが座るべき席だ。
Russian (RU): Согласно этой статусной системе, это место предназначалось для мужа тёти Розы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com esse sistema de ranking, aquele lugar era onde o marido da tia Rosa deveria sentar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 按序列來說，那該是樓座姑母的丈夫坐的座位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 按序列来说，那该是楼座姑母的丈夫坐的座位。
Indonesian (IDN): Menurut sistem peringkat ini, tempat itu adalah kursi di mana suami Bibi Rosa seharusnya duduk.
Italian (IT): Seguendo la gerarchia, lì avrebbe dovuto sedersi il marito di zia Rosa...
Turkish (TR): Bu sıralama sistemine göre, o koltuk Rosa Teyze'nin kocasının oturması gereken yerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ......He hasn't come, as far as I know, yet the table had been laid for his seat.
Steam (ST): ......Even though he wasn't supposed to be coming, his place was made up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Even though he wasn't supposed to be coming, his place was made up.
PC Japanese (JP): ……来ていないはずなのに、その席にも準備がされていた。
Russian (RU): ......Даже несмотря на его отсутствие, его место было подготовлено.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele não havia vindo, mas até onde eu sei, a mesa havia sido colocada com o seu assento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……明明沒來，卻還是準備了他的位子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……明明没来，却还是准备了他的位子。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Dia tidak datang, sepengetahuanku, tapi meja telah disiapkan untuk kursinya.
Italian (IT): Quel posto era stato riservato per lui, anche se non sarebbe venuto.
Turkish (TR): ......Bildiğim kadarıyla henüz gelmedi ama masa onun oturması için hazırlanmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): These kind of ranking orders usually permit the spouse a corresponding status, but the Ushiromiya family had an original kind of ranking.
Steam (ST): Normally, ranking systems of this sort give spouses equal positions as their partners, but the Ushiromiya family's system was unique.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): These kind of ranking orders usually recognize the status of the spouse, but the Ushiromiya family had an original kind of ranking.
PC Japanese (JP): 普通、序列は配偶者にも準ずる格を認めるものだが、右代宮家は独自の序列を持っていた。
Russian (RU): Подобные системы распределения мест обычно исходят из статуса супругов, но у семьи Уширомия была своя статусная система.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esse tipo de classificação normalmente dá aos cônjuges o seu patamar correspondente, mas a família Ushiromiya tem um tipo de ranking original.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一般來說，配偶者也應該獲得相應的地位，但是右代宮家卻有著獨自的序列。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一般来说，配偶者也应该获得相应的地位，但是右代宫家却有着独自的序列。
Indonesian (IDN): Urutan peringkat seperti ini biasanya mengizinkan pasangan status yang sesuai, tapi keluarga Ushiromiya memiliki jenis peringkat orisinal.
Italian (IT): Normalmente, una gerarchia riconosce anche ai coniugi un rango equivalente, ma quello della famiglia Ushiromiya era unico nel suo genere...
Turkish (TR): Bu tür sıralama düzenleri genellikle eşe uygun bir statü sağlar, ancak Ushiromiya ailesinin orijinal bir sıralama türü vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Maybe it's a leftover of male chauvinism.{n}Under the notion that a mother's womb is only a temporary house for the child and she contributes no genes, the children of direct descent would have the highest ranking, followed by the grandkids.
Steam (ST): ......Maybe it's a remnant of male chauvinism. If you start with the assumption that a woman's womb is just something to be borrowed, then the children of direct descent would come first, directly followed by the grandchildren.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Maybe it's a leftover of male chauvinism. If the system is predicated on the idea that a woman's womb is just a borrowed thing, then the children of direct descent would have a much higher ranking, and the grandchildren would come next.
PC Japanese (JP): ……多分、男尊女卑の名残だろう。女の腹は借り物だとする考えに基づくと、直系の子供がもっとも序列が高く、孫が次。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……多分、男尊女卑の名残だろう。{n}女の腹は借り物だとする考えに基づくと、直系の子供がもっとも序列が高く、孫が次。
Russian (RU): ......Должно быть, это пережитки мужского шовинизма.{n}Но если система основывается на идее, что женская матка — всего лишь позаимствованная вещь, то тогда дети прямого потомка должны занимать более высокий статус, а его внуки — уже пониже, чем их родители.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Talvez seja um tipo de machismo.{n}Sob a noção que o útero de uma mãe é a casa temporária de seu filho, e ela contribui com seus genes, as crianças, que são descendentes diretos, possuem um ranking mais elevado; ou seja, os netos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大概是男尊女卑的遺風遺俗吧。{n}本著“女人的肚子不過是借來生孩子用”的想法，直系的子女序列最高，孫次之。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大概是男尊女卑的遗风遗俗吧。{n}本着“女人的肚子不过是借来生孩子用”的想法，直系的子女序列最高，孙次之。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Mungkin sisa dari kenisbian laki-laki.{n}Di bawah anggapan bahwa rahim ibu hanya rumah sementara untuk anak dan tidak memberikan gen apa pun, anak-anak keturunan langsung akan memiliki peringkat tertinggi, diikuti cucu-cucu.
Italian (IT): Forse è per via di un retaggio maschilista. Se ci si basa sulla nozione che l'utero di una donna è un oggetto dato in affitto, allora i figli legittimi sarebbero di rango molto più alto, seguiti dai nipoti.
Turkish (TR): ......Belki de erkek şovenizminin bir kalıntısıdır.{n}Bir annenin rahminin çocuk için sadece geçici bir ev olduğu ve hiçbir gen katkısında bulunmadığı düşüncesi altında, doğrudan soydan gelen çocuklar en yüksek sıralamaya sahip olur, ardından torunlar gelirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): Meaning that the spouses, with no blood ties, would be considered the last in line.
Steam (ST): In other words, spouses have no blood ties and are therefore placed at the end of the line.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Meaning that the spouses, with no blood ties, are considered the last in line.
PC Japanese (JP): 血の繋がらない配偶者たちは一番ビリって考えになるわけだ。
Russian (RU): Это значит, что супруги, не связанные узами крови, идут самыми последними по табелю о рангах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que significa que os cônjuges, que não possuem uma ligação sanguínea, são considerados os últimos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 沒血緣關係的配偶者就成了最末尾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 没血缘关系的配偶者就成了最末尾。
Indonesian (IDN): Artinya pasangan, tanpa ikatan darah, akan dianggap paling akhir.
Italian (IT): Ragion per cui i coniugi, non condividendo lo stesso sangue, erano considerati gli ultimi nella scala gerarchica...
Turkish (TR): Yani kan bağı olmayan eşler en son sırada sayılacaktır.

Umineko Project (UP): ......It's terrible, but according to that ranking order, Grandmother, if she was still alive, would be in a position even lower than mine.
Steam (ST): ......It's terrible, but by this system, my Grandmother would be ranked even lower than me, if she were still alive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's terrible, but according to that ranking order, Grandmother, when she was alive, would have been in a position even lower than mine.
PC Japanese (JP): ……気の毒な話だが、その序列によるならば祖母さまが生きていたとして、その序列は俺よりも下だということになる。
Russian (RU): ......Кошмар, но следуя такому порядку, бабушка, когда она была ещё жива, имела даже более низкий статус, чем я.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Isso é terrível, mas de acordo com essa ordem, se a nossa avó ainda estivesse viva, ela estaria em uma posição ainda mais baixa que a minha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……還真挺可怜的，如果奶奶還活著的話，按這序列來排，她的序列還會排在我之下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……还真挺可怜的，如果奶奶还活着的话，按这序列来排，她的序列还会排在我之下。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Ini mengerikan, tapi menurut urutan peringkat itu, Nenek, jika masih hidup, akan berada di posisi lebih rendah dari aku.
Italian (IT): A me dispiace dirlo, ma stando a questa gerarchia, se la nonna fosse ancora viva, occuperebbe un rango inferiore persino al mio.
Turkish (TR): ......Bu korkunç, ama bu sıralamaya göre, büyükanne, eğer hala hayatta olsaydı, benimkinden bile daha düşük bir konumda olurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): In youth, obey your father; after marriage, your husband; after aging, your children.
Steam (ST): In their youth, they obey their father; after they get married, their husband; after aging, their children.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In their youth they obey their father; after they get married, their husband; after aging, their children.
PC Japanese (JP): 若い日には父に従い、嫁いでからは夫に従い、老いてからは子に従え。
Russian (RU): В молодости подчиняйся своему отцу; после вступления в брак — своему мужу; в старости — своим детям.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando jovem, obedeça seu pai; após o casamento, obedeça seu marido; após envelhecer, os seus filhos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在家從父，既嫁從夫，老來從子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在家从父，既嫁从夫，老来从子。
Indonesian (IDN): Di masa muda, patuh pada ayah; setelah menikah, pada suami; setelah tua, pada anak.
Italian (IT): Quando sono giovani obbediscono al padre; dopo il matrimonio, al marito; nella vecchiaia, ai loro figli.
Turkish (TR): Gençlikte babana, evlendikten sonra kocana, yaşlandıktan sonra da çocuklarına itaat et.

Umineko Project (UP): A leftover of the times when they used to say, "Women: no home in three worlds".
Steam (ST): There's the old saying: "Women have no home in any realm".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There's the old saying, 'Women, whether in their past, present, or future, have no home'.
PC Japanese (JP): 「女、三界に家なし」なんて言われた昔の名残だ。
Russian (RU): Существует даже старая поговорка: "У женщины в прошлом, настоящем и будущем нет дома".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um resquício dos tempos em que se costumava dizer, "Mulheres: sem casa em nenhum dos três mundos.".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 怪不得會有「女子三界無家」這種老話了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 怪不得会有「女子三界无家」这种老话了。
Indonesian (IDN): Sisa dari zaman ketika mereka biasa berkata, "Perempuan: tidak punya rumah di tiga dunia".
Italian (IT): Sono le tracce di una vecchia massima, che diceva: ‘Il mondo fu fatto per gli uomini, non per le donne’.
Turkish (TR): "Kadınlara üç dünyada da yuva yok" dedikleri zamanlardan bir kalıntı.

Umineko Project (UP): Long ago, when I was still incapable of figuring all this out, I'd thought it was so great that we could all chat with the adult siblings sitting in their group and us cousins in ours. However, now that I can reexamine the seating order after growing up a bit, it stirs up some very complicated feelings in me...
Steam (ST): Long ago, when I was still incapable of figuring all this out, I'd thought it was so great that we could all chat in our little groups, adult siblings with adult siblings and cousins with cousins. However, now that I can reexamine the seating order after growing up a bit, it stirs up some very complicated feelings in me...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Long ago, when I was still incapable of figuring all this out, I'd thought it was so great that we could all chat, with the adult siblings in their group and us cousins in ours. However, now that I can reexamine the seating order after growing up a bit, it stirs up some very complicated feelings in me...
PC Japanese (JP): そんなことに思い至らない昔は、親兄弟は親兄弟同士、いとこはいとこ同士とそれぞれのグループごとに座れて話が弾んでいいなんて思っていたが、この歳になって再び着席順を見直してみると、何とも複雑な気持ちにさせられる…。
Russian (RU): Давным‐давно, когда я ещё не понимал всех этих сложностей, я думал, как же здорово, что все мы можем общаться, взрослые в своей группе, а двоюродные братья и сёстры — в своей. Однако теперь, когда я стал намного взрослее, эта статусная система стала вызывать у меня смешанные чувства...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Há muito tempo atrás, quando eu ainda era incapaz de entender tudo isso, eu pensava que era algo bom, já que os irmãos poderiam conversar, sentados em seu grupo, e nós, primos, no nosso grupo. No entanto, agora que eu posso reexaminar a ordem dos assentos, isso acaba despertando alguns sentimentos bem complicados em mim...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 小時候根本沒想過這些，只是想著老爸兄妹們坐一起，堂兄妹們也是坐在一起，可以各聊各的還挺不錯。可到了這歲數再看這座位順序，真是讓我感到一股說不出來的複雜心情…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 小时候根本没想过这些，只是想着老爸兄妹们坐一起，堂兄妹们也是坐在一起，可以各聊各的还挺不错。可到了这岁数再看这座位顺序，真是让我感到一股说不出来的复杂心情…。
Indonesian (IDN): Dulu, ketika aku masih tidak bisa memahami semua ini, aku pikir sangat hebat bahwa kami semua bisa mengobrol dengan saudara dewasa duduk dalam kelompok mereka dan kami sepupu dalam kelompok kami. Namun, sekarang setelah aku bisa memeriksa kembali urutan tempat duduk setelah tumbuh sedikit, itu membangkitkan perasaan yang sangat rumit dalam diriku...
Italian (IT): In passato non capivo queste cose, e pensavo fosse bello che fratelli, sorelle e cugini fossero incoraggiati a conversare coi loro rispettivi gruppi, ma guardando l'ordine dei posti con un occhio più maturo, la cosa mi suscitava delle emozioni molto difficili da esprimere a parole...
Turkish (TR): Uzun zaman önce, tüm bunları anlamaktan hala acizken, yetişkin kardeşlerin kendi gruplarında, biz kuzenlerin de kendi grubumuzda oturup sohbet edebilmemizin harika olduğunu düşünürdüm. Ancak şimdi, biraz büyüdükten sonra oturma düzenini yeniden inceleyebildiğim için, içimde çok karmaşık duygular uyandırıyor...

Umineko Project (UP): Aunt Natsuhi, married to the eldest son of the family, responsible for managing the household, and number two for all practical intents and purposes, sat to my right, ...which meant that she was two steps lower than me in the ranking order.
Steam (ST): Aunt Natsuhi, who was married to the eldest son and was the de-facto number two in managing this family, sat to my right, ...which meant that she was two steps lower than me in the ranking order.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Natsuhi oba-san, married to the eldest son of the family and number two in managing the house, sat to my right, ...which meant that she was two steps lower than me in the ranking order.
PC Japanese (JP): 本家の長男に嫁ぎ、家を切り盛りする実質上のナンバー２の夏妃伯母さんが俺の右側の席、…つまり俺より２つも序列が下だというのだから。
Russian (RU): Тётя Нацухи вышла замуж за самого старшего сына в семье, второго по статусу в управлении домом, который сидел по правую сторону от меня. ...Это означало, что она была на две ступени ниже меня по статусной системе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A tia Natsuhi, casada com o filho mais velho, responsável pela casa, número dois em todos os fins e propósitos práticos, sentou‐se à minha direita, ...o que significa que ela está dois passos abaixo de mim nessa ordem de ranking.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嫁於本家長子，掌管著家事，實質上是二把手的夏妃伯母卻坐在我的右席，…也就是說序列比我還要低兩位。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嫁于本家长子，掌管着家事，实质上是二把手的夏妃伯母却坐在我的右席，…也就是说序列比我还要低两位。
Indonesian (IDN): Bibi Natsuhi, menikah dengan anak tertua keluarga, bertanggung jawab mengelola rumah tangga, dan nomor dua untuk semua maksud dan tujuan, duduk di sebelah kananku, ...yang berarti dia dua tingkat lebih rendah dariku dalam urutan peringkat.
Italian (IT): Zia Natsuhi, che era stata presa in sposa dal primogenito della famiglia, ed era di fatto la numero due nell'amministrazione della casa, era seduta alla mia destra... il che comportava l'essere di due gradi sotto di me nella gerarchia...
Turkish (TR): Ailenin en büyük oğluyla evli, evin idaresinden sorumlu ve pratikte iki numara olan Natsuhi Teyze sağımda oturuyordu, ...bu da onun sıralamada benden iki basamak aşağıda olduğu anlamına geliyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...It was difficult to guess what was going through her head.{n}That's why I made a small apologetic gesture before sitting down.
Steam (ST): ...It was hard to imagine what might be going on inside her heart. That's why I made a small apologetic gesture towards her before sitting down.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It was difficult to guess what was going inside Oba-san's head. That's why I made a small apologetic gesture before sitting down.
PC Japanese (JP): …伯母さんの胸中を察することは難しかった。なので俺は、伯母さんに謝るような仕草をしてから着席するのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …伯母さんの胸中を察することは難しかった。{n}なので俺は、伯母さんに謝るような仕草をしてから着席するのだった。
Russian (RU): ...С трудом можно предположить, что происходит внутри тётиной головы.{n}Поэтому, перед тем как сесть, я сделал небольшой извиняющий жест.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...É difícil de saber o que deve estar passando pela cabeça dela.{n}Por isso eu fiz um pequeno gesto de desculpas antes de me sentar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …難以覺察出伯母現在是什麼心境。{n}所以我在坐下之前，一臉歉意地行了個禮。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …难以觉察出伯母现在是什么心境。{n}所以我在坐下之前，一脸歉意地行了个礼。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Sulit menebak apa yang ada dalam pikirannya.{n}Itu sebabnya aku membuat gerakan permintaan maaf kecil sebelum duduk.
Italian (IT): Mi era difficile immaginare cosa stesse passando per la testa della zia. Pertanto le porsi un piccolo cenno di scuse prima di sedermi.
Turkish (TR): ...Aklından neler geçtiğini tahmin etmek zordu.{n}Bu yüzden oturmadan önce küçük bir özür dileme hareketi yaptım.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "How nice to see you, Battler‐kun. You've grown quite tall, haven't you?"
Steam (ST): "How nice to see you, Battler-kun. You've grown quite tall, haven't you?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "How nice to see you, Battler-kun. You've grown quite tall, haven't you?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「お久しぶりですね、戦人くん。ずいぶん背が伸びましたね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お久しぶりですね、戦人くん。ずいぶん背が伸びましたね」
Russian (RU): "Как приятно тебя видеть, Баттлер‐кун. Когда это ты успел так вырасти?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É bom vê‐lo, Battler‐kun. Você ficou bem alto, não ficou?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好久不見了，戰人君。長得真高呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好久不见了，战人君。长得真高呢。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Senang bertemu, Battler-kun. Kamu sudah tumbuh cukup tinggi, ya?"
Italian (IT): "Che bello rivederti, Battler-kun. Sbaglio o ti sei fatto parecchio alto?"
Turkish (TR): "Seni görmek ne güzel, Battler-kun. Boyun epey uzamış, değil mi?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Huh, ah, yeah! Normal life—you know, food, meals, eating—then suddenly I was this tall."
Steam (ST): "Oh, uh, yep! Six long years of eating well, sampling various cuisines, and deriving sustenance from Mother Earth's bountiful gifts. Hard work, but I pulled through."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Huhh, ah, yeah! I ate and ate and ate meals and before I knew it I got this tall."
PC Japanese (JP): 「え、ぁ、はい！　食ったり食べたり食事したりしてたらいつの間にかこんな身長に。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「え、ぁ、はい！　食ったり食べたり食事したりしてたらいつの間にかこんな身長に」
Russian (RU): "Хе‐хе! Да ничего особенного, в самом деле, обычная жизнь, я не стал ограничивать себя в еде и оглянуться не успел, как стал таким высоким."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hã, ah, sim! O de sempre — sabe, comer bastante, fazer todas as refeições — quando eu percebi já estava assim."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哎，啊，是啊！我有事沒事就在吃啊啃啊嚼啊，不知不覺就長這麼高了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哎，啊，是啊！我有事没事就在吃啊啃啊嚼啊，不知不觉就长这么高了。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Hah, ah, iya! Hidup normal—kamu tahu, makanan, makan, makan—lalu tiba-tiba aku setinggi ini."
Italian (IT): "Oh, ah, sì! A forza di mangiare, mangiare e ancora mangiare, ho raggiunto quest'altezza senza che me ne rendessi conto."
Turkish (TR): "Ha, ah, evet! Normal bir hayat—bilirsin, yemek, ziyafet, atıştırmak derken—birden bu kadar uzadım."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "Boys do grow fast, don't they? How tall are you?"
Steam (ST): "Growing just like a boy, I see. How tall are you now?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Boys will be boys, no? How tall are you?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「さすが男の子ね。身長はいくつくらいあるの？」
Russian (RU): "Мальчишки есть мальчишки, верно? Так какой у тебя рост?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Garotos crescem rápido, não? Qual a sua altura agora?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不愧是男孩子啊。身高是有多少了呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Indonesian (IDN): "Anak laki-laki memang tumbuh cepat, ya? Tinggimu berapa?"
Italian (IT): "Proprio come dovrebbe fare un ragazzo. Quanto sei alto adesso?"
Turkish (TR): "Erkekler gerçekten hızlı büyüyor, değil mi? Boyun kaç?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "I guess about 180 cm? No, wait, you missed your moment, you're supposed to jump in with "Did you do anything besides eat?!""
Steam (ST): "I guess about 180 cm? But Aunt Natsuhi, that's where you're supposed to say "Heck, sounds like all you did was eat"!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I guess about 180 cm? Ah, Oba-san, please, whenever you feel like it, feel free to say 'Stop stuffing yourself!'"
PC Japanese (JP): 「１８０かな？　つーか伯母さん、そこは、食べてばっかりじゃねぇかーって突っ込んでくださいよ〜ん！」
Russian (RU): "Думаю, около 180 см. Ах, тётя, ты упустила шанс сказать мне: 'Ты только и делал, что обжирался?!'"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Acho que uns 180 cm? Não, espera, você esqueceu algo, você esqueceu de dizer algo como "Você não fez nada além de comer?!""
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「一米八十吧？話說伯母啊，這裡應該說“你這不光顧著吃了嘛”之類的給我吐下槽嘛～！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「一米八十吧？话说伯母啊，这里应该说“你这不光顾着吃了嘛”之类的给我吐下槽嘛～！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Sekitar 180 cm, kurasa?" Tidak, tunggu, kau melewatkan momenmu, seharusnya kau langsung bilang "Apa kerjamu cuma makan?!"
Italian (IT): "Credo sul metro e ottanta? Ah, ma zia, qui dovresti dire qualcosa come: ‘ma non fai altro che mangiare?!’."
Turkish (TR): "Sanırım 180 cm civarı? Hayır, bekle, anını kaçırdın, "Yemek yemek dışında bir şey yaptın mı?!" diye araya girmen gerekiyordu."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "Huh? ......Ahh, *giggle*, I'm sorry."
Steam (ST): "Huh? ...Oh, *giggle*, I'm sorry."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Huh? ......Aah, *giggle*, I'm sorry."
PC Japanese (JP): 「え？……あぁ、くす、ごめんなさいね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「え？　……あぁ、くす、ごめんなさいね」
Russian (RU): "Что? ......Хи‐хи. Ах, извини."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hã? ......Ahh, *risos*, me desculpe."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哎？……啊，呵呵，對不起。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哎？……啊，呵呵，对不起。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Hah?" ......Ahh, *cekikikan*, maaf."
Italian (IT): "Eh...? Ahh, uhuhuh, scusami."
Turkish (TR): "Ha? ......Ahh, *giggle*, özür dilerim."

Umineko Project (UP): After a moment, she gave a small laugh, but it seemed she couldn't quite figure out what she was supposed to be laughing at.
Steam (ST): After a short pause, she did laugh with me, but it seemed she couldn't quite figure out what she was supposed to be laughing at.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oba-san, after a moment, gave a small laugh, but it seemed she couldn't quite figure out what she was supposed to be laughing at.
PC Japanese (JP): 伯母さんは遅れて笑いに付き合ってくれたが、どこが笑うべきツボか理解できてないようだった。
Russian (RU): После короткой паузы тётя слегка рассмеялась, но было видно, что она сама не может толком понять, над чем смеётся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por um momento, ela deu um pequeno sorriso, mas pareceu que ela não sabia bem se deveria estar rindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 伯母雖然慢半拍地笑了笑，但她好像根本沒理解到笑點在哪。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 伯母虽然慢半拍地笑了笑，但她好像根本没理解到笑点在哪。
Indonesian (IDN): Setelah beberapa saat, dia tertawa kecil, tapi sepertinya dia tidak begitu mengerti apa yang seharusnya ditertawakannya.
Italian (IT): La risata della zia arrivò in ritardo, ma sembrava che non avesse capito cosa ci fosse di divertente.
Turkish (TR): Bir süre sonra küçük bir kahkaha attı, ancak neye gülmesi gerektiğini tam olarak anlayamamış gibiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): This woman is Aunt Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}).
Steam (ST): This woman is Aunt Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}).
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This woman is Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}) oba-san.
PC Japanese (JP): この人は夏妃（なつひ）伯母さん。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): この人は夏妃伯母さん。
Russian (RU): Эта женщина — тётя Нацухи ({p:0:夏妃}).
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa mulher é a tia Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}).
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這位是{ruby:Natsuhi:夏妃}伯母。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这位是{ruby:Natsuhi:夏妃}伯母。
Indonesian (IDN): Wanita ini adalah Bibi Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}).
Italian (IT): Questa signora è la zia Natsuhi ({p:0:夏妃}) .
Turkish (TR): Bu kadın Natsuhi Teyze ({p:0:夏妃}).

Umineko Project (UP): She's the wife of the eldest son of the family, meaning she is my dad's older brother's wife.
Steam (ST): She's the wife of the eldest son of the family, meaning she's my father's older brother's wife.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She's the wife of the eldest son of the family, meaning she is my father's older brother's wife.
PC Japanese (JP): 親兄弟の長男の妻、つまり、うちの親父の兄の奥さんに当たる人だ。
Russian (RU): Она жена самого старшего сына в семье, то есть является женой старшего брата моего отца.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela é casada com o filho mais velho da família, o que significa que ela é esposa do irmão mais velho do meu pai.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她是長子的妻子，也就是說，是我爸的哥哥的太太。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她是长子的妻子，也就是说，是我爸的哥哥的太太。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia adalah istri putra tertua keluarga, yang berarti dia adalah istri kakak laki-laki ayahku.
Italian (IT): È la moglie del primogenito della famiglia, ossia la consorte del fratello maggiore del mio vecchio.
Turkish (TR): Ailenin en büyük oğlunun karısı, yani babamın ağabeyinin karısı.

Umineko Project (UP): Is it easier to get it if I call her Jessica's mother?
Steam (ST): Is it simpler if I just call her Jessica's mother?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Is it easier to get it if I call her Jessica's mother?
PC Japanese (JP): 朱志香の母親と言った方がわかりやすいか。
Russian (RU): Наверное, действительно будет проще, если я буду называть её матерью Джессики?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Fica mais fácil de entender se eu disser que ela é a mãe da Jessica?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說是朱志香的母親要更容易理解吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说是朱志香的母亲要更容易理解吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Lebih mudah dipahami jika kusebut dia ibu Jessica?
Italian (IT): Immagino sarebbe più facile capirlo se la chiamassi ‘la madre di Jessica’...
Turkish (TR): Ona Jessica'nın annesi desem daha kolay anlaşılır mı?

Umineko Project (UP): ...It feels bad to say it like this, but—not that I hated her—but I didn't particularly like her.
Steam (ST): ...It feels bad to say it like this, but while I didn't exactly dislike her, I didn't particularly like her either.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It feels bad to say it like this, but, not that I hated her, I didn't particularly like her.
PC Japanese (JP): …こう言っちゃ悪いが、嫌いってわけでもないが、特別好きでもない伯母さんだ。
Russian (RU): ...Может, это и плохо так говорить, но не то чтобы я ненавидел её, просто она мне не очень нравится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...É bem triste ter que dizer isso, mas — não é que eu odeie ela — contudo eu particularmente também não gosto dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這麼說是有點沒禮貌，但她是個雖不討厭，卻也不是特別讓我喜歡的伯母。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这么说是有点没礼貌，但她是个虽不讨厌，却也不是特别让我喜欢的伯母。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Rasanya tidak enak mengatakannya seperti ini, tapi—bukan berarti aku membencinya—tapi aku juga tidak terlalu menyukainya.
Italian (IT): È brutto da dire, però non è che la odio, ma non sono nemmeno particolarmente affezionato a lei.
Turkish (TR): ...Bunu böyle söylemek kötü hissettiriyor ama—ondan nefret ettiğimden değil—onu pek sevmezdim.

Umineko Project (UP): She never got into our kids' circle, and my only impression of her was as someone who always talked about complicated stuff with my parents while having a crabby expression on her face.
Steam (ST): She hardly ever spoke with us kids, and all my memories of her involve her talking to the adults about complicated things, with a scary look on her face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She never got into our kids' circle, and she always looked difficult to get along with. And it didn't help that she gave the impression that she was at odds with the other parents.
PC Japanese (JP): あまり子供の輪に入ってこないし、いつも気難しそうな顔をして、親たちと難しい話をしているという印象しかない。
Russian (RU): Она никогда не сближалась с нашей детской компанией, и с ней было очень нелегко ладить, разумеется, производимое ею впечатление того, что она находится на ножах с нашими родителями, тоже не способствовало налаживанию дружеских отношений.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela nunca se deu muito bem com as crianças, e a minha única impressão dela é de uma mulher que sempre está falando de coisas difíceis com meus pais, sempre com uma expressão de tristeza no rosto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 印象中不怎麼和小孩子說話，一直擺著張像是難以取悅的臉，和長輩們總是在說些難懂的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 印象中不怎么和小孩子说话，一直摆着张像是难以取悦的脸，和长辈们总是在说些难懂的话。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia tidak pernah masuk ke lingkaran kami anak-anak, dan satu-satunya kesanku tentang dia adalah seseorang yang selalu membicarakan hal-hal rumit dengan orang tuaku dengan wajah masam.
Italian (IT): Non interagiva molto con noi bambini, aveva sempre il viso imbronciato, e mi dava l'impressione che non facesse altro che discutere di questioni serie con i nostri genitori...
Turkish (TR): Çocukların çevresine hiç girmedi ve onunla ilgili tek izlenimim, yüzünde huysuz bir ifade varken ailemle her zaman karmaşık şeyler konuşan biri olduğuydu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...The fact is, that having barely ever exchanged words, I hesitated a lot even just now about how to approach her.
Steam (ST): ...In fact, since we hardly ever exchange words, I spent a long time trying to figure out how I should approach her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The fact is that having barely ever exchanged words, I hesitated a lot about how to approach her.
PC Japanese (JP): …実際、あまり言葉を交わしたことがなく、今もどう掴みを取ろうかだいぶ迷ったのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Факт в том, что я вечно колебался насчёт того, как следует подступиться к ней, так что, помимо редкого обмена несколькими словами, дальше дело не шло.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...O fato é que mal trocamos palavras, e eu sempre hesito em me aproximar dela, assim como agora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …實際上，我也沒和她怎麼說過話，就連剛才也猶豫了半天要怎麼與她相處。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …实际上，我也没和她怎么说过话，就连刚才也犹豫了半天要怎么与她相处。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Faktanya, karena hampir tidak pernah bertukar kata, aku sangat ragu bahkan sekarang tentang bagaimana mendekatinya.
Italian (IT): La verità è che non avevo parlato molto con lei, e non sapevo bene come approcciarla nemmeno tuttora.
Turkish (TR): ...Gerçek şu ki, neredeyse hiç kelime alışverişinde bulunmadığımız için, ona nasıl yaklaşacağım konusunda şu anda bile çok tereddüt ettim.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Aaand it was pretty much a flop.
Steam (ST): ...Though my efforts seem to have ended in failure.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And I ended up empty-handed.
PC Japanese (JP): …甲斐なく外してしまったがなー。
Russian (RU): ...И в конечном итоге я так ничего и не добился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E no fim, acaba sendo um fracasso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …當然最後也挺白費功夫的就是了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …当然最后也挺白费功夫的就是了。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Daan itu benar-benar gagal.
Italian (IT): Ma ormai avevo perso l'occasione...
Turkish (TR): ...Veee görünüşe göre eforlarım fiyaskoyla sonuçlanmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): The silverware had been tidily set up on the table, but the meal itself hadn't been brought in.
Steam (ST): The silverware sat neatly on the table, but the meal itself hadn't been brought in yet.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The silverware had been tidily set up on the table, but the meal itself hadn't been brought in.
PC Japanese (JP): テーブルの上には整然と食器が並べられていたが、まだ食事の配膳は始まっていなかった。
Russian (RU): Стол уже был аккуратно сервирован, но сама еда пока подана не была.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os talheres já estavam colocados na mesa, mas a refeição em si ainda não havia chegado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 桌上整齊地排列著餐具，不過還沒開始上菜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 桌上整齐地排列着餐具，不过还没开始上菜。
Indonesian (IDN): Peralatan perak sudah rapi diatur di meja, tapi makanan itu sendiri belum dihidangkan.
Italian (IT): L'argenteria era disposta sul tavolo in modo ordinato, ma il pasto non era ancora stato servito.
Turkish (TR): Çatal bıçak takımı masaya düzenli bir şekilde yerleştirilmişti, ancak yemeğin kendisi getirilmemişti.

Umineko Project (UP): As a rule, the meal doesn't start until the man at the head of the table has taken his seat.{n}So, as long as Grandfather—the highest ranked—didn't come, lunch would be indefinitely on hold. Not even the appetizers would come.
Steam (ST): As a general rule, you couldn't start a meal until the person sitting at the head of the table arrived. So, as long as Grandfather didn't come, lunch would be put on hold indefinitely. Not even the appetizers would arrive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In essence, until the man at the head of the table had taken his seat, the meal wouldn't start. So, as long as Grandfather, the highest ranked, didn't come, lunch would be indefinitely on hold. Not even the appetizers would come.
PC Japanese (JP): 基本的に、上席者が着席するまでは食事は始まらない。つまり、最上位の祖父さまが来ない限り、いつまでもお昼は始まらない。前菜すら来ないわけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 基本的に、上席者が着席するまでは食事は始まらない。{n}つまり、最上位の祖父さまが来ない限り、いつまでもお昼は始まらない。前菜すら来ないわけだ。
Russian (RU): В общем, пока человек во главе стола не займёт своё место, трапеза не начнётся.{n}Поэтому, пока дедушка, как самая влиятельная персона, не соизволит явиться, обед так и будет простаивать. Даже закусок, и тех не подадут.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como regra, a refeição nunca se inicia antes que o homem que senta na ponta da mesa chegue.{n}Por isso, como o vovô, que tem o patamar mais elevado — não chegou, o almoço não pode começar. Nem mesmo os aperitivos são servidos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一般來說，上座的人沒到是不能開始用餐的。{n}也就是說，在序列最高的爺爺沒來之前，再怎麼等也不能開飯。連前菜都不能上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一般来说，上座的人没到是不能开始用餐的。{n}也就是说，在序列最高的爷爷没来之前，再怎么等也不能开饭。连前菜都不能上。
Indonesian (IDN): Sebagai aturan, makan tidak dimulai sampai pria di kepala meja telah duduk.{n}Jadi, selama Kakek—yang paling tinggi pangkatnya—belum datang, makan siang akan ditunda tanpa batas. Bahkan makanan pembuka tidak akan datang.
Italian (IT): Di base, non avremmo cominciato a mangiare fino a quando la persona a capotavola non avrebbe preso posto. In altre parole, finché il nonno, alla cima della gerarchia, non sarebbe arrivato, il pranzo non avrebbe mai avuto inizio. Non sarebbero stati serviti neanche gli antipasti.
Turkish (TR): Kural olarak, masanın başındaki adam yerine oturana kadar yemek başlamaz.{n}Dolayısıyla, Büyükbaba—en yüksek rütbeli olan—gelmediği sürece, öğle yemeği süresiz olarak askıda kalacaktı. Mezeler bile gelmeyecekti.

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, this silence in the dining hall was the sound of our parents as they withstood their hunger and waited, on tenterhooks, for Grandfather to come.
Steam (ST): Simply put, the silence in this room was caused by our parents enduring their hunger while they waited for Grandfather to arrive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, while our parents withstood their hunger, the silence of the dining room would still wait for Grandfather to come.
PC Japanese (JP): つまりこの食堂の沈黙は、親たちが空腹を堪えながら祖父さまが来るのはまだかと待つものだったのである。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, хотя наши родители и сдерживали свой голод, они молча продолжали сидеть в ожидании дедушкиного прихода.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, o silêncio de nosso pais na sala de jantar, era de quem estava resistindo à fome e esperando a chegada do vovô.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 餐廳的沉默，正說明了我爸他們正一邊忍著空腹一邊在等爺爺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 餐厅的沉默，正说明了我爸他们正一边忍着空腹一边在等爷爷。
Indonesian (IDN): Dengan kata lain, keheningan di ruang makan ini adalah suara orang tua kami yang menahan lapar dan menunggu, dengan tegang, kedatangan Kakek.
Italian (IT): Motivo per cui il silenzio in questa sala era causato dai nostri genitori, che resistevano ai morsi della fame mentre aspettavano l'arrivo del nonno.
Turkish (TR): Başka bir deyişle, yemek salonundaki bu sessizlik, açlıklarına dayanmış ve diken üstünde Büyükbabanın gelmesini bekleyen ebeveynlerimizin sesiydi.

Umineko Project (UP): Except—the Grandfather I remembered always showed up at the right time when we ate together like this.
Steam (ST): However, the Grandfather from my memories would always show up on time to meals like this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's just that the Grandfather I remembered, when we ate together like this, always showed up at the right time.
PC Japanese (JP): ただ、俺の記憶の中の祖父さまは、こうして会食などがある時には必ず時間通りに現れたものだ。
Russian (RU): Вот только тот дедушка, которого я помню, когда мы вместе ели, всегда приходил вовремя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Exceto que — o vovô que eu me lembro sempre chegava na hora para comermos todos juntos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是，在我記憶中的爺爺，在這種會餐時總是能準時出現。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是，在我记忆中的爷爷，在这种会餐时总是能准时出现。
Indonesian (IDN): Kecuali—Kakek yang kuingat selalu datang tepat waktu ketika kami makan bersama seperti ini.
Italian (IT): Tuttavia, io mi ricordavo che il nonno era sempre puntuale quando mangiavamo insieme in questo modo...
Turkish (TR): Ancak—benim hatırladığım Büyükbaba, bu şekilde birlikte yemek yediğimizde her zaman tam zamanında gelirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ...He wouldn't ever have been so late as to have everyone else waiting on him.
Steam (ST): ...He was the kind of person who would never be so late that it kept everyone waiting, especially after the entire group had arrived.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...He was supposed to be the kind of person that would never be so late that he'd keep everyone waiting, even though they were all present.
PC Japanese (JP): …全員が揃ってなお待たせるほど遅刻するなどということはありえない人だったはず。
Russian (RU): ...Он никогда так не опаздывал, заставляя людей ждать, когда все они уже собрались.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ele nunca tinha chegado tão tarde, fazendo com que todos tivessem que esperar por ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …他不應該是個會在全員早已齊聚的情況下，還要再讓大家等上這麼久才姍姍來遲之人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …他不应该是个会在全员早已齐聚的情况下，还要再让大家等上这么久才姗姗来迟之人。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Dia tidak akan pernah terlambat sampai membuat orang lain menunggunya.
Italian (IT): Non era il tipo di persona che avrebbe tardato al punto da farci aspettare.
Turkish (TR): ...Herkesin onu beklemesine neden olacak kadar geç kalmazdı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Grandfather's pretty late. ......As far as I can remember, he was always strict about staying on time."
Steam (ST): "Grandfather's pretty late. ......As far as I can remember, he was always strict about time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「遅ぇな、祖父さま。……俺の記憶じゃ、時間に厳格な人だったと思うんだけどな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「遅ぇな、祖父さま。……俺の記憶じゃ、時間に厳格な人だったと思うんだけどな」
Russian (RU): "Дедушка опаздывает. ......Насколько я помню, он всегда был достаточно пунктуален."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O vovô está bem atrasado. ......Pelo que me lembro, ele sempre foi bem rigoroso quanto a estar sempre no horário."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爺爺好慢啊。……在我的記憶中，他可是個很守時的人啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爷爷好慢啊。……在我的记忆中，他可是个很守时的人啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kakek sangat terlambat. ......Seingatku, dia selalu ketat tentang tepat waktu."
Italian (IT): "Il nonno è in ritardo... Se ricordo bene, lui è uno estremamente puntuale."
Turkish (TR): "Büyükbaba oldukça geç kaldı. ......Hatırlayabildiğim kadarıyla, zamanında gelme konusunda her zaman çok katıydı."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, maybe six years ago, yeah. ...But not lately. Seriously, he's off in his own little world now—he doesn't even show up at family meals. ...I figured he'd at least stick around for today's meal, though."
Steam (ST): "Well, that might've been true six years ago, ...but it hasn't been that way lately. In fact, he's off in his own little world so often that he doesn't even show up at family meals. ...Still, I figured he'd at least come down today.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Well, that might've been true six years ago, ...but it hasn't been that way lately. Seriously, he's off in his own little world so often that he doesn't even show up at family meals. ...Even so, I figured that he'd at least stick around for today's meal.
PC Japanese (JP): 「あー、６年前はそうだったかもなぁ。…最近はそうでもねぇよ。というか、もう自分の世界オンリーって感じで会食にも顔を出さねぇぜ。さすがに今日くらいは足並みを揃えてくれるって思ってたんだけどな。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あー、６年前はそうだったかもなぁ。…最近はそうでもねぇよ。というか、もう自分の世界オンリーって感じで会食にも顔を出さねぇぜ。さすがに今日くらいは足並みを揃えてくれるって思ってたんだけどな」
Russian (RU): "Ну, шесть лет назад, возможно, так и было. ...Но в последнее время всё по‐другому. Серьёзно, он так часто погружается в свой воображаемый мир, что даже не выходит, чтобы отобедать со всей семьёй. ...Хотя мне казалось, что, как минимум, сегодня он всё‐таки соизволит пообедать с нами."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, ao menos há seis anos atrás. ...Mas não ultimamente. Sério, ele está tão obcecado em seu pequeno mundinho agora — que nem mesmo aparece para as refeições em família. ...Eu pensei que ao menos ele viria para a refeição de hoje."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊，在六年前是如此吧。…最近就不同嘞。倒不如說，他就好像只活在自己的世界中似的，連會餐時也不露臉嘞。虧我還以為今天他總該會下來露個臉配合一下。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊，在六年前是如此吧。…最近就不同嘞。倒不如说，他就好像只活在自己的世界中似的，连会餐时也不露脸嘞。亏我还以为今天他总该会下来露个脸配合一下。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Ya, mungkin enam tahun yang lalu. ...Tapi akhir-akhir ini tidak. Serius, dia sekarang di dunianya sendiri—bahkan tidak muncul di makan keluarga. ...Kupikir dia akan setidaknya hadir untuk makan hari ini."
Italian (IT): "Aah, questo forse valeva sei anni fa... ma ultimamente non è questo il caso. Come dire, non si fa vedere neanche ai pranzi e cene in famiglia, dato che è rinchiuso nel suo piccolo mondo... Pensavo che almeno per oggi avrebbe cambiato solfa..."
Turkish (TR): "Belki altı yıl önce, evet. ...Ama son zamanlarda değil. Cidden, artık kendi küçük dünyasında yaşıyor—aile yemeklerine bile gelmiyor. ...En azından bugünkü yemeğe gelir diye düşünmüştüm."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "...That said, if he doesn't turn up, I'll be a hell of a lot more relaxed and happier to boot."
Steam (ST): ...Then again, I feel a lot more relaxed and happy without him."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Still, I feel more relaxed and happier without him."
PC Japanese (JP): …まー、私ゃ来ない方が気楽で嬉しいけどよー。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…まー、私ゃ来ない方が気楽で嬉しいけどよー」
Russian (RU): "...Но если честно, без него я чувствую себя гораздо спокойней и счастливей."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Bem, eu me sinto muito mais feliz e relaxada sem ele aqui."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…不過要我來說的話，不來最好，樂得輕鬆。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…不过要我来说的话，不来最好，乐得轻松。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Tapi, jika dia tidak muncul, aku akan jauh lebih santai dan bahagia."
Italian (IT): "Beh, mi sento più felice e a mio agio se non viene."
Turkish (TR): "...Bununla birlikte, eğer gelmezse, çok daha rahat ve mutlu olacağım."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi

Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JP]
