Italian (IT): [=UP]
Turkish (TR): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): After being scolded by her mother, Jessica faced the other way, sticking her tongue out.
Steam (ST): When her mother scolded her, Jessica stuck her tongue out and looked away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 母親の夏妃伯母さんに叱られ、朱志香は舌を出しながらそっぽを向く。
Russian (RU): После замечания от своей матери, Джессике только и оставалось, что прикусить язык.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após ser repreendida por sua mãe, Jessica olhou para o outro lado, colocando a língua para fora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被母親責罵的朱志香邊吐了吐舌頭邊把頭轉開。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被母亲责骂的朱志香边吐了吐舌头边把头转开。
Indonesian (IDN): Setelah dimarahi ibunya, Jessica menghadap ke arah lain, menjulurkan lidahnya.
Italian (IT): Rimproverata da sua madre, Jessica si girò dall'altra parte, facendo la linguaccia...
Turkish (TR): Annesi tarafından azarlandıktan sonra Jessica dilini dışarı çıkararak diğer tarafa baktı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......No way around it.{n}Nothing to do but wait for the host to arrive.
Steam (ST): ......No way around it. Might as well wait until our host arrives.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......No way around it. Nothing to do but wait for the host to arrive.
PC Japanese (JP): ……仕方ねぇぜ。ホストさまがいらっしゃるのを待つとするか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……仕方ねぇぜ。{n}ホストさまがいらっしゃるのを待つとするか。
Russian (RU): ......Ну что тут поделаешь?{n}Ответ — ничего, так что остаётся только ждать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nenhuma educação de sua parte.{n}Nada para fazer além de esperar pela chegada do anfitrião.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……沒辦法。{n}就等到主人出來吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……没办法。{n}就等到主人出来吧。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Tidak ada jalan lain.{n}Tidak ada yang bisa dilakukan selain menunggu tuan rumah datang.
Italian (IT): Non c'era nulla da fare. Si doveva aspettare che arrivasse il padrone di casa.
Turkish (TR): ......Başka yolu yok.{n}Ev sahibinin gelmesini beklemekten başka yapacak bir şey yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): When I glanced at the clock, I saw that it was almost twenty minutes past twelve...
Steam (ST): When I glanced at the clock, I saw that it was almost 12:20...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I glanced at the clock, I saw that it was almost 12:20...
PC Japanese (JP): 時計を見ると、もうじき１２時の２０分を指そうとしていた…。
Russian (RU): Когда я посмотрел на часы, то увидел, что уже почти 12:20...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu olhei para o relógio, quando percebi que já havia passado vinte minutos desde o meio‐dia...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了下時鐘，指針馬上就要指向十二點二十分了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看了下时钟，指针马上就要指向十二点二十分了…。
Indonesian (IDN): Ketika aku melirik jam, sudah hampir dua puluh menit lewat dari pukul dua belas...
Italian (IT): Quando guardai l'orologio, le lancette puntavano quasi le 12:20...
Turkish (TR): Saate baktığımda saatin on ikiyi neredeyse yirmi dakika geçtiğini gördüm...

Umineko Project (UP): The aged master of the Ushiromiya head house, Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}).{n}He was there in his study.
Steam (ST): Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}), the aged Family Head of the Ushiromiya Head Family. This man...could be seen in his study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The old master of the Ushiromiya head house, Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}). His shape in his study.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮本家の老いた当主、右代宮金蔵（きんぞう）。その姿は、彼の書斎にあった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 右代宮本家の老いた当主、右代宮金蔵。{n}その姿は、彼の書斎にあった。
Russian (RU): Пожилой глава дома Уширомия, Уширомия Кинзо ({p:0:金蔵}).{n}Он всё так же пребывал в своем кабинете.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O velho chefe da família Ushiromiya, Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}).{n}Ele estava em seu estúdio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 右代宮本家的老當主，{ruby:Ushiromiya Kinzo:右代宮金藏}。{n}他正在自己的書房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 右代宫本家的老当主，{ruby:Ushiromiya Kinzo:右代宫金藏}。{n}他正在自己的书房。
Indonesian (IDN): Tuan tua rumah kepala Ushiromiya, Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}).{n}Dia ada di sana, di ruang belajarnya.
Italian (IT): Il vecchio capofamiglia del ramo principale degli Ushiromiya, Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}) Ushiromiya. Tale figura si trovava nel suo studio.
Turkish (TR): Ushiromiya malikanesinin yaşlı efendisi Ushiromiya Kinzo ({p:0:金蔵}).{n}Çalışma odasındaydı.

Umineko Project (UP): The clock showed noon, but he didn't even attempt to get up.
Steam (ST): The clock had already passed noon, but he didn't even attempt to rise from his seat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The clock showed noon, but he didn't even attempt to get up.
PC Japanese (JP): 時計は昼を指していたが彼は席を立とうとはしない。
Russian (RU): На часах уже был полдень, но он даже не пытался подняться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O relógio já marcava meio‐dia, mas ele nem se importou com isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 時針雖已指向正午，他卻沒有一點像要從椅子上站起來的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 时针虽已指向正午，他却没有一点像要从椅子上站起来的样子。
Indonesian (IDN): Jam menunjukkan tengah hari, tapi dia bahkan tidak berusaha untuk bangkit.
Italian (IT): L'orologio segnava mezzogiorno, ma lui non aveva intenzione di smuoversi dalla sua sedia.
Turkish (TR): Saat öğleyi gösteriyordu ama kalkmaya teşebbüs bile etmedi.

Umineko Project (UP): With reading glasses on his face, he stacked up old‐fashioned books with elaborately designed bindings one on top of another beside him, immersing himself in their reading.
Steam (ST): With his spectacles on, he built up a growing pile of books with elaborate bindings, which he then read intently.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Putting his spectacles on, he piled up one by one beside him old-fashioned books with elaborately designed bindings, and immersed himself in their reading.
PC Japanese (JP): 老眼鏡を掛けながら、凝った意匠の装丁がされた古めかしい本を次々に積み上げ、それらを読みふけることに没頭している。
Russian (RU): Надев очки, он разложил возле себя старинные книги в замысловатых переплётах и погрузился в чтение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com óculos de leitura sobre seu rosto, ele estava debruçado em livros à moda antiga, com elaboradas encadernações, um em cima do outro, imerso em sua leitura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他正戴著老花眼鏡，將裝訂精緻的古書一本又一本地堆疊在桌上，專心致志地埋頭深讀著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他正戴着老花眼镜，将装订精致的古书一本又一本地堆叠在桌上，专心致志地埋头深读着。
Indonesian (IDN): Dengan kacamata baca di wajahnya, dia menumpuk buku-buku kuno dengan sampul rumit satu di atas yang lain di sampingnya, tenggelam dalam membacanya.
Italian (IT): Indossando degli occhiali da lettura, impilò uno dopo l'altro dei libri antichi con copertine dalla raffinata rilegatura, e si immerse completamente nella loro lettura.
Turkish (TR): Yüzünde okuma gözlükleriyle, özenle tasarlanmış ciltleri olan eski moda kitapları yanında üst üste dizmiş, kendini okumaya vermişti.

Umineko Project (UP): It definitely didn't look like it was for his leisure; on the contrary, he exuded impatience, crisis, as though every minute, every second were precious.
Steam (ST): You couldn't really say that he was having too much fun to stop. Rather, he filled the room with a sense of impatience, or perhaps a sense of impending danger, as though every second wasted was a tragedy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It definitely didn't look like it was for his leisure; on the contrary, he exuded impatience, crisis, as though every minute, every second were precious.
PC Japanese (JP): それは楽しくて仕方がない、というよりは、一分一秒が惜しいような焦燥感、あるいは危機感のようなものすら感じられた。
Russian (RU): Трудно было предположить, что он так отдыхает; совсем напротив, он трясся от нетерпения, словно каждая минута была для него большой драгоценностью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Definitivamente não parecia que era parte de seu lazer; ao contrário, ele exalava impacientes crises, como se cada minuto, cada segundo fosse precioso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與其說是樂在其中，倒不如說是給人一種一分一秒都不能浪費的焦躁感，或者甚至說是危機感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与其说是乐在其中，倒不如说是给人一种一分一秒都不能浪费的焦躁感，或者甚至说是危机感。
Indonesian (IDN): Ini jelas tidak terlihat seperti untuk bersantai; sebaliknya, dia memancarkan ketidaksabaran, krisis, seolah setiap menit, setiap detik sangat berharga.
Italian (IT): Non lo stava facendo per svagarsi, ma al contrario, sembrava impaziente, come se ogni minuto, ogni secondo contasse, o che addirittura fosse in allerta per qualche pericolo.
Turkish (TR): Kesinlikle boş zamanını değerlendiriyor gibi görünmüyordu; tam tersine, sanki her dakika, her saniye değerliymiş gibi sabırsızlık, kriz yayıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The sealed room was dense with dancing dust particles, and the air stagnated with a mix of smells of various elixirs, each giving off its own suspicious stench.
Steam (ST): In this sealed room, a dense dust danced through the air, which was thick with the stench of chemicals that exuded a mix of suspicious odors.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The inside of the sealed room, where dense dust danced, stagnated, steeped in the suspicious stench of smelly medicine.
PC Japanese (JP): 締め切られた室内は、濃厚な埃が舞い、胡散臭い異臭を放つ薬品の臭いを混ぜこぜにした空気で澱んでいる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 閉め切られた室内は、濃厚な埃が舞い、胡散臭い異臭を放つ薬品の臭いを混ぜこぜにした空気で澱んでいる。
Russian (RU): Внутри давно не проветриваемой комнаты, где всё было окутано пылью, можно было ощутить подозрительно смрадный запах лекарств.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O quarto fechado era denso, com partículas de poeira voando, e o ar estava estagnado com a mistura do odor de diversos elixires, cada um exalando o seu próprio aroma suspeito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 密閉的室內，瀰漫著濃濃的飛塵。空氣中也混雜著藥品散發出的可疑氣味，淤積在屋裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 密闭的室内，弥漫着浓浓的飞尘。空气中也混杂着药品散发出的可疑气味，淤积在屋里。
Indonesian (IDN): Ruang tertutup itu padat dengan partikel debu yang menari-nari, dan udara stagnan dengan campuran bau berbagai ramuan, masing-masing mengeluarkan bau mencurigakan.
Italian (IT): All'interno della stanza sigillata aleggiava della fitta polvere, e l'aria stagnante si mischiava al tanfo dei medicinali, che emanavano un forte odore sospetto.
Turkish (TR): Kapalı oda dans eden toz parçacıklarıyla doluydu ve hava, her biri kendi şüpheli kokusunu yayan çeşitli iksirlerin kokularının karışımıyla durgunlaşmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...They were somehow sweet, and heavy.
Steam (ST): ...Those odors were somehow sweet...and heavy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Somehow, sweet, heavy.
PC Japanese (JP): しかもそれはどことなく甘く、重く。
Russian (RU): ...Этот густой сладкий запах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...De alguma forma, eram doces e pesados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且這氣味裡還多少帶著份甜膩與濃重。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且这气味里还多少带着份甜腻与浓重。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Bau mereka agak manis, dan berat.
Italian (IT): Tale odore entrava nelle narici, e aveva un che di dolciastro.
Turkish (TR): ...Bir şekilde tatlı ve ağırdılar.

Umineko Project (UP): For anyone with a good nose, the first thing they'd do after entering would be to open a window and ventilate the room.
Steam (ST): If anyone with a normal nose came in here, the first thing they'd do would be to open a window and ventilate this room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For anyone with a good nose, the first thing they'd do after entering would be to open a window and ventilate the room.
PC Japanese (JP): まともな鼻を持つ人間なら、入って最初にやることは間違いなく窓を開けて換気することだろう。
Russian (RU): Те, у кого с обонянием всё в порядке, зайди они внутрь этой комнаты, первым делом бросились бы открывать все окна, чтобы хорошенько проветрить её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Qualquer um com um bom olfato, logo após entrar, iria abrir a janela para ventilar o quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要是鼻子正常的人進來，第一件事肯定是開窗通風吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要是鼻子正常的人进来，第一件事肯定是开窗通风吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Bagi siapa pun yang memiliki hidung yang baik, hal pertama yang akan mereka lakukan setelah masuk adalah membuka jendela dan mengudarakan ruangan.
Italian (IT): Qualunque persona dall'olfatto funzionante che sarebbe entrata lì, avrebbe come prima cosa aperto le finestre per far circolare l'aria.
Turkish (TR): İyi bir burnu olan birinin içeri girdikten sonra yapacağı ilk şey bir pencere açıp odayı havalandırmak olurdu.

Umineko Project (UP): The knocking against the study door had been going on for a while.
Steam (ST): The knocking against the study door had been going on for a while.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The knocking against the study door had been going on for a while.
PC Japanese (JP): その書斎の扉を、さっきから叩き続ける音が繰り返されている。
Russian (RU): Стук в дверь кабинета всё не прекращался.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As batidas contra a porta do estúdio continuaram por um tempo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從剛才開始，書房的敲門聲就一直持續不斷。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从刚才开始，书房的敲门声就一直持续不断。
Indonesian (IDN): Ketukan di pintu ruang belajar sudah berlangsung cukup lama.
Italian (IT): Qualcuno stava bussando da un po' di tempo contro la porta di quello studio.
Turkish (TR): Çalışma odasının kapısının çalınması bir süredir devam ediyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): A voice calling "Father" sometimes mingled with the knocks.
Steam (ST): A voice calling "Father" sometimes mingled with the knocks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A voice calling 'Father' sometimes mingled with the knocks.
PC Japanese (JP): その音には時折、「お父さん」という声が混じっていた。
Russian (RU): Голос, зовущий "Отец", иногда смешивался со стуком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma voz chamando "pai" se misturava com as batidas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 敲門聲中時不時還夾雜著幾聲「爸」「爸」。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 敲门声中时不时还夹杂着几声「爸」「爸」。
Indonesian (IDN): Suara yang memanggil "Ayah" kadang bercampur dengan ketukan.
Italian (IT): Ai colpi ogni tanto si aggiungeva una voce che faceva: ‘padre’.
Turkish (TR): "Baba" diye seslenen bir ses bazen vuruşlara karışıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): As Kinzo heaved a deep sigh, he snapped shut the old book he had in his hands, and slammed it on the table.
Steam (ST): As Kinzo heaved a deep sigh, he snapped shut the old book in his hands and slammed it on the table.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Kinzo heaved a deep sigh, he snapped the old book he had in his hands shut and slammed it on the table.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は大きく溜め息をつくと、手にしている古書を乱暴に閉じて卓上に叩き付ける。
Russian (RU): Наконец, Кинзо глубоко вздохнул, закрыл старинную книгу, которую держал в руках, и хлопнул ею по столу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo suspirou profundamente, fechando seu velho livro que segurava, e o bateu contra a mesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏用力嘆了一口氣，粗暴地合上手中的古書，砸在桌上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏用力叹了一口气，粗暴地合上手中的古书，砸在桌上。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat Kinzo menarik napas dalam-dalam, dia menutup buku kuno yang ada di tangannya dengan keras, dan membantingnya ke meja.
Italian (IT): Inalando un sospiro profondo, Kinzo chiuse di scatto il libro che aveva tra le mani, e lo sbatté sul tavolo.
Turkish (TR): Kinzo derin bir iç çekerken elindeki eski kitabı kapatıp masanın üzerine çarptı.

Umineko Project (UP): Then, he yelled at Krauss who was continuing to knock on the door.
Steam (ST): Then, he yelled at Krauss, who was still knocking on the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, he yelled at Krauss who was still knocking on the door.
PC Japanese (JP): それから大声で、扉を叩き続けている蔵臼に怒鳴った。
Russian (RU): Затем он заорал Крауссу, который продолжал тарабанить в дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ele gritou para Krauss, que continuava a bater na porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後他向還在繼續敲門的藏臼大叫道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后他向还在继续敲门的藏臼大叫道。
Indonesian (IDN): Lalu, dia berteriak pada Krauss yang terus mengetuk pintu.
Italian (IT): Dopodiché gridò a squarciagola contro Klaus, che stava ancora bussando alla porta.
Turkish (TR): Sonra da kapıyı çalmaya devam eden Krauss'a bağırdı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Silence!! Will you not stop that noise, fool!!! Who taught you that doors shall be opened unto you if you knock?! They crucified that imbecile!! Do you wish the same upon yourself?!!"
Steam (ST): "Silence!! Enough with that racket, you fool!!! Who told you the door would be opened if you but knocked?! I'll crucify the imbecile!! Do you wish to suffer the same fate?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Silence!! Will you not stop that noise, fool!!! Who told you the door would open if you knocked!? I'll crucify the imbecile!! Do you wish to be as well!!??"
PC Japanese (JP): 「やかましいッ！！その音を止めぬか、愚か者ッ！！！　叩けば扉は開かれると誰が教えた！　その馬鹿者は磔にしたぞッ！！　お前もそうされたいのかッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「やかましいッ！！　その音を止めぬか、愚か者ッ！！！　叩けば扉は開かれると誰が教えた！　その馬鹿者は磔にしたぞッ！！　お前もそうされたいのかッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Тишина!!! Неужели ты никак не успокоишься, глупец!!! Кто тебе сказал, что двери распахнутся, если в них тарабанить?! Одного такого идиота уже четвертовали!!! Ты тоже этого хочешь?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Silêncio!! Você não vai parar com esse barulho, seu tolo?! Quem ensinou que as portas abrem se você ficar batendo nelas?! Crucificaram esse imbecil!! Quer que eu faça o mesmo com você?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「吵死了！！還不停下，蠢貨！！！是誰告訴你敲了門，門就會開的！那頭蠢驢已經被處以磔刑了！！你也想像他一樣嗎！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「吵死了！！还不停下，蠢货！！！是谁告诉你敲了门，门就会开的！那头蠢驴已经被处以磔刑了！！你也想像他一样吗！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Diam!! Tidak bisakah kau berhenti membuat kebisingan itu, bodoh!!! Siapa yang mengajarimu bahwa pintu akan terbuka jika kau mengetuk?! Mereka menyalib orang tolol itu!! Apakah kau ingin nasib yang sama?!!"
Italian (IT): "Fai silenzio!! Piantala di fare chiasso, bestia!!! Chi ti ha detto che avrei aperto la porta se tu avessi bussato?! Inchioderò su una croce quel deficiente!! Vuoi fare anche tu la sua stessa fine?!!"
Turkish (TR): "Sessizlik!!! Şu gürültüyü kesmeyecek misin, aptal!!! Kapıyı çalarsan sana kapıların açılacağını sana kim öğretti?! O embesili çarmıha gerdiler! Aynı şeyi kendin için de istiyor musun?!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "......Father. Today is the day of the family conference—it comes just once a year. Everyone has gathered downstairs. Please come out."
Steam (ST): "......Father, this is the day of the family conference, which happens only once a year, is it not? Everyone's gathered down below. Please come out."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Father. Isn't today the annual family conference? Everyone's gathered down there. Please come out."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……お父さん。年に一度の親族会議の日ではありませんか。皆、下に集まっています。どうかお出で下さい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……お父さん。年に一度の親族会議の日ではありませんか。皆、下に集まっています。どうかお出で下さい」
Russian (RU): "......Отец. Разве сегодня не ежегодное семейное собрание? Все уже собрались внизу. Пожалуйста, спустись."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Pai. Hoje é o dia da conferência da família — que só acontece uma vez por ano. Todos já estão reunidos. Venha, por favor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……爸。今天可是一年一度舉行親族會議的日子呀。大家都在下面等著呢。請務必出來見他們一下吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……爸。今天可是一年一度举行亲族会议的日子呀。大家都在下面等着呢。请务必出来见他们一下吧。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Ayah. Hari ini adalah hari konferensi keluarga—hanya sekali setahun. Semua orang sudah berkumpul di bawah. Tolong keluarlah."
Italian (IT): "...Padre. Non è forse oggi la riunione di famiglia annuale? Tutti sono al piano di sotto. Per favore, esci fuori."
Turkish (TR): "......Baba. Bugün aile konferansı günü—yılda sadece bir kez yapılıyor. Herkes alt katta toplandı. Lütfen dışarı çık."

Umineko Project (UP): Krauss called out to his father through the door.{n}...Kinzo always shut himself up in the study and hated letting even his family into the room.
Steam (ST): Krauss called out to his father through the door. ...Kinzo always shut himself up in the study, hating it when nearly anyone, even his family, entered the room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss called out to his father through the door....Kinzo always shut himself up in the study and hated it when even his family entered the room.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼は扉越しに父に呼びかける。…金蔵はいつも書斎に篭りきりで、家人すらも部屋に入れることを嫌った。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 蔵臼は扉越しに父に呼びかける。{n}…金蔵はいつも書斎に篭りきりで、家人すらも部屋に入れることを嫌った。
Russian (RU): Краусс продолжал звать отца через дверь.{n}...Кинзо всегда закрывался в кабинете и ненавидел, даже когда кто‐нибудь из его семьи заходил туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Krauss chamou por seu pai através da porta.{n}...Kinzo sempre se tranca em seu estúdio e odeia deixar até mesmo a sua família entrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼隔著門喊道。{n}…金藏一直都待在書房裡閉門不出，就算是親人也不讓進。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼隔着门喊道。{n}…金藏一直都待在书房里闭门不出，就算是亲人也不让进。
Indonesian (IDN): Krauss memanggil ayahnya melalui pintu.{n}...Kinzo selalu mengurung diri di ruang belajar dan benci membiarkan bahkan keluarganya masuk ke ruangan.
Italian (IT): Klaus stava chiamando suo padre attraverso la porta... Kinzo era sempre rinchiuso nel suo studio, e odiava l'idea che qualcuno entrasse nella sua stanza, persino i suoi servitori.
Turkish (TR): Krauss kapıdan babasına seslendi.{n}...Kinzo her zaman çalışma odasına kapanır ve ailesinin bile odaya girmesine izin vermezdi.

Umineko Project (UP): For that reason, Krauss had no choice but to call out thus from the corridor...
Steam (ST): For that reason, Krauss had no choice but to call to him from the corridor like this...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For that reason, Krauss had no choice but to call out thus from the corridor...
PC Japanese (JP): そのため、こうして廊下から言葉をかけるしかないのである…。
Russian (RU): По этой причине Крауссу ничего не оставалось, кроме как продолжать звать его из коридора...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, Krauss não teve escolha além de chamá‐lo do corredor...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，其他人只能像這樣在走廊上隔著門和他說話…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，其他人只能像这样在走廊上隔着门和他说话…。
Indonesian (IDN): Karena itu, Krauss tidak punya pilihan selain memanggil seperti ini dari koridor...
Italian (IT): Per questa ragione, Klaus non aveva altra scelta se non di parlargli dal corridoio...
Turkish (TR): Bu nedenle Krauss'un koridordan seslenmekten başka çaresi yoktu...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Molest me not!! Everyone? Who is "everyone"?! You refer to the fools trying to drag me out of here?!!"
Steam (ST): "Molest me not!! Just who is this "everyone" of which you speak? Do you mean the fools trying to drag me out of here?!!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Molest me not!! What do you mean by everyone? Do you mean the fools trying to drag me out of here?!!
PC Japanese (JP): 「私に構うでないッ！！　皆とは何か、私をここから引き摺り出そうとする者どもなのかッ！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私に構うでないッ！！　皆とは何か、私をここから引き摺り出そうとする者どもなのかッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ты отстанешь или нет!!! Все? Что ещё за 'все'?! Ты говоришь об идиотах, пытающихся вытащить меня отсюда?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não me perturbe!! Todos? Quem são "todos"?! Você se refere àqueles tolos que estão tentando me tirar daqui?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「少管我！！“大家”是什麼？是想把我從這裡拖出來的傢伙嗎！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「少管我！！“大家”是什么？是想把我从这里拖出来的家伙吗！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Jangan ganggu aku!! Semua orang? Siapa "semua orang" itu?! Kau bicara tentang orang-orang bodoh yang mencoba menyeretku keluar dari sini?!!"
Italian (IT): "Non disturbarmi!! Chi sarebbero questi ‘tutti’ che stanno provando a trascinarmi fuori di qui?!!"
Turkish (TR): "Beni rahatsız etmeyin!! Herkes mi? "Herkes" kim?! Beni buradan çıkarmaya çalışan aptalları mı kastediyorsun?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Then kill them all! Chop them up, make them into firewood, feed them to the witch's hearth!! Put a pot in that hearth and boil wormwood! And if still there remain imbeciles foolish enough to dare try to lure me out of here, force them to drink that broth of the Apocalypse! Preserve the remainder in liquor!"
Steam (ST): Then kill them all! Tear them apart, use their bodies for firewood, and feed them into the witch's hearth!! Put a pot in that hearth to boil the wormwood! Force the imbeciles who dare try to lure me out of here to drink the broth of the Apocalypse! I will soak their dregs in liquor!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then kill them all! Dismember them, make them into firewood, feed them to the witch's hearth!! Put a pot in that hearth and boil wormwood! Force the imbeciles who dare try to lure me out of here to drink the broth of the Apocalypse! I will soak their dregs in liquor!
PC Japanese (JP): ならば殺してしまえ！　バラバラにし薪にして魔女の炉にくべてしまえッ！！　その炉には鍋を掛けてニガヨモギを煮るがいい！　黙示録の煮汁はそれでも私をここから連れ出そうとする馬鹿者どもに飲ませてやれッ！　残りは酒に漬けるのだ！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ならば殺してしまえ！　バラバラにして薪にして魔女の炉にくべてしまえッ！！　その炉には鍋を掛けてニガヨモギを煮るがいい！　黙示録の煮汁はそれでも私をここから連れ出そうとする馬鹿者どもに飲ませてやれッ！　残りは酒に漬けるのだ！」
Russian (RU): "Ну и ладно, убейте их! Расчлените их, превратите их в дрова и растопите ими ведьмин очаг!!! Поставьте в тот очаг горшок и сварите в нём полынь! Заставьте безумцев, посмевших пытаться вытащить меня отсюда, испить этот отвар апокалипсиса! Я смешаю их останки с моим напитком!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Então mate todos eles! Pique‐os, faça uma fogueira com eles e alimente o coração da bruxa!! Faça um ensopado com seus corações e ferva com absinto!{n}E, se eles ainda forem tolos o bastante para tentar me tirar daqui, faça‐os beberem do caldo do Apocalipse! Preserve o que sobrar em licor!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那就把他們全殺了！砍成一塊塊當柴火送進魔女的爐子裡！！爐子上再掛口鍋煮上苦艾！！讓那些還想把我從這裡拉出去的蠢貨們，嘗嘗默示錄湯汁的滋味！剩下的就泡在酒裡！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那就把他们全杀了！砍成一块块当柴火送进魔女的炉子里！！炉子上再挂口锅煮上苦艾！！让那些还想把我从这里拉出去的蠢货们，尝尝默示录汤汁的滋味！剩下的就泡在酒里！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kalau begitu bunuh mereka semua! Potong mereka, jadikan kayu bakar, beri makan ke perapian penyihir!! Taruh panci di perapian itu dan rebus kayu apsintus! Dan jika masih ada orang bodoh yang cukup bodoh untuk berani mencoba memancingku keluar dari sini, paksa mereka minum kaldu Kiamat itu! Simpan sisanya dalam minuman keras!"
Italian (IT): "In tal caso, uccidili! Falli a pezzi, rendili legna da ardere, alimenta con essi il focolare della strega!! Su quel focolare mettici una pentola, e lasciaci bollire su dell'assenzio! Obbliga questi imbecilli che osano trascinarmi fuori di qui a bere l'intruglio dell'Apocalisse! Immergi i loro resti nel liquore!"
Turkish (TR): "O zaman hepsini öldürün! Onları doğrayın, yakacak odun yapın, cadının ateşine atın!! O ateşe de bir tencere koyup pelin otu kaynatın! Ve eğer hala beni buradan çıkarmaya cüret edecek aptallar kalırsa, onları kıyametin suyunu içmeye zorlayın! Kalanları likörde saklayın!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Aah, Genji, where are you?! Call for Genji!! Have my demonic absinthe prepared! The whispering of the green fairy reaches me no longer!! Aah, where is Genji, call for GenjiiIii!!!"
Steam (ST): Aah, where is Genji?! Call for Genji!! Have my demonic absinthe prepared! The whispering of the green fairy reaches me no longer!! Aah, where is Genji?! Bring him heeeeeere!!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Aah, Genji, where are you!? Call for Genji!! Have my demonic absinthe prepared! The whispering of the green fairy reaches me no longer!! Aah, Genji, where are you?! Call for GenjiiIii!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、源次はどこだ！　源次を呼べい！！　苦艾の魔酒を用意させろ！　緑の妖精の囁きが届かぬ！！　あぁ、源次はどこだッ、源次を呼べぇえぇいッ！！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ、源次はどこだ！　源次を呼べい！！　苦艾の魔酒を用意させろ！　緑の妖精の囁きが届かぬ！！　あぁ、源次はどこだッ、源次を呼べぇえぇいッ！！！」
Russian (RU): "А‐ах, Генджи, где же ты?! Приказываю, Генджи!!! Приготовь мой демонический абсент! Я больше не слышу голоса зелёной феи!!! А‐ах, Генджи, где же ты?! Приказываю тебе, Генджи‐и‐и‐и!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Aah, Genji, onde você está?! Chame o Genji!! Deixe o meu absinto demoníaco preparado! O sussurro da fada verde não pode mais me atingir!! Aah, onde está o Genji, chame o Genjiiiii!!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「啊啊，源次在哪！把源次叫來！！去叫他準備好苦艾的魔酒！我聽不見綠色妖精的低吟啊！！啊啊，源次在哪，快把源次叫來————！！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「啊啊，源次在哪！把源次叫来！！去叫他准备好苦艾的魔酒！我听不见绿色妖精的低吟啊！！啊啊，源次在哪，快把源次叫来————！！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Aah, Genji, di mana kau?! Panggil Genji!! Siapkan absint setanku! Bisikan peri hijau tidak sampai lagi kepadaku!! Aah, di mana Genji, panggil GenjiiIii!!!"
Italian (IT): "Aah, dov'è Genji?! Chiamami Genji!! Fagli preparare il mio infernale liquore all'artemisia! Il sussurrare della fata verde non arriva alle mie orecchie!!{n}Aah, dov'è Genji? Chiamami Genjiiiii!!!"
Turkish (TR): "Aah, Genji, neredesin?! Genji'yi çağırın!! İçkimi hazırla! Yeşil perinin fısıltısı artık bana ulaşmıyor!! Aah, Genji nerede, GenjiiIii'yi çağırın!!!"

Umineko Project (UP): ...Before the door, Krauss, Nanjo, and Genji kept waiting for the master of the house, who would not come out.
Steam (ST): ...On the other side of the door, Krauss, Nanjo and Genji kept waiting for the master of the house, who stubbornly refused to come out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Before the door, Krauss, Nanjo and Genji kept waiting for the master of the house, who would not come out.
PC Japanese (JP): …扉の前では、蔵臼と南條、そして源次が、出てこようとしない主を待ち続けている。
Russian (RU): ...Перед дверью стояли Краусс, Нанджо и Генджи, и все ждали хозяина дома, который так и не вышел.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Do outro lado da porta, Krauss, Nanjo e Genji continuavam esperando pelo mestre da casa, que não queria sair.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …站在門前的藏臼、南條，還有源次，他們都在等著不肯出來的主人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …站在门前的藏臼、南条，还有源次，他们都在等着不肯出来的主人。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Di depan pintu, Krauss, Nanjo, dan Genji terus menunggu tuan rumah, yang tidak mau keluar.
Italian (IT): ...Al di là della porta, Klaus, Nanjo e Genji continuavano ad attendere il padrone, che non aveva intenzione di uscire.
Turkish (TR): ...Kapının önünde Krauss, Nanjo ve Genji, dışarı çıkmayan evin efendisini beklemeye devam ettiler.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmph... ......Looks like he hates me to his core. My voice doesn't reach him anymore."
Steam (ST): "Hmph... ...Looks like he hates me to the core. My voice doesn't reach him anymore."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmph.........Looks like he hates me to his core. My voice doesn't reach him anymore."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふ…。……すっかり嫌われてしまったようだ。もう私の声では何も届かんよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ふ…。……すっかり嫌われてしまったようだ。もう私の声では何も届かんよ」
Russian (RU): "Хмф... ......Похоже, что он ненавидит меня до глубины души. Мой голос больше не доходит до него."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmph.........Parece que ele realmente me odeia. Minha voz não é mais capaz de alcançá‐lo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哼…。……看來我是被徹底討厭了。我的聲音已經傳不進他耳中了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哼…。……看来我是被彻底讨厌了。我的声音已经传不进他耳中了。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Hmph... ......Sepertinya dia benar-benar membenciku. Suaraku tidak sampai lagi padanya."
Italian (IT): "Hmph... Sembra proprio che mi odi dal profondo. Non importa cosa gli dica, ormai la mia voce non lo raggiunge."
Turkish (TR): "Hmph... ......Benden iliklerine kadar nefret ediyor gibi görünüyor. Sesim artık ona ulaşmıyor."

Umineko Project (UP): Krauss shrugged as though saying "It's no use", and smiled bitterly.
Steam (ST): Krauss shrugged as though saying "It's no use" and smiled bitterly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss shrugged as though saying 'It's no use' and smiled bitterly.
PC Japanese (JP): 蔵臼は、やれやれという風に肩をすくめて苦笑いをしてみせる。
Russian (RU): Краусс пожал плечами, как бы говоря "что тут поделаешь", и горько улыбнулся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Krauss deu de ombros e disse "Não adianta", sorrindo amargamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 藏臼無可奈何地聳了聳肩，露出了苦笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 藏臼无可奈何地耸了耸肩，露出了苦笑。
Indonesian (IDN): Krauss mengangkat bahu seolah berkata "Tidak ada gunanya", dan tersenyum pahit.
Italian (IT): Klaus fece spallucce sconsolato, e fece un amaro sorriso...
Turkish (TR): Krauss "Faydası yok" der gibi omuz silkti ve acı acı gülümsedi.

Umineko Project (UP): ...He himself hadn't believed for a moment that his father would answer his calls.{n}However, as it was the duty of the eldest son, he had formally made the request.
Steam (ST): ...From the beginning, he hadn't really expected his Father to respond to his calls. However, since it was the duty of the eldest son, he had tried as a formality.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...He himself hadn't really believed his father would answer his calls. However, as it was the duty of the eldest son, he had formally made the request.
PC Japanese (JP): …自分の呼びかけに父が応じるとは鼻から思ってはいない。しかし長男の務めとして、形式的に声を掛けただけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …自分の呼びかけに父が応じるとは端から思ってはいない。{n}しかし長男の務めとして、形式的に声を掛けただけだ。
Russian (RU): ...Он и сам не больно надеялся, что отец исполнит его просьбу.{n}Однако следуя своему положению старшего сына, он обратился с формальной просьбой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ele mesmo não acreditava que seu pai fosse lhe responder.{n}Porém, é dever do filho mais velho ir chamá‐lo formalmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …他早就心知肚明父親不會理睬自己。{n}只是出於長子的義務，上來喊一喊做做樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …他早就心知肚明父亲不会理睬自己。{n}只是出于长子的义务，上来喊一喊做做样子。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Dia sendiri tidak percaya sejenak pun bahwa ayahnya akan menjawab panggilannya.{n}Tapi, karena itu adalah tugas anak tertua, dia secara formal membuat permintaan.
Italian (IT): Non aveva mai creduto che suo padre avrebbe risposto alla chiamata. Tuttavia, lo interpellò per formalità, in quanto era dovere del primogenito.
Turkish (TR): ...Kendisi de babasının çağrılarına cevap vereceğine bir an bile inanmamıştı.{n}Ancak, bu en büyük oğlun görevi olduğu için, ricada bulunmuştu.

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "......Kinzo‐san. Your sons, daughters, and grandchildren have come to see you, you know... How about you show your face, just a little...?"
Steam (ST): "......Kinzo-san, your sons, daughters and grandchildren have come to see you, have they not...? Could you just let them see your face, if only for a short while...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Kinzo-san. Aren't your sons and daughters and your grandchildren coming to see you...? How about you show your face, just a little...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……金蔵さん。あんたの顔を見に、息子や娘や孫たちが来てるんじゃないか…。ちょっと顔を見せてやったらどうだね…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……金蔵さん。あんたの顔を見に、息子や娘や孫たちが来てるんじゃないか…。ちょっと顔を見せてやったらどうだね…」
Russian (RU): "......Кинзо‐сан. Разве это не ваши сыновья, дочери и внуки приехали, чтобы увидеть вас?.. Почему бы вам хотя бы ненадолго не показать своё лицо?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Kinzo‐san. Seus filhos, filhas e netos vieram para ver você, sabia...? Que tal ir até lá, apenas por um instante...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……金藏先生。兒子、女兒、孫子孫女們都來看你了啊…。就稍微出來一下，和他們見一見面吧…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……金藏先生。儿子、女儿、孙子孙女们都来看你了啊…。就稍微出来一下，和他们见一见面吧…」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Kinzo-san. Putra-putrimu dan cucu-cucumu sudah datang untuk menemuimu, kau tahu... Bagaimana kalau kau tunjukkan wajahmu, sedikit saja...?"
Italian (IT): "...Kinzo-san. I tuoi figli, le tue figlie, i tuoi nipoti, non sono forse venuti qui per vedere la tua faccia...? Che ne dici di farti vedere solo per un po'...?"
Turkish (TR): "......Kinzo-san. Oğulların, kızların ve torunların seni görmeye geldi, biliyorsun... Birazcık yüzünü göstermeye ne dersin...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Shut up, be silent!!! You dare admonish me, Nanjo?!!{n} I do not call for you, I said to call for Genji!! Now hurry, call for him this instant! Time is short—the apostles are already readying their trumpets—why do you not understand this, you foolish sheep!!"
Steam (ST): "Shut up, be silent!!! You dare to admonish me, Nanjo?!! {n}I never told anyone to get you, I told them to get Genji!! Now call for him immediately! Time is short—the apostles are already readying their trumpets—why do you not understand this, you foolish sheep!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Shut up, be silent!!! Do you admonish me, Nanjo?!!{n} I do not call for you lot, I said to call for Genji!! Now call for him immediately! Time is short, the apostles are already readying their trumpets! Why do you not understand, you foolish sheep!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うるさい黙れッ！！！　私に意見するというか南條ッ！！{n}　貴様など呼んではおらぬ、私は源次を呼べと言ったのだ！！　さぁ急げ、すぐに呼べ！　時間は常に有限だ、使徒たちはすでにラッパを構えているぞ、なぜにそれがわからぬか愚かな羊どもめッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うるさい黙れッ！！　私に意見するというか南條ッ！！{n}貴様など呼んではおらぬ、私は源次を呼べと言ったのだ！！　さぁ急げ、すぐに呼べ！　時間は常に有限だ、使徒たちはすでにラッパを構えているぞ、なぜにそれがわからぬか愚かな羊どもめッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Молчать, всем молчать!!! Ты пытаешься меня учить, Нанджо?!!{n} Я вызывал не тебя, я сказал позвать Генджи!!! Теперь быстро зовите его сюда! Времени осталось мало, апостолы уже готовят свои трубы! Почему вы этого никак не поймёте, вы, стадо баранов!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Cale a boca, fique quieto!!! Você ousa admoestar‐me, Nanjo?!{n} Eu não pedi para chamá‐lo, eu disse para chamar o Genji!! Vamos, rápido, chame ele neste instante! O tempo é curto — os apóstolos já estão tocando suas trombetas — por que você não entende, sua tola ovelha?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「別吵閉嘴！！！南條你是在對我提意見嗎！！{n}我沒在叫你，我說了是叫源次！！快點，馬上叫來！時間是有限的，使徒們早已經擺好了吹喇叭的姿勢，為什麼就不明白呢，愚蠢的綿羊們！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「别吵闭嘴！！！南条你是在对我提意见吗！！{n}我没在叫你，我说了是叫源次！！快点，马上叫来！时间是有限的，使徒们早已经摆好了吹喇叭的姿势，为什么就不明白呢，愚蠢的绵羊们！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Diam, diamlah!!! Kau berani menasehatiku, Nanjo?!!{n} Aku tidak memanggilmu, aku bilang panggil Genji!! Sekarang cepat, panggil dia sekarang! Waktu singkat—para rasul sudah menyiapkan terompet mereka—kenapa kau tidak mengerti ini, domba bodoh!!"
Italian (IT): "Stai zitto, taci!!! Osi giudicarmi, Nanjo?!!{n} Ho detto di chiamare Genji, non te!! Muoviti, chiamalo subito! Il tempo sta per giungere, gli angeli stanno già preparando le loro trombe, perché non lo capite, sciocche pecore?!!"
Turkish (TR): "Kapa çeneni, sessiz ol!!! Ne cüretle beni azarlarsın, Nanjo?!!{n} Ben seni çağırmadım, Genji'yi çağırdım!! Şimdi acele et, hemen çağır onu! Zaman daralıyor—havariler trompetlerini hazırlamaya başladılar bile—bunu neden anlamıyorsun, seni aptal koyun!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo slammed the old, heavy book on the table over and over.{n}The racket obviously indicated his highest displeasure.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "I'm going back downstairs. ......It would be a waste to let that lunch Gohda's so proud of get any colder. It's one of the few things the others have to look forward to here. ...Hmph."
Steam (ST): "I'm going back downstairs. ......It would be a waste to let the fruits of Gohda's prized cooking talent get any colder. It's one of the few things our relatives can look forward to when they come to this house. ...Hmph."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I'm going back downstairs. ......It would be a waste to let that lunch Gohda's so proud of get any colder. It's one of the few things we can look forward to...in this family. ...Hmph."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私は下に戻る。……郷田の自慢のランチをこれ以上、無駄に冷ましてしまうことはない。親類たちにとって、当家での数少ない楽しみだろうからな。…ふ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私は下に戻る。……郷田の自慢のランチをこれ以上、無駄に冷ましてしまうことはない。親類たちにとって、当家での数少ない楽しみだろうからな。…ふ」
Russian (RU): "Я пошёл вниз. ......Не могу позволить, чтобы обед, которым Года так гордится, успел остыть. Это одна из тех немногих вещей, которые мы с нетерпением ждём... в этой семье. ...Хмф."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu vou descer. ......Seria um desperdício deixar a comida que o Gohda tanto se orgulha esfriar. É uma das poucas coisas que essa família ainda pode aproveitar aqui. ...Hmph."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我先下去了。……沒理由讓鄉田的拿手好菜就這麼白白冷掉。畢竟對親戚們來說，這可是在本宅為數不多的樂趣之一呢。…哼。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我先下去了。……没理由让乡田的拿手好菜就这么白白冷掉。毕竟对亲戚们来说，这可是在本宅为数不多的乐趣之一呢。…哼。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Aku akan kembali ke bawah. ......Akan sia-sia membiarkan makan siang yang Gohda begitu banggakan menjadi lebih dingin. Itu salah satu dari sedikit hal yang bisa dinanti-nantikan orang lain di sini. ...Hmph."
Italian (IT): "Io torno di sotto... Non possiamo lasciare che il pranzo preparato da Gouda con tanta fierezza si raffreddi ulteriormente. È una delle poche cose che i parenti apprezzano di questa famiglia... Hmph."
Turkish (TR): "Ben aşağı iniyorum. ......Gohda'nın gurur duyduğu öğle yemeğinin daha fazla soğumasına izin vermek yazık olur. Diğerlerinin burada dört gözle beklediği birkaç şeyden biri. ...Hmph."

Russian (RU): Кинзо вернулся к своему сиденью и сдвинул выполненный в старом стиле рычаг на столе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo retornou ao seu assento no estúdio e pressionou um velho interruptor sobre a mesa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 書房中的金藏坐回椅子上，按下了桌上古風的按鈕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 书房中的金藏坐回椅子上，按下了桌上古风的按钮。
Indonesian (IDN): Kinzo kembali ke kursinya di ruang belajar dan menekan saklar kuno di meja.
Italian (IT): Kinzo tornò alla sedia nel suo studio, e premette un pulsante sulla scrivania dallo stile antiquato...
Turkish (TR): Kinzo çalışma odasındaki yerine döndü ve masanın üzerindeki eski moda bir düğmeye bastı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...After a small delay, the heavy sound of the door unlocking could be heard.
Steam (ST): ...After a small delay, the heavy sound of the door unlocking could be heard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …すると少しだけ遅れて、扉の施錠が開く重い音が聞こえた。
Russian (RU): ...Спустя пару секунд, раздался тяжёлый звук, означающий, что дверь открывается.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Após um pequeno intervalo, o pesado som da porta se abrindo pôde ser ouvido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不一會兒便傳來一聲沉重的聲響，門上的鎖被打開了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不一会儿便传来一声沉重的声响，门上的锁被打开了。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Setelah sedikit penundaan, suara berat pintu yang terbuka bisa terdengar.
Italian (IT): Dopo un po' di tempo, si aprì lentamente la serratura della porta, facendo un forte rumore.
Turkish (TR): ...Küçük bir gecikmeden sonra kapının ağır sesi duyuldu.

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo believed that his family might try to break into his study.
Steam (ST): Kinzo was convinced that his family wanted to make a mess of his study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo believed that his family might try to break in his study.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は自分の書斎を家人が荒らそうとしていると信じていた。
Russian (RU): Кинзо полагал, что его семья может попытаться вломиться к нему в кабинет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo acreditava que sua família poderia tentar trancá‐lo no estúdio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏堅信，家人想把他的書房弄得一團糟。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏坚信，家人想把他的书房弄得一团糟。
Indonesian (IDN): Kinzo percaya bahwa keluarganya mungkin mencoba masuk ke ruang belajarnya.
Italian (IT): In passato, Kinzo credette che un membro della villa avesse provato ad irrompere nel suo studio.
Turkish (TR): Kinzo, ailesinin çalışma odasına zorla girmeye çalışabileceğini düşünürdü.

Umineko Project (UP): Perhaps someone once opened the window for some air and scattered some important documents or something, and that had made him extremely upset.
Steam (ST): Or perhaps someone had once opened the window for some air and ended up scattering things that, to him, were important research materials, leaving him in a terrible mood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Perhaps someone once opened the window for some air and scattered important documents and other stuff? Is that what made him so nasty?
PC Japanese (JP): あるいは、換気しようと誰かが窓を開けた際に彼にとっての重要な資料などが飛び散り、それがひどく彼を不愉快にさせたのか。
Russian (RU): Быть может, однажды кто‐то, желая впустить свежего воздуха в кабинет, открыл окно, и ветер разбросал важные документы и другие вещи? Может, это и стало причиной его злой нетерпимости и неприязни?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além disso, uma vez alguém abriu a janela e o vento levou diversos documentos importantes e outras coisas, o que o deixou profundamente irritado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 或許是因為之前有人想換換房間的空氣，打開了窗吹散了對他來說很重要的資料，結果讓他感到非常不愉快吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 或许是因为之前有人想换换房间的空气，打开了窗吹散了对他来说很重要的资料，结果让他感到非常不愉快吧。
Indonesian (IDN): Mungkin seseorang pernah membuka jendela untuk udara dan menebarkan beberapa dokumen penting atau sesuatu, dan itu membuatnya sangat marah.
Italian (IT): Forse qualcuno una volta aveva aperto la finestra per cambiare l'aria e fece volare via dei documenti importanti, mettendolo così di pessimo umore...
Turkish (TR): Belki de birileri hava almak için pencereyi açmış ve bazı önemli belgeleri etrafa saçmıştı, ve bu onu son derece üzmüştü.

Umineko Project (UP): ...Now, Kinzo had placed a secure lock in his room, making it so that without his permission nobody could enter, and locking himself in the dungeon he himself created.
Steam (ST): ...Kinzo had outfitted his room with a formidable lock, preventing anyone from entering without his permission and thereby sealing himself in a jail of his own making.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Now, Kinzo had placed a secure lock in his own room, making it so that without his permission nobody could enter, and locking himself in the dungeon he'd created.
PC Japanese (JP): …今では金蔵は、自分の部屋に厳重な施錠を施し、自分の許可がなければ誰も入室できないようにして、自ら作った座敷牢に自らを閉じ込めているのだった。
Russian (RU): ...Кинзо установил надёжный замок, препятствующий доступу в комнату, и теперь никто не мог войти в неё без его разрешения. Вот так он заперся в созданном им самим подземелье.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Por isso, Kinzo colocou uma trava de segurança em seu quarto, fazendo com que ninguém pudesse entrar sem permissão, se trancando no calabouço que ele mesmo criou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …現在金藏給自己的房間上了很複雜的鎖，將自己關進了這座親手打造的牢獄之中，沒有他的允許誰都進不來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …现在金藏给自己的房间上了很复杂的锁，将自己关进了这座亲手打造的牢狱之中，没有他的允许谁都进不来。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Sekarang, Kinzo telah memasang kunci yang aman di ruangannya, membuatnya sehingga tanpa izinnya tidak ada yang bisa masuk, dan mengurung dirinya di penjara yang dia ciptakan sendiri.
Italian (IT): Pertanto, Kinzo aveva dotato la sua stanza di una robusta serratura, e si rinchiuse all'interno di una cella costruita con le sue stesse mani, facendo in modo che nessuno potesse entrare senza il suo permesso.
Turkish (TR): ...Kinzo odasına güvenli bir kilit yerleştirmiş, kendi izni olmadan kimsenin giremeyeceği bir hale getirmiş ve kendisini kendi yarattığı zindana kilitlemişti.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji, who he trusted the most, was relatively free to enter the room, but even that was not absolute.
Steam (ST): Genji, whom he trusted the most, was relatively free to enter the room, but even that didn't always hold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji, who he trusted the most, was relatively free to enter the room, but that was also not absolute.
PC Japanese (JP): もっとも信頼されている源次は比較的入室を許されているが、それも絶対ではない。
Russian (RU): Генджи, больше всех пользующийся его доверием, мог сравнительно свободно входить и выходить из комнаты, но и это право не было абсолютным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji, que é a pessoa na qual ele mais confia, é relativamente livre para entrar no quarto quando quiser, mas não é algo absoluto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然深受信賴的源次比較容易獲得進入的允許，但那也不是絕對的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然深受信赖的源次比较容易获得进入的允许，但那也不是绝对的。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji, yang paling dia percayai, relatif bebas masuk ke ruangan, tetapi bahkan itu tidak mutlak.
Italian (IT): Egli aveva concesso a Genji, colui di cui più si fidava, il permesso di entrare relativamente a piacimento nella stanza, ma neanche lui era intoccabile.
Turkish (TR): En çok güvendiği kişi olan Genji odaya girmekte nispeten özgürdü, ancak bu bile mutlak değildi.

Umineko Project (UP): If Kinzo was in a bad mood, even he wouldn't be able to enter.
Steam (ST): If Kinzo was in a bad mood, even Genji wouldn't be able to enter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If Kinzo was in a bad mood, even he wouldn't be able to enter.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵の機嫌が悪ければ入ることはできない。
Russian (RU): Если Кинзо случалось быть в особо дурном настроении, то войти не мог даже Генджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se Kinzo estiver de mau humor, nem mesmo ele é capaz de entrar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏心情不好的時候也一樣會被拒之門外。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏心情不好的时候也一样会被拒之门外。
Indonesian (IDN): Jika Kinzo sedang dalam suasana hati yang buruk, bahkan dia tidak akan bisa masuk.
Italian (IT): Se Kinzo era di cattivo umore, non poteva entrare...
Turkish (TR): Kinzo kötü bir ruh halindeyse, o bile giremezdi.

Umineko Project (UP): .........Anyone else would be limited to holding a conversation through the door, not even seeing his face.
Steam (ST): .........Anyone else would be limited to holding a conversation through the door, unable even to see Kinzo's face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………それ以外の人間には、顔すら合わせようとせず、扉越しに会話をするのがせいぜい。
Russian (RU): .........Всем остальным приходилось довольствоваться разговором через дверь, не видя его лица.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Qualquer outro acaba sendo limitado a ter uma conversa pela porta, sem nem poder ver seu rosto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……至於其他的人，別說是見面，最多也就只能隔著門說說話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……至于其他的人，别说是见面，最多也就只能隔着门说说话。
Indonesian (IDN): Orang lain akan terbatas pada percakapan melalui pintu, bahkan tidak melihat wajahnya.
Italian (IT): Tutti gli altri al massimo dialogavano con lui attraverso la porta, senza neanche poterlo guardare in faccia.
Turkish (TR): .........Diğer herkes onun yüzünü bile görmeden kapıdan konuşmakla sınırlı kalırdı.

Umineko Project (UP): And most of the time, they wouldn't even get a real conversation.
Steam (ST): And most of the time, what they got could hardly be called a conversation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And most of the time, they wouldn't even get a real conversation.
PC Japanese (JP): しかも多くの場合、それは会話として成り立たなかった。
Russian (RU): А в большинстве случаев даже и такого разговора не получалось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na maioria das vezes, eles nem mesmo têm uma conversa de verdade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且多數情況，那連對話都算不上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且多数情况，那连对话都算不上。
Indonesian (IDN): Dan sebagian besar waktu, mereka bahkan tidak akan mendapatkan percakapan yang nyata.
Italian (IT): E nella maggior parte dei casi, non lo si poteva neanche definire un dialogo.
Turkish (TR): Ve çoğu zaman gerçek bir sohbet bile edemeyeceklerdi.

Umineko Project (UP): However, that didn't pose any particular problem for the family.
Steam (ST): However, this didn't trouble the rest of the family much.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, that didn't become a big problem for the family.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、それらは家人にとってさしたる問題にはならなかった。
Russian (RU): Однако это не доставляло семье больших хлопот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, isso não representa nenhum tipo de problema para a família.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，這對他的家人來說卻沒成為什麼大問題。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，这对他的家人来说却没成为什么大问题。
Indonesian (IDN): Namun, itu tidak menimbulkan masalah khusus bagi keluarga.
Italian (IT): Ma per i membri della villa, questo era un problema trascurabile.
Turkish (TR): Ancak bu durum aile için özel bir sorun teşkil etmiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): That was because they had no reason to go out of their way to interfere with the retirement of the cantankerous and aged head; the fact that he was completely immersed in his odd research and always locked up in his hideaway was something of a benefit.
Steam (ST): After all, it just wasn't worth the effort to disturb this aging Family Head, who was impossible to please and always stayed shut away, immersed in his research.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because going to the trouble of speaking to the aged Head, who was impossible to please, completely immersed in his odd research, and always locked up in his hideaway, just wasn't worth the effort.
PC Japanese (JP): 気難しくなり、自らの怪しげな研究に没頭し引き篭もってくれる老いた当主の隠居に、わざわざ口を挟む理由もなかったからである。
Russian (RU): Ни у кого просто не возникало желания напрасно тратить силы на разговор с совершенно не подлежащим никакому ублажению пожилым главой, погружённым в свои странные исследования, запершись в своём убежище.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso porque eles não têm nenhum motivo para interferir na aposentadoria do velho rabugento. O fato é que ele estava completamente imerso em sua estranha pesquisa, e ficar sempre trancado em seu esconderijo era como um benefício.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畢竟，難伺候的老當主已經關起門來隱居，全身心投入於了自己那可疑的研究裡，那自然也犯不著置喙。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毕竟，难伺候的老当主已经关起门来隐居，全身心投入于了自己那可疑的研究里，那自然也犯不着置喙。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu karena mereka tidak punya alasan untuk ikut campur dengan pengasingan kepala keluarga yang pemarah dan tua; fakta bahwa dia sepenuhnya tenggelam dalam penelitian anehnya dan selalu terkunci di persembunyiannya adalah sesuatu yang menguntungkan.
Italian (IT): Non avevano motivo di prendersi la briga di intromettersi in merito al ritiro dell'anziano capofamiglia, un uomo incontentabile che si era barricato per immergersi nelle sue bizzarre ricerche...
Turkish (TR): Çünkü huysuz ve yaşlı reisin emekliliğine müdahale etmek için hiçbir sebepleri yoktu; tamamen tuhaf araştırmalarına dalmış olması ve her zaman gizlendiği yerde kilitli kalması bir avantajdı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......They made the most of his refusal to leave the study, entrusting him to the hands of the servants, while they themselves kept their distance.
Steam (ST): Taking advantage of his refusal to leave his room, they supported his isolation, putting his care entirely into the hands of the servants.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......They were happy that he didn't come out of his study and, putting him in the hands of the servants, they themselves also tried to avoid him.
PC Japanese (JP): ……書斎から出てこないのを幸いに、使用人たちに世話を任せきりにして、自分たちもまた、隔離しているつもりなのだったから。
Russian (RU): ......Все были вполне довольны тем, что он не покидал своего кабинета, предоставив заботу о нём слугам, и старались его избегать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eles ficaram felizes por ele não sair mais do estúdio e o confiaram aos serviçais enquanto mantinham a máxima distância possível dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而且，他們自己也趁著老爺子不出書房，把照顧他的工作全推了給傭人，想就這麼把金藏隔離起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而且，他们自己也趁着老爷子不出书房，把照顾他的工作全推了给佣人，想就这么把金藏隔离起来。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Mereka memanfaatkan penolakannya untuk meninggalkan ruang belajar, mempercayakannya kepada para pelayan, sementara mereka sendiri menjaga jarak.
Italian (IT): Lieti che non uscisse dal suo studio, e avendo anche loro intenzione di isolarsi da lui, lo lasciarono nelle mani dei domestici.
Turkish (TR): ......Çalışma odasından çıkmayı reddetmesinden en iyi şekilde yararlandılar, kendileri mesafelerini korurken onu hizmetkârların ellerine emanet ettiler.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Genji, my usual. I'm busy."
Steam (ST): "Genji, my usual. I'm busy."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「源次、いつものやつを頼む。私は忙しい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「源次、いつものやつを頼む。私は忙しい」
Russian (RU): "То же, что и обычно, Генджи. Я занят."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Genji, o de sempre. Eu estou ocupado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「源次，把我一直在喝的那個拿過來。我很忙。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「源次，把我一直在喝的那个拿过来。我很忙。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Genji, seperti biasa. Aku sibuk."
Italian (IT): "Genji, il solito, per favore. Ho delle cose da fare."
Turkish (TR): "Genji, her zamanki gibi. Meşgulüm."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Steam (ST): "......Yes sir."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
Russian (RU): "......Слушаюсь."
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (IT): "...Sì, padrone."

Umineko Project (UP): Genji headed to a corner of the study.{n}There, suspicious‐looking bottles boasting venomous colors were on display.
Steam (ST): Genji headed to a corner of the study. There, suspicious-looking bottles boasting venomous colors were on display.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji headed to a corner of the study. There, a suspicious-looking bottle boasting a venomous color was displayed.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は、書斎の一角に向かう。そこには怪しげなボトルが毒々しい色を自慢しあいながら陳列されていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次は、書斎の一角に向かう。{n}そこには怪しげなボトルが毒々しい色を自慢しあいながら陳列されていた。
Russian (RU): Генджи направился в угол кабинета.{n}Там находилась подозрительная бутылка с плескавшимся в ней напитком ядовитого цвета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji foi até o canto do estúdio.{n}Lá, garrafas de aparência suspeita, que ostentavam cores venenosas, estavam em exposição.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次走向了書房一角。{n}那裡陳列著各種可疑的瓶子，一個個爭相泛著詭異的顏色。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次走向了书房一角。{n}那里陈列着各种可疑的瓶子，一个个争相泛着诡异的颜色。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji menuju ke sudut ruang belajar.{n}Di sana, botol-botol berwarna mencurigakan dengan warna-warna beracun dipajang.
Italian (IT): Genji si diresse in un angolo dello studio. Lì vi erano in mostra delle bottiglie dallo strano aspetto, che sfoggiavano un colore intenso...
Turkish (TR): Genji çalışma odasının bir köşesine yöneldi.{n}Orada, zehirli renklere sahip şüpheli görünümlü şişeler sergileniyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): ...They were actually liquor, but considering that they were placed in this shady‐looking room, you could almost suspect that they might be ghastly poisons.
Steam (ST): ...They were actually liquor, but considering the shady atmosphere of this room, one might easily suspect them of being some ghastly poison.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It was actually liquor, but, considering that it was placed in this suspicious-looking room, one begins to doubt whether it isn't actually some kind of ghastly poison.
PC Japanese (JP): …それは実際には酒なのだが、この怪しげな室内にあっては不気味な毒物だと疑ってしまいそうになる。
Russian (RU): ...Вообще‐то это был алкогольный напиток, но если учесть, что он находился в подозрительной комнате, то любой бы начал сомневаться — а не смертельный ли яд перед ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Eram, na verdade, licores, mas considerando que eles foram colocados nesse quarto de aparência sombria, você quase podia suspeitar que eram algum tipo de veneno.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖然實際上是酒，但放置在如此詭異的室內，旁人一定會以為是什麼可怕的毒藥吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然实际上是酒，但放置在如此诡异的室内，旁人一定会以为是什么可怕的毒药吧。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Mereka sebenarnya adalah minuman keras, tetapi mengingat mereka ditempatkan di ruangan yang terlihat mencurigakan ini, seseorang hampir bisa menduga bahwa mereka mungkin racun yang mengerikan.
Italian (IT): In realtà era del liquore, ma all'interno di quella stanza sinistra si sarebbe potuto sospettare che si trattasse di un inquietante veleno.
Turkish (TR): ...Bunlar aslında likördü, ama bu karanlık görünümlü odaya yerleştirildikleri düşünülürse, korkunç zehirler olabileceklerinden neredeyse şüphelenebilirdiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): The inside of the study was filled with the mountainous library of outlandish books that Kinzo had amassed.
Steam (ST): Inside the study, the mysterious collection of books gathered by Kinzo had grown into a mountain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Inside the study, the mysterious collection of books that Kinzo had gathered had grown into a mountain.
PC Japanese (JP): 書斎の中は、金蔵が集めてきた奇怪なる蔵書が山を成していた。
Russian (RU): Таинственная коллекция из книг, собранных Кинзо, образовали в его кабинете целую гору.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O estúdio estava cheio de montanhas de livros estranhos empilhados, que Kinzo havia acumulado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 書房中，金藏收集來的怪奇藏書堆積如山。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 书房中，金藏收集来的怪奇藏书堆积如山。
Indonesian (IDN): Bagian dalam ruang belajar dipenuhi dengan perpustakaan buku-buku aneh yang dikumpulkan Kinzo.
Italian (IT): Dentro lo studio, Kinzo aveva accumulato una collezione di strani libri, che formavano delle grosse pile.
Turkish (TR): Çalışma odasının içi Kinzo'nun biriktirdiği tuhaf kitaplardan oluşan dağ gibi bir kütüphaneyle doluydu.

Umineko Project (UP): They were bizarre old books, some banned, and each and every one of them either forbidden, cursed, or sealed.
Steam (ST): They were bizarre ancient or banned books, all of them either forbidden, cursed, or sealed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were bizarre ancient or banned books, all of them either forbidden, cursed, or sealed.
PC Japanese (JP): それらはいずれも禁じられた、あるいは呪われた、あるいは封印された奇怪なる古書や禁書たちである。
Russian (RU): Все эти книги были странными древними или запрещёнными книгами, все без исключения проклятые или запечатанные.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eram livros velhos e bizarros, alguns banidos, sendo cada um deles proibido, amaldiçoado ou selado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 每本都是些或被禁讀的，或被詛咒的，或被封印的古書或禁書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 每本都是些或被禁读的，或被诅咒的，或被封印的古书或禁书。
Indonesian (IDN): Mereka adalah buku-buku kuno yang aneh, beberapa dilarang, dan masing-masing dari mereka baik terlarang, terkutuk, atau disegel.
Italian (IT): Erano tutti parte di una collezione di vecchi e misteriosi libri banditi, che erano stati proibiti, maledetti, oppure sigillati.
Turkish (TR): Tuhaf eski kitaplardı bunlar, bazıları yasaklanmıştı ve her biri ya yasaklanmış, ya lanetlenmiş ya da mühürlenmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, if one were to actually call them old books, Kinzo would fly into a rage and say something like this:
Steam (ST): But if you tried to call them "old books",
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But then, if one were to call them old books,
PC Japanese (JP): もっともそれを古書と呼べば金蔵は猛り狂いこう言うだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): もっともそれを古書と呼べば金蔵は憤怒しながらこう言うだろう。
Russian (RU): Но если кто‐нибудь называл их старыми книгами, Кинзо впадал в ярость и говорил примерно следующее:
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, se alguém os chamasse de livros velhos, Kinzo teria um ataque de raiva como esse:
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過若是稱它們為古書的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过若是称它们为古书的话。
Indonesian (IDN): Tentu saja, jika seseorang benar-benar menyebut mereka buku kuno, Kinzo akan marah dan mengatakan sesuatu seperti ini:
Italian (IT): Ad ogni modo, se qualcuno li avesse definiti dei vecchi libri, Kinzo si sarebbe infuriato, dicendo qualcosa come:
Turkish (TR): Tabii ki, eğer biri onlara gerçekten eski kitaplar derse, Kinzo öfkeden deliye döner ve şöyle bir şey söylerdi:

Umineko Project (UP): {i:"Call them...}{i:grimoires!"}
Steam (ST): Kinzo would fly into a rage and say... "Call them Grimoires!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo would fly into a rage and say something like this:"Call them Grimoires!"
PC Japanese (JP): グリモワール（呪文書）と呼べ！　と。
Russian (RU): {i:"Называй их...} {i:гримуарами!"}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {i:"Chame‐os de...}{i:grimórios!"}
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏可會像瘋了一樣大叫道：“那是{ruby:grimoire:咒文書}！”
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏可会像疯了一样大叫道：“那是{ruby:grimoire:咒文书}！”
Indonesian (IDN): {i:"Sebut mereka...}{i:grimoire!"}
Italian (IT): {i:"Chiamali...} {i:grimori!"}
Turkish (TR): {i:"Onlara...}{i:büyü kitapları deyin!"}

Umineko Project (UP): There were candles which had melted in a suspicious‐looking fashion and taken on peculiar forms, and all manner of other strange objects, probably having something to do with black magic.
Steam (ST): There were also many mysterious objects that presumably held some meaning with regards to black magic, like candles suspiciously melted and molded into strange shapes.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were many mysterious objects, like a candle suspiciously melted and molded into a strange shape, which probably had something to do with black magic.
PC Japanese (JP): 怪しげに溶けて奇妙な造形となった蝋燭や、黒魔術において何かの意味を持つのだろう、奇怪なオブジェクトの数々。
Russian (RU): В кабинете хватало предметов с таинственными свойствами, такими, к примеру, как свечи, тающие и оплавляющиеся в странную форму, вероятно имеющую какое‐то отношение к чёрной магии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Haviam velas derretidas, de aparência suspeita, que tomavam formas peculiares e todos os outros tipos de objetos estranhos, provavelmente com alguma ligação à magia negra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 熔化了一半的造型奇特的蠟燭，還有那些在黑魔術中或許有著什麼特別意義的奇怪物件，擺滿了房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 熔化了一半的造型奇特的蜡烛，还有那些在黑魔术中或许有着什么特别意义的奇怪物件，摆满了房间。
Indonesian (IDN): Ada lilin yang meleleh dengan cara yang mencurigakan dan mengambil bentuk yang aneh, dan segala macam benda aneh lainnya, mungkin ada hubungannya dengan sihir hitam.
Italian (IT): Vi erano molti oggetti misteriosi, probabilmente collegati alla magia nera, come una candela modellata in una strana forma, che si scoglieva in modo sospetto.
Turkish (TR): Şüpheli bir şekilde erimiş ve tuhaf şekillere bürünmüş mumlar ve muhtemelen kara büyüyle ilgili olan her türlü başka tuhaf nesne vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): The constellations covering the celestial globe would have caused anyone who knew the night sky well to raise an eyebrow.
Steam (ST): The constellations drawn on a certain celestial globe contained quite a few shapes that would draw puzzled looks from anyone familiar with today's night sky.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The constellations drawn on a certain celestial globe contained quite a few dots that a person who knows the night sky well would tilt their head at.
PC Japanese (JP): 天球儀に記された星座は、今日の夜空をよく知る者が見たなら首を傾げるようなものばかりが記されている。
Russian (RU): Созвездия, нарисованные на глобусе звёздного неба, содержали предостаточное количество точек, и человек, знакомый с ночным небом, наверняка склонил бы над ним свою голову.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As constelações cobrindo a esfera celeste faziam qualquer um que conhecesse o céu noturno ficar com dúvidas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在天球儀上所有記載著的星座，若是讓那些對現代天文有所研究的人看了，恐怕都會不禁納悶起來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在天球仪上所有记载着的星座，若是让那些对现代天文有所研究的人看了，恐怕都会不禁纳闷起来。
Indonesian (IDN): Rasi bintang yang menutupi globe langit akan membuat siapa pun yang mengenal langit malam dengan baik mengangkat alis.
Italian (IT): Le costellazioni disegnate su un mappamondo stellare avrebbero lasciato perplesso chi conosceva bene il cielo notturno moderno.
Turkish (TR): Gök küresini kaplayan takımyıldızlar, gece gökyüzünü iyi bilen herkesin kaşlarını kaldırmasına neden olabilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): The illustrations inscribed in old books, haphazardly left open, ranged from the religious and mystical...to the demonic and grotesque, as well as bizarre diagrams of various magic circles.
Steam (ST): The carelessly strewn-about books contained many illustrations, all of them of a religious or mysterious nature... including some depicting demonically grotesque subjects or bizarre diagrams of various magic circles.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The illustrations inscribed in old, casually opened books were all full of religious, or possibly demonic, grotesque arcana, as well as the weird shapes of various magical circles.
PC Japanese (JP): 無造作に開かれたまま置かれた古書に記されているイラストは、いずれも宗教的な神秘的なもの、あるいは悪魔的なグロテスクなもの、そして様々な魔法陣の奇怪な図形。
Russian (RU): Иллюстрации на страницах старых, небрежно открытых книг были с избытком снабжены религиозными или, вероятно, демоническими, причудливыми фантастическими письменами, а также странными фигурами разнообразных магических кругов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As ilustrações gravadas nos velhos livros deixados entre abertos, variavam do religioso e místico...do demoníaco ao grotesco, como bizarros diagramas e vários círculos mágicos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨意敞開著的古書上，盡是畫著些帶有宗教色彩、神秘色彩的插畫，抑或是惡魔一般的獵奇圖案，以及各種各樣奇怪的魔法陣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随意敞开着的古书上，尽是画着些带有宗教色彩、神秘色彩的插画，抑或是恶魔一般的猎奇图案，以及各种各样奇怪的魔法阵。
Indonesian (IDN): Ilustrasi yang tertera dalam buku-buku kuno, yang dibiarkan terbuka sembarangan, berkisar dari yang religius dan mistis...hingga yang setan dan mengerikan, serta diagram aneh dari berbagai lingkaran sihir.
Italian (IT): Le illustrazioni contenute nei vecchi libri lasciati aperti con noncuranza erano tutte di natura religiosa e mistica, o addirittura demoniaca e grottesca, e insieme ad esse vi erano vari disegni di strani cerchi magici.
Turkish (TR): Eski kitaplarda yazılı, gelişigüzel açık bırakılmış resimler, dini ve mistik...şeytani ve grotesk ile çeşitli büyü çemberlerinin tuhaf diyagramlarına kadar uzanıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): And above all, the sweet, poisonous smell that filled the room, which to those entering for the first time would surely be a profound assault on their sense of sight, smell, and all their other senses, making them lose their grip on reality...
Steam (ST): And above all, a sweet, poisonous smell filled the room, profoundly assaulting the eyes and noses of those who entered for the first time. Eventually, it must surely make a person go numb and lose their grip on reality.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And above all, the sweet, poisonous smell that filled the room profoundly assaulted those who entered for the first time in their sense of sight and smell, then all their senses, making them lose their grip on reality ...
PC Japanese (JP): そして何より、この部屋に充満する甘い毒の臭いは、この部屋に初めて訪れる者を、視覚的にも嗅覚的にも、そして感覚的にも深く冒し、現実感を喪失させるに違いない…。
Russian (RU): Довершал картину сладкий ядовитый запах, заполняющий комнату, глубоко воздействовавший на чувства зрения и обоняния впервые входящих в кабинет, заставляя их терять ощущение реальности...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, acima de tudo, um doce e venenoso odor preenchia o quarto, fazendo com que aqueles que entrassem pela primeira vez tivessem o seu sentido de visão, olfato e todos os outros, profundamente prejudicados, fazendo‐os perderem o senso de realidade...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再加上那股充滿房間的甜臭味，肯定能讓第一次進入這房間的人，從視覺上、嗅覺上甚至從感覺上，都深深喪失現實感…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再加上那股充满房间的甜臭味，肯定能让第一次进入这房间的人，从视觉上、嗅觉上甚至从感觉上，都深深丧失现实感…。
Indonesian (IDN): Dan di atas segalanya, bau manis dan beracun yang memenuhi ruangan, yang bagi mereka yang masuk untuk pertama kalinya pasti akan menjadi serangan mendalam pada indra penglihatan, penciuman, dan semua indra mereka, membuat mereka kehilangan pegangan pada kenyataan...
Italian (IT): E soprattutto, l'odore dolce e venefico che permeava la stanza, assaliva brutalmente coloro che vi entravano per la prima volta, affliggendo la vista, l'olfatto e i sensi, e facendo senz'altro perdere la percezione del reale.
Turkish (TR): Ve hepsinden önemlisi, odayı dolduran tatlı, zehirli koku, ilk kez girenler için görme, koklama ve diğer tüm duyuları üzerinde derin bir saldırı olacağı ve gerçeklik kavramlarını kaybetmelerine neden olacağı kesin...

Umineko Project (UP): Inside that study, Genji, with his well trained hand, prepared Kinzo's usual drink.
Steam (ST): Inside that study, Genji prepared Kinzo's usual drink with a well-trained hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Inside that study, Genji, with his well trained hand, prepared Kinzo's usual drink.
PC Japanese (JP): そんな書斎の中で、源次はいつもの慣れた手つきで、金蔵の愛飲する酒を準備する。
Russian (RU): Вот в таком кабинете Генджи, уже набивший руку в этом деле, готовил Кинзо его напиток.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dentro do estúdio, Genji, que já tinha habilidade, preparava a bebida usual de Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在這樣的書房中，源次和往常一樣，熟練地準備著金藏的愛酒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在这样的书房中，源次和往常一样，熟练地准备着金藏的爱酒。
Indonesian (IDN): Di dalam ruang belajar itu, Genji, dengan tangannya yang terlatih, menyiapkan minuman biasa Kinzo.
Italian (IT): All'interno di tale studio, Genji preparò con le sue mani esperte la bevanda preferita di Kinzo.
Turkish (TR): O çalışma odasının içinde Genji, iyi eğitilmiş elleriyle Kinzo'nun her zamanki içkisini hazırlıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): If you didn't know that the ghastly dark green liquid that filled the complexly designed bottle was liquor, you certainly wouldn't want to put it in your mouth.
Steam (ST): No one would even think of drinking such an ominous dark green liquid in that complex and ornate glass, unless someone first told them it was alcohol.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If you didn't know that the ominous dark green liquid that filled the complexly designed bottle was liquor, you really wouldn't want to put it in your mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): 複雑な意匠のボトルに満たされた暗緑色の不気味な液体は、酒だと教えられなければとても口に含む気にはなるまい。
Russian (RU): Если бы не знание того, что жидкость зловещего зелёного цвета в бутылке причудливой формы является алкогольным напитком, никто по доброй воле не согласился бы выпить его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se você não soubesse que aquele medonho e escuro líquido verde que preenchia a garrafa era licor, você certamente não iria querer colocá‐lo em sua boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 造型複雜的酒瓶中裝滿了暗綠色的液體，要是沒人告知是酒的話，肯定不會有人想把它喝進口中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 造型复杂的酒瓶中装满了暗绿色的液体，要是没人告知是酒的话，肯定不会有人想把它喝进口中。
Indonesian (IDN): Jika Anda tidak tahu bahwa cairan hijau tua yang mengerikan yang mengisi botol dengan desain rumit itu adalah minuman keras, Anda tentu tidak akan ingin memasukkannya ke dalam mulut Anda.
Italian (IT): Se non si dicesse che lo strano liquido verdastro che riempiva la bottiglia dai complessi ornamenti fosse alcol, difficilmente a qualcuno verrebbe in mente di trangugiarlo...
Turkish (TR): Karmaşık tasarımlı şişeyi dolduran korkunç koyu yeşil sıvının likör olduğunu bilmeseydiniz, kesinlikle ağzınıza koymak istemezdiniz.

Umineko Project (UP): ......He poured a small quantity of the spirit into the glass, placed a cube of sugar in a strangely shaped spoon, and then poured water from a pitcher over it.
Steam (ST): ......He poured a little into the glass. Then, he placed a cube of sugar in a strangely shaped spoon and poured water from a pitcher over it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......He poured a small quantity of the spirits into the glass. After placing a cube of sugar in a strangely shaped spoon, he then poured water from a pitcher over it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それをグラスに少々注ぎ、奇妙な形をしたスプーンに角砂糖を乗せてその上からピッチャーの水を注ぎ込む。
Russian (RU): ......Он налил немного напитка в бокал, поместив кубик сахара в ложку странной формы, Генджи стал поливать его водой из кувшина.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele derramou uma pequena quantia dele em um copo, colocando um cubo de açúcar em uma colher de formato estranho, e então derramando água de um jarro sobre ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……將那酒倒進酒杯少許，然後用造型奇特的湯匙放入方糖，再用水壺倒些水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……将那酒倒进酒杯少许，然后用造型奇特的汤匙放入方糖，再用水壶倒些水。
Indonesian (IDN): ......Dia menuangkan sejumlah kecil minuman ke dalam gelas, menaruh kubus gula di sendok berbentuk aneh, dan kemudian menuangkan air dari kendi ke atasnya.
Italian (IT): Ne versò una piccola quantità in un bicchiere, mise un cubetto di zucchero in un cucchiaio dalla forma peculiare, e versò sopra di esso l'acqua contenuta in una brocca.
Turkish (TR): ......İçkiden küçük bir miktar bardağa döktü, garip şekilli bir kaşığa bir küp şeker koydu ve ardından üzerine bir sürahiden su döktü.

Umineko Project (UP): Strangely, when the colorless water was poured into it, the dark green liquid turned a cloudy white.
Steam (ST): Strangely, when the transparent water was poured, the dark green liquid turned a cloudy white.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Strangely, when the transparent water was poured, the dark green liquid turned a cloudy white.
PC Japanese (JP): 不思議なことに、暗緑色の液体は透明な水が注ぎ込まれると白く白濁する。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 不思議なことに、暗緑色の液体は透明な水が注ぎ込まれると白く濁る。
Russian (RU): Это было странно, но прозрачная вода, попавшая в напиток, окрасила тёмно‐зелёную жидкость в облачно белый цвет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Estranhamente, quando a água incolor foi colocada, o líquido verde ficou com uma coloração branca opaca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不可思議的是，向暗綠色的液體中倒入透明的水後，它竟變成了白色渾濁的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不可思议的是，向暗绿色的液体中倒入透明的水后，它竟变成了白色浑浊的样子。
Indonesian (IDN): Anehnya, ketika air tak berwarna dituangkan ke dalamnya, cairan hijau tua berubah menjadi putih keruh.
Italian (IT): Stranamente, quando vi venne versata l'acqua trasparente, il liquido verdastro si tinse di bianco...
Turkish (TR): Tuhaf bir şekilde, renksiz su döküldüğünde koyu yeşil sıvı bulanık bir beyaza dönüştü.

Umineko Project (UP): ...It created the strange visual illusion that the water had caused a chemical reaction, which made it all the more difficult to perceive the concoction as liquor.
Steam (ST): ...It was a strange optical illusion, as though the water had caused a chemical reaction and made the drink become even more unrecognizable as liquor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It was a strange optical illusion, as though the water had caused a chemical reaction and made the drink become even more unrecognizable as liquor.
PC Japanese (JP): …それはまるで水と化学反応を起こしたかのような奇妙な錯覚を与え、ますますに酒だという認識を遠のかせた。
Russian (RU): ...Глазам представала странная оптическая иллюзия, словно вода вызвала химическую реакцию, из‐за которой напиток стало ещё трудней признать алкогольным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Isso criou uma estranha ilusão visual de que a água causou uma reação química, o que tornou ainda mais difícil de perceber que a mistura era um licor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這給人一種，就像是它在和水起化學反應一樣的奇妙錯覺，越發難以讓人把它和酒聯繫起來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这给人一种，就像是它在和水起化学反应一样的奇妙错觉，越发难以让人把它和酒联系起来了。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Itu menciptakan ilusi visual aneh bahwa air telah menyebabkan reaksi kimia, yang membuatnya semakin sulit untuk menganggap ramuan itu sebagai minuman keras.
Italian (IT): L'acqua conferì una strana illusione ottica, proprio come se avesse causato una reazione chimica, rendendo sempre più difficile considerare tale bevanda come un liquore.
Turkish (TR): ...Suyun kimyasal bir reaksiyona neden olduğu gibi garip bir görsel yanılsama yarattı, bu da karışımın likör olarak algılanmasını daha da zorlaştırdı.

Umineko Project (UP): To this, he added an original flavoring that Kinzo liked, and fine‐tuned the taste.
Steam (ST): Then, Genji added original flavors Kinzo loved, fine-tuning its taste.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It improved the original flavor Kinzo liked and adjusted the taste.
PC Japanese (JP): それに、金蔵が好む独自のフレーバーを加え、味を調える。
Russian (RU): Подобная манипуляция улучшала исходный вкус, нравившийся Кинзо. Так вкус подгонялся под его предпочтения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para isso, ele adicionou um sabor original que Kinzo gostava e aperfeiçoava o sabor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而最後，再加上一味金藏喜歡的獨特香料，調和味道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而最后，再加上一味金藏喜欢的独特香料，调和味道。
Indonesian (IDN): Untuk ini, dia menambahkan penyedap asli yang disukai Kinzo, dan menyempurnakan rasanya.
Italian (IT): In più, aggiungeva un sapore originale che Kinzo gradiva, e ne migliorava il gusto...
Turkish (TR): Buna Kinzo'nun sevdiği orijinal bir aroma ekledi ve tadında ince ayarlar yaptı.

Umineko Project (UP): ...There was no recipe. Its success was measured only by Kinzo's mood swing when he drank it, and he had learned how to make it only after many decades.
Steam (ST): ...There was no recipe. Its success was measured only by Kinzo's mood swings when he drank it, and it had taken Genji many decades to learn how to do it right.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …レシピはない。飲んだ金蔵の一喜一憂によってだけ出来具合を計り、数十年かけて身につけたものである。
Russian (RU): ...Фиксированного рецепта не было. Насколько удачно получился напиток, можно было судить по перемене настроения у Кинзо, когда тот принимался пить его, поэтому у Генджи ушли десятилетия, чтобы научиться правильно готовить его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Não havia uma receita. Seu sucesso era medido pela mudança de humor de Kinzo quando ele bebia. Ele levou décadas para aprender como preparar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …沒有調酒方。一切的調配，都是通過觀察金藏品嘗時的喜怒哀樂，經過數十年的調試而掌握到的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …没有调酒方。一切的调配，都是通过观察金藏品尝时的喜怒哀乐，经过数十年的调试而掌握到的。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Tidak ada resep. Keberhasilannya hanya diukur oleh perubahan suasana hati Kinzo ketika dia meminumnya, dan dia telah belajar cara membuatnya hanya setelah beberapa dekade.
Italian (IT): Non c'era una ricetta. Era un metodo appreso dopo svariati decenni, il cui successo era stato misurato solo dal variare dell'umore di Kinzo mentre lo beveva.
Turkish (TR): ...Tarif yoktu. Başarısı sadece Kinzo'nun bunu içtiğinde ruh halinin nasıl değiştiğiyle ölçülüyordu ve bunu nasıl yapacağını ancak onlarca yıl sonra öğrenmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji placed the glass on a tray, and made his way over to Kinzo.{n}Kinzo was now gazing out the window.
Steam (ST): Genji placed the glass on a tray and walked over to Kinzo. By this time, Kinzo was gazing out the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji placed the glass in the tray, and faced Kinzo. Kinzo was now gazing out the window.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次はそのグラスを盆に載せ、金蔵の元に向かう。金蔵はいつの間にか、窓の外を眺めていた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 源次はそのグラスを盆に載せ、金蔵の元に向かう。{n}金蔵はいつの間にか、窓の外を眺めていた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji colocou o copo em uma bandeja e se dirigiu até Kinzo.{n}Kinzo estava olhando pela janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次把酒杯放在托盤上，端著它走向金藏。{n}金藏不知何時開始，就在眺望著窗外。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次把酒杯放在托盘上，端着它走向金藏。{n}金藏不知何时开始，就在眺望着窗外。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji meletakkan gelas di atas nampan, dan berjalan menuju Kinzo.{n}Kinzo sekarang menatap ke luar jendela.
Italian (IT): Genji posò il bicchiere su un vassoio, e raggiunse Kinzo. Senza rendersene conto, Kinzo stava osservando fuori dalla finestra.
Turkish (TR): Genji bardağı bir tepsiye koydu ve Kinzo'ya doğru ilerledi.{n}Kinzo şimdi pencereden dışarı bakıyordu.
