Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo had regained his composure—so much so that he was now unrecognizable as the man who had been shouting, screaming and yelling just moments before.
Steam (ST): Kinzo had regained his composure and was now unrecognizable as the shouting, screaming, yelling man from a few moments ago.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo, now unrecognizable as the man who was shouting, screaming and yelling just before, regained his composure.
PC Japanese (JP): ついさっきまで怒鳴り、叫び、絶叫していたのと同じ人物とは思えないくらい、金蔵は落ち着きを取り戻していた。
Russian (RU): Кинзо, в котором теперь было не узнать человека, до этого кричащего, орущего и вопящего, обрёл самообладание.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kinzo recuperou sua compostura — ele estava quase irreconhecível do homem que estava gritando e berrando há alguns momentos atrás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏已經冷靜下來，實在難以想像他與剛才那個大喊大叫的是同一個人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏已经冷静下来，实在难以想象他与刚才那个大喊大叫的是同一个人。
Indonesian (IDN): Kinzo telah mendapatkan kembali ketenangannya—sangat berbeda dengan pria yang baru saja berteriak, menjerit dan berteriak beberapa saat yang lalu.
Italian (IT): Kinzo riprese la sua compostezza, diventato irriconoscibile dall'uomo che aveva gridato, urlato e strepitato fino a poco prima.
Turkish (TR): Kinzo soğukkanlılığını yeniden kazanmıştı—öyle ki birkaç dakika önce bağıran, çığlık atan ve bağıran adamdan artık eser yoktu.

Umineko Project (UP): In that man's back dwelt a dignity and intelligence made plain simply by how he tilted his glass and gazed down at the scenery beyond the window.
Steam (ST): Looking at this man from behind as he tilted his glass and gazed down at the scenery beyond the window, ...he projected a sense of dignity and intelligence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that man's back dwelt a dignity and intelligence made plain simply by how he tilted his glass and gazed down at the scenery beyond the window.
PC Japanese (JP): その男の背中には、ただグラスを傾けて窓から景色を見下ろすだけで示せる貫禄と知性が宿っていた。
Russian (RU): Спина этого мужчины выражала достоинство и ум, что лишь подчеркивалось тем, как он наклонял свой бокал и смотрел на пейзаж за окном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No homem, habitava dignidade e inteligência, que podiam ser vistas pela simples forma como ele inclinou seu copo e observou o cenário pela janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個男人的背影之中，蘊含著一股只需微微傾斜酒杯、俯視窗外景色，就能透露出的威嚴與知性。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个男人的背影之中，蕴含着一股只需微微倾斜酒杯、俯视窗外景色，就能透露出的威严与知性。
Indonesian (IDN): Di punggung pria itu berdiam martabat dan kecerdasan yang jelas hanya dari bagaimana dia memiringkan gelasnya dan memandang pemandangan di luar jendela.
Italian (IT): Guardando la sua schiena, egli proiettava imponenza e intelligenza, rese evidenti semplicemente dal modo in cui inclinava il bicchiere e squadrava lo scenario al di fuori della finestra.
Turkish (TR): O adamın sırtında, bardağını eğip pencerenin ötesindeki manzarayı seyredişinden bile anlaşılan bir asalet ve zekâ vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): Genji, in order to allow Kinzo to set down his glass any time, motionlessly waited behind and to his left, as though he were a living sideboard.
Steam (ST): To allow Kinzo to set his glass down at any time, Genji motionlessly waited behind Kinzo and to his left, as though he were a living sideboard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji, in order to allow Kinzo to set down his glass any time, motionlessly waited behind and to Kinzo's left, as though he were a living sideboard.
PC Japanese (JP): 源次は、金蔵がいつでもグラスを置けるよう、自らが生きたサイドボードであるかのように、じっとその左後方に控えていた。
Russian (RU): Генджи, готовый к тому, что Кинзо может в любой момент пожелать расстаться с бокалом, неподвижно стоял слева от господина, словно живой буфет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Genji, a fim de permitir que Kinzo pudesse largar o copo a qualquer momento, parou um pouco atrás dele, do lado esquerdo, como se fosse um aparador vivo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為了讓金藏能隨時放回酒杯，源次像個活酒櫃一樣，站在金藏左後方一動不動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为了让金藏能随时放回酒杯，源次像个活酒柜一样，站在金藏左后方一动不动。
Indonesian (IDN): Genji, untuk memungkinkan Kinzo meletakkan gelasnya kapan saja, diam-diam menunggu di belakang dan di sebelah kirinya, seolah-olah dia adalah lemari samping yang hidup.
Italian (IT): Per permettere a Kinzo di posare il bicchiere in qualsiasi momento, Genji rimaneva immobile dietro di lui, attendendo alla sua sinistra, come se fosse un bancone umano.
Turkish (TR): Genji, Kinzo'nun kadehini istediği zaman bırakmasına izin vermek için, Sanki canlı bir büfe gibi arkasında ve solunda hareketsizce bekledi.

Umineko Project (UP): As he did, Kinzo stuck out just the glass, his gaze still directed at the world outside the window.
Steam (ST): Then, without averting his eyes from the window, Kinzo held out his glass.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thereupon, while Kinzo looked out the window, he stuck out only the glass.
PC Japanese (JP): すると金蔵は窓の外を見たまま、グラスだけを突き出した。
Russian (RU): Таким образом, пока Кинзо смотрел в окно, взгляд Генджи был прикован к бокалу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto ele fazia isso, Kinzo se apoiou contra o vidro, observando diretamente o mundo através da janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏看著窗外，把酒杯朝源次遞了過去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏看着窗外，把酒杯朝源次递了过去。
Indonesian (IDN): Saat dia melakukannya, Kinzo mengulurkan hanya gelasnya, tatapannya masih mengarah ke dunia di luar jendela.
Italian (IT): Successivamente, con lo sguardo ancora rivolto verso l'esterno, Kinzo gli porse il bicchiere.
Turkish (TR): Bunu yaparken Kinzo sadece bardağı uzattı, bakışları hala pencerenin dışındaki dünyaya yönelmişti.

Umineko Project (UP): There was just a mouthful remaining.
Steam (ST): There was only a mouthful remaining.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There was just a mouthful remaining.
PC Japanese (JP): 中身はほんの一口分ほど残っている。
Russian (RU): Бокал был уже почти пустой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia apenas mais um gole.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 裡面還留著一小口。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 里面还留着一小口。
Indonesian (IDN): Hanya tersisa satu tegukan.
Italian (IT): Ne era rimasto abbastanza per un sorso.
Turkish (TR): Sadece bir ağız dolusu kalmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): It was not a gesture intended to set it upon the tray, as Genji expected, but was a motion to hand the glass over to Genji.
Steam (ST): It was not a gesture intended to set it upon the tray, but a motion to hand the glass over to Genji.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was not a gesture intended to set it upon the tray, as Genji expected, but was an motion to hand the glass over to Genji.
PC Japanese (JP): それは源次の持つ盆に載せようという仕草ではなく、源次にグラスを譲ろうとするような仕草だった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não era um gesto de quem pretendia colocar o copo na bandeja, como Genji esperava, mas um movimento estendendo o copo até Genji.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 金藏的動作看起來不像是要放回托盤，而是像把酒杯讓給源次一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 金藏的动作看起来不像是要放回托盘，而是像把酒杯让给源次一样。
Indonesian (IDN): Itu bukan gerakan yang dimaksudkan untuk meletakkannya di atas nampan, seperti yang Genji harapkan, tetapi adalah gerakan untuk memberikan gelas itu kepada Genji.
Italian (IT): Non era un cenno compiuto per posare il bicchiere sul vassoio tenuto in mano da Genji, bensì un gesto per passarglielo.
Turkish (TR): Genji'nin beklediği gibi tepsinin üzerine koymaya yönelik bir hareket değildi bu, bardağı Genji'ye uzatmaya yönelik bir hareketti.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お前が作るのを真似ているのだが、どうにも同じ味が出ぬ。……お前が作る方が美味い」

PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵は、無礼講にせよと言っても決してそうしない忠臣を鼻で笑う。

Umineko Project (UP): However, he was not making fun of him; it was relaxed, like a smile at a close friend's unriddable bad habit.
Steam (ST): However, he was not making fun of him. His smile was relaxed, as though chuckling at a close friend's old, unshakable habit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, he was not making fun of him; it was relaxed, like a smile at a close friend's unriddable bad habit.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは小馬鹿にしたものではなく、親しい友人の治らぬ癖に笑うような軽やかなものだった。
Russian (RU): Однако в этой улыбке не было ни капли насмешки. Такой улыбкой улыбаются близкому другу, чья привычка неискоренима.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, ele não fez graça dele; era um calmo sorriso para um amigo próximo, sem nenhum traço de má fé.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): ".........We have grown old, you and I. I forgot my age a long time ago."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): ".........You have served me exceedingly well these years. ......My sons call me eccentric. The servants that were once many, all of them, retired in their growing fear of me. ......Only you, even now, serve me."
Steam (ST): ".........Until now, you have served me exceedingly well. ......My sons call me eccentric. The servants that were once many have all quit in fear of me. ......Only you serve me even now."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Until now, you have served me exceedingly well. ......My sons call me eccentric. The servants that were once many, all of them, retired in their growing fear of me. ......Only you, even now, serve me."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………今日まで、本当によく私に仕えてくれた。……息子たちは誰もが私を変人呼ばわりした。大勢いた使用人も皆、私を恐れて辞めていった。……お前だけが、今でも私に仕えてくれる。」

Russian (RU): ".........До сегодняшнего дня ты был непревзойдён в служении мне. ......Мои сыновья называют меня эксцентричным. Слуги, которых здесь раньше было много, один за другим уволились из‐за страха передо мной. ......Лишь ты и поныне служишь мне."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Você tem me servido de forma excelente todos esses anos.{n}......Meus filhos me chamam de excêntrico. Meus serviçais, que antes eram muitos, foram se retirando porque tinham medo de mim. ......Apenas você me serve agora."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "That fool Krauss squanders money like water, throws away two gold coins to obtain one. With that, he deludes himself into saying he earned money!! Eva is a slave to money, thinking of me as a hen or whatnot!! As if when I die, she'll even use my carcass to make broth!!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「蔵臼の愚か者は金を湯水のように使い、１枚の金貨を得るのに２枚の金貨を捨てておる。それで金を稼げたなどと妄言をッ！！　絵羽は金の亡者だ、あやつは私を鶏か何かだと思っておる！！　死んだらガラにしてダシまで取る気だ！！

Ева — раба презренного металла, видящая во мне злую наседку на золотых яйцах! А когда я сыграю в ящик, она даже сварит суп из моих костей!"

Indonesian (IDN): "Bodoh itu Krauss menghamburkan uang seperti air, membuang dua koin emas untuk mendapatkan satu. Dengan itu, dia membodohi dirinya sendiri dengan mengatakan dia menghasilkan uang!! Eva adalah budak uang, menganggapku sebagai ayam atau apa!! Seolah ketika aku mati, dia bahkan akan menggunakan bangkuku untuk membuat kaldu!!"

Umineko Project (UP): After his almost deranged outburst of the past few minutes settled down, Kinzo regained his composure once more.
Steam (ST): When his seemingly deranged fit subsided, Kinzo regained his composure once again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The outburst, like his previous agitation, had calmed, and Kinzo regained his composure again.
PC Japanese (JP): さっきまでの錯乱のような発作が収まると、再び金蔵は落ち着きを取り戻していた。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "And so, ......I have decided. .....................I cannot stand spending the insipid remainder of my life procrastinating like this. If I have any final coins left to gamble, then I choose to abandon them all to the whims of the Demons' Roulette."
Steam (ST): "And so, ......I have decided. ............I cannot bear to spend my dimmed, remaining years procrastinating like this. If I have one final coin to bet, then I choose to abandon it to the whims of the Demons' Roulette.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "And so, ......I have decided. .....................I cannot stand spending my dimmed, remaining years procrastinating like this. If this body of mine is the final coin I have to bet, then I choose to abandon it to the whims of the Demons' Roulette.
PC Japanese (JP): 「ゆえに。……私は決心した。…………………このままぼやけ切った余生を怠慢に過ごすことなど、もはや耐えられはせん。この身に、最後に賭するコインがあるならば、それを悪魔たちのルーレットに託してみたい。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ゆえに。……私は決心した。…………………このままぼやけ切った余生を怠慢に過ごすことなど、もはや耐えられはせん。この身に、最後に賭するコインがあるならば、それを悪魔たちのルーレットに託してみたい」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Finalmente, ......tomei minha decisão. .....................Eu não posso ficar parado, desperdiçando o resto da minha vida insípida procrastinando desta forma. Se eu ainda tiver qualquer moeda para jogar, então eu escolho abandonar todos os caprichos da Roleta do Demônio."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「所以，……我下定了决心。…………………我已经无法容忍自己，再像这样糊里糊涂地浪费余生了。要是我还有最后能下赌注的硬币，我愿把它扔进恶魔的轮盘赌。」

Italian (IT): "Perciò... Ho preso una decisione... Non posso tollerare di vivere gli anni di senilità che mi restano nell'indolenza. Se mi rimane un'ultimo soldo da puntare, voglio provare a riporre la mia fiducia nella Roulette Demoniaca..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "......The power of magic is always determined by the risk staked upon it. Like visiting a shrine at the Hour of the Ox in ancient Japanese sorcery, to nail a curse doll to a tree. The magic power dwells in incurring the risk that it will be seen before seven days pass. The more dangerous the risk, the stronger the magic power will be."
Steam (ST): ......The power of magic is always determined by the risk of the gamble. Like visiting a shrine at the Hour of the Ox in ancient Japanese sorcery, to nail a curse doll to a tree. Magical power is produced specifically because of the risk that it will be seen within the seven days the curse takes. The greater the risk, the stronger the magic power will be."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The power of magic is always settled with a gamble. Like visiting a shrine at the Hour of the Ox in ancient Japanese sorcery, to nail a curse doll to a tree. The magic power dwells in incurring the risk that it will be seen within the seven days the curse takes. The more dangerous the risk, the stronger the magic power will be.
PC Japanese (JP): ……魔法の力はいつも賭けるリスクで決まる。日本古来の呪術である丑の刻参りがそうであろう。七日間、儀式を目撃されてはならないというリスクを支払うからこそ魔力が宿る。困難なリスクが生じれば生じるほどに魔力は強く生じるのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……魔法の力はいつも賭けるリスクで決まる。日本古来の呪術である丑の刻参りがそうであろう。七日間、儀式を目撃されてはならないというリスクを支払うからこそ魔力が宿る。困難なリスクが生じれば生じるほどに魔力は強く生じるのだ」
Russian (RU): "......В магической силе решающим элементом всегда является риск. Так, в древнем японском колдовстве люди посещают святилище в час быка, чтобы прибить проклятую куклу гвоздем к дереву. Магическая сила тут заключена в риске, что куклу могут увидеть до истечения семи дней. Чем выше риск, тем сильнее будет порождённая магическая сила."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O poder da magia é sempre determinado pelo risco empilhado sobre ela. Igual na antiga feitiçaria japonesa, onde você visita um santuário às duas horas da manhã, durante a Hora do Boi, para pregar uma boneca amaldiçoada em uma árvore e orar pela morte da pessoa. O poder mágico fica sujeito ao risco de que ele será visto, antes de se passarem sete dias. Quanto mais perigoso o risco, mais forte vai ser o poder da magia."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……魔法之力的強弱，一直都以賭博風險的大小來決定。日本古代咒術中的所謂每天丑時參拜也正是如此吧。正因必須擔負起七天內不可被人目擊儀式的風險，才寄宿著魔力。風險越大，產生出的魔力也會越大。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……魔法之力的强弱，一直都以赌博风险的大小来决定。日本古代咒术中的所谓每天丑时参拜也正是如此吧。正因必须担负起七天内不可被人目击仪式的风险，才寄宿着魔力。风险越大，产生出的魔力也会越大。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Kekuatan sihir selalu ditentukan oleh risiko yang dipertaruhkan padanya. Seperti mengunjungi kuil pada Jam Kerbau dalam sihir Jepang kuno, untuk memaku boneka kutukan ke pohon. Kekuatan sihir berada dalam mengambil risiko bahwa itu akan terlihat sebelum tujuh hari berlalu. Semakin berbahaya risikonya, semakin kuat kekuatan sihirnya."
Italian (IT): "Il potere di una magia è sempre determinato dal rischio che si mette in gioco. Come nell'antica stregoneria giapponese, dove si visita un tempio nelle prime ore dopo mezzanotte per inchiodare ad un albero una bambola maledetta. Il potere magico risiede nel rischio che si paga, ovvero impedire che qualcuno assista al rituale tenuto nel corso di sette giorni. Maggiori sono le difficoltà generate dal rischio, maggiore sarà il potere magico da esso scaturito."
Turkish (TR): "......Büyünün gücü her zaman ona yatırılan riskle belirlenir. Eski Japon büyücülüğünde Öküz Saatinde bir tapınağı ziyaret etmek, bir ağaca lanetli bir bebek çivilemek gibi. Büyünün gücü, yedi gün geçmeden önce görülme riskini göze almakta yatar. Risk ne kadar fazla olursa, büyünün gücü de o kadar güçlü olacaktır."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "All the various miracles that appear in myth can be called crystals of astonishing magic power, obtained through miraculously low probabilities and astronomical risks!"
Steam (ST): "Many miracles that happened in myth might be called the crystallization of shocking magic power, with a low probability of occurance and astronomical risk!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Many miracles that happened in myth can be said to be the crystallization of a shocking magic power that had a low probability of happening and an astronomical risk!
PC Japanese (JP): 神話に登場する数々の奇跡は天文学的リスクに奇跡的な低確率を得て成就した驚愕すべき魔力の結晶なのだと言える！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「神話に登場する数々の奇跡は天文学的リスクに奇跡的な低確率を得て成就した驚愕すべき魔力の結晶なのだと言える！」
Russian (RU): "Множество чудес, имевших место в мифах, можно назвать кристаллизацией чудовищной магической силы с ничтожной вероятностью воплощения и связанной с астрономически высоким риском!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Todos os vários milagres, que aparecem na mitologia, podem ser chamados de cristais de poderes mágicos surpreendentes, obtidos através da baixa e milagrosa probabilidade e seus riscos astronômicos!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可以說神話中登場的種種奇跡，都是在天文數字級別的風險中，賭中了有如奇跡般的極低概率，而產生出來的驚人魔力的成果！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可以说神话中登场的种种奇迹，都是在天文数字级别的风险中，赌中了有如奇迹般的极低概率，而产生出来的惊人魔力的成果！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Semua berbagai keajaiban yang muncul dalam mitos dapat disebut kristal dari kekuatan sihir yang menakjubkan, diperoleh melalui probabilitas yang sangat rendah dan risiko astronomis!"
Italian (IT): "Si dice che molti dei miracoli avvenuti nei miti siano frutto di uno strepitoso potere magico, conseguito mediante bassissime probabilità poste contro un rischio astronomicamente alto!"
Turkish (TR): "Mitlerde yer alan çeşitli mucizelerin tümü, mucizevi derecede düşük olasılıklar ve astronomik risklerle elde edilen şaşırtıcı büyülü güç kristalleri olarak adlandırılabilir!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "That Moses parted the sea was no miracle of God's—it was that utterly desperate risk, weighed upon the scales of oppression, of being cornered by soldiers on the Red Sea's shores, which gave birth to miraculous magic power! Even if the same thing occurs again, on the same scope, the sea will no doubt not part."
Steam (ST): That Moses parted the waters of the sea was not a miracle of God— the risk of that desperate situation, cornered by soldiers on the Red Sea's shores, weighed upon the scales of slaughter and gave birth to that miraculous magic power. If the same thing occurred again on the same scale, the sea would surely fail to part."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That Moses parted the waters of the sea was not a miracle of God - the risk of that desperate situation, cornered by soldiers on the Red Sea's shores, weighed upon the scales of slaughter, gave birth to the miraculous magic power. Even if the same thing occurs again, on same scope, the sea will no doubt not part.
PC Japanese (JP): モーゼが海を割ったのは神の奇跡ではない、虐殺の秤に載せられ軍勢によって紅海に追い詰められた絶体絶命のリスクが奇跡の魔力を生んだのだ！　同じことが同じ規模で繰り返されようとも、再び海が割れることはないだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「モーゼが海を割ったのは神の奇跡ではない、蹂躙の秤に載せられ、軍勢によって紅海に追い詰められた絶体絶命のリスクが奇跡の魔力を生んだのだ！　同じことが同じ規模で繰り返されようとも、再び海が割れることはないだろう」
Russian (RU): "Раздвижение Моисеем вод морских было не чудом Господним. Риск в отчаянной ситуации, когда солдаты наступали ему на пятки на берегах Красного моря, взвешенный на весах кровавой расправы, породил чудотворную магическую силу. Даже если обстоятельства вновь сложатся подобным образом и в таком же масштабе, морские воды повторно не разойдутся."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Moisés dividindo o mar não foi um milagre de Deus — foi um risco totalmente desesperado, que pesou sobre a escala da opressão de ser encurralado por soldados na costa do Mar Vermelho, o que deu origem a um poder mágico milagroso! Ainda que o mesmo ocorra de novo, no mesmo âmbito, o mar, sem dúvida, não se abrirá."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{c:86EF9C:摩西分開大海}不是神給予的奇跡，{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}他被架在虐殺的天秤上，被大軍追殺至紅海，正是這九死一生的風險才產生出了奇跡的魔力！即使同樣的事以同樣規模再發生一次，海也是不會再度分開的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{c:86EF9C:摩西分开大海}不是神给予的奇迹，{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}他被架在虐杀的天秤上，被大军追杀至红海，正是这九死一生的风险才产生出了奇迹的魔力！即使同样的事以同样规模再发生一次，海也是不会再度分开的。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Bahwa Musa membelah laut bukanlah keajaiban Tuhan—itu adalah risiko yang sangat putus asa, ditimbang pada timbangan penindasan, terkepung oleh tentara di pantai Laut Merah, yang melahirkan kekuatan sihir yang ajaib! Bahkan jika hal yang sama terjadi lagi, pada tingkat yang sama, laut tidak akan terbelah."
Italian (IT): "Mosè non separò le acque grazie ad un miracolo divino, è stato il rischio di quella situazione disperata, in cui un esercito pronto a massacrarli li aveva intrappolati lungo le coste del Mar Rosso, a generare il potere magico necessario per un miracolo!   Anche se dovesse avvenire un evento identico della stessa gravità, probabilmente le acque non si separebbero di nuovo."
Turkish (TR): "Musa'nın denizi ikiye ayırması Tanrı'nın bir mucizesi değildi—Mucizevi büyü gücünü doğuran, Kızıldeniz kıyılarında askerler tarafından köşeye sıkıştırılmanın, zulmün terazisinde tartılan o son derece umutsuz riskiydi! Aynı şey aynı kapsamda bir kez daha gerçekleşse bile, deniz kuşkusuz yarılmayacaktır."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "That is because Moses managed to spectacularly draw out the single miracle carved in the roulette of those in power, which has more pockets than {c:86EF9C:asougi (10⁵⁶) and nayuta (10⁶⁰)} multiplied together."
Steam (ST): "After all, Moses was able to magnificently summon a miracle engraved on but one of the countless, enumerable results on the roulette of those with power.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That is because Moses, instead of betting on incalculable odds in the roulette of those with power, managed to spectacularly draw to himself the single miracle carved within the eyes of many.
PC Japanese (JP): なぜならモーゼは、力ある者たちのルーレットの、阿僧祇、那由他を掛けたよりも多く存在する目の中にひとつだけ刻まれた奇跡を見事引き寄せることができたからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「なぜならモーゼは、力ある者たちのルーレットの、阿僧祇、那由他を掛けたよりも多く存在する目の中にひとつだけ刻まれた奇跡を見事引き寄せることができたからだ」
Russian (RU): "А всё потому, что Моисей смог эффектно сотворить чудо в рулетке облечённых могуществом, где номеров больше, чем {c:86EF9C:асёги (10⁵⁶) и наюта (10⁶⁰)}, умноженных друг на друга!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso porque Moisés, espetacularmente, obteve um único milagre cravado na roleta que detém estes poderes, que possui mais números do que {c:86EF9C:asougi (10⁵⁶) e nayuta (10⁶⁰)} multiplicados juntos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「要問為什麼的話，那是因為摩西在強者云聚的輪盤賭中，比起{c:86EF9C:阿僧祇}和{c:86EF9C:那由他}還要多得多的格子裡面，押中了唯一鑲著奇跡的那一格，從而引來了奇跡的發生。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「要问为什么的话，那是因为摩西在强者云聚的轮盘赌中，比起{c:86EF9C:阿僧祇}和{c:86EF9C:那由他}还要多得多的格子里面，押中了唯一镶着奇迹的那一格，从而引来了奇迹的发生。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}」
Indonesian (IDN): "Itu karena Musa berhasil mengeluarkan secara spektakuler satu-satunya keajaiban yang terukir dalam roulette mereka yang berkuasa, yang memiliki lebih banyak kantong daripada {c:86EF9C:asougi (10⁵⁶) dan nayuta (10⁶⁰)} dikalikan bersama."
Italian (IT): "Questo perché Mosè riuscì a evocare un miracolo eccezionale, che era scolpito nella roulette dei potenti, le cui caselle erano più numerose di {c:86EF9C:un infinito elevato all'ennesima}."
Turkish (TR): "Çünkü Musa, {c:86EF9C:asougi (10⁵⁶) ve nayuta (10⁶⁰)} çarpımından daha fazla cebi olan iktidar sahiplerinin ruletine oyulmuş tek mucizeyi olağanüstü bir şekilde çıkarmayı başarmıştır."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "The power to triumph over astronomical odds!! Yes, magical power is, in other words, having the luck to grasp miracles!! To obtain great magical power, one must bear a risk that is hopelessly great!! Those who possess no magic would call this not a bet, but pure desperation!"
Steam (ST): That is the force that can triumph over astronomical odds!! Indeed, good fortune that can grasp miracles is magical power itself!! To obtain this mighty power, one must face the risk of despair!! Those who possess no magical power may call that desperation rather than a bet!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That power that can triumph over astronomical odds!! Yes, magical power is that fortune through which miracles are grasped!! To obtain this mighty magic power, one must face the risk of despair!! Those who possess no magical power call that desperation rather than a bet!
PC Japanese (JP): その天文学的確率に勝利できる力！！　そう、奇跡を掴み取る運気は即ち魔力なのだ！！　強大な魔力を得るためには絶望的なリスクを背負わねばならぬ！！　魔力持たぬ者はそれを賭けでなく自暴自棄と呼ぼう！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その天文学的確率に勝利できる力！！　そう、奇跡を掴み取る運気は即ち魔力なのだ！！　強大な魔力を得るためには絶望的なリスクを背負わねばならぬ！！　魔力持たぬ者はそれを賭けでなく自暴自棄と呼ぼう！」
Russian (RU): "Сила преодолеть астрономические случайности! Да, магическая сила является удачей, через которую воплощается чудо! А чтобы заполучить столь могущественную магическую силу, необходимо рисковать на уровне безнадёжности! Те же, в ком нет магической силы, назовут это скорее отчаяньем, чем ставкой!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O poder de triunfar sobre as probabilidades astronômicas!! Sim, o poder mágico é, em outras palavras, ter a sorte de alcançar um milagre!! Para obter um grande poder mágico, é preciso estar ciente de que é um risco desesperadamente ótimo!! Aqueles que não possuem a magia não chamariam isso de aposta, mas sim de puro desespero!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這股賭中天文學般概率的力量！！沒錯，抓住奇跡的運氣就已經是魔力了！！要獲得強大的魔力就必須擔負絕望性的風險！！對於沒有魔力的人而言，那不是什麼賭注，只不過是自暴自棄！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这股赌中天文学般概率的力量！！没错，抓住奇迹的运气就已经是魔力了！！要获得强大的魔力就必须担负绝望性的风险！！对于没有魔力的人而言，那不是什么赌注，只不过是自暴自弃！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Kekuatan untuk mengalahkan peluang astronomis!! Ya, kekuatan magis adalah, dengan kata lain, memiliki keberuntungan untuk meraih keajaiban!! Untuk mendapatkan kekuatan magis yang besar, seseorang harus menanggung risiko yang sangat besar!! Mereka yang tidak memiliki sihir akan menyebut ini bukan taruhan, tetapi keputusasaan murni!"
Italian (IT): "Un potere che può trionfare contro probabilità astronomicamente alte!! Sì, il potere magico è la sorte che si impadronisce di un miracolo!! Per ottenere questo immenso potere, occorre addossarsi dei rischi estremi!! Coloro privi di potere magico non la chiamano una scommessa, ma la definiscono come pura disperazione!"
Turkish (TR): "Astronomik olasılıklara karşı zafer kazanma gücü!! Evet, büyülü güç, başka bir deyişle, mucizeleri yakalama şansına sahip olmaktır!! Büyük bir büyü gücü elde etmek için, umulmadık derecede büyük bir riske katlanmak gerekir! Büyüye sahip olmayanlar buna bahis değil, saf çaresizlik derler!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "However, those who truly do possess magical power can grasp hold of that miracle and make the enigma come into being!! And if that power exists within me! I will seize that miracle, I will be able to make the wish I devoted my life towards come true!!"
Steam (ST): "However, people who truly do possess magic power can grasp hold of that miracle and make the enigma come into being!! And if that power exists within me...! I'll seize that miracle! I'll have a chance at making the wish I devoted my life towards come true!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, people who truly do possess magic power can grasp hold of that miracle and make the enigma come into being!! And if that power exists within me...! I'll seize that miracle! I'll have a chance at making the wish I devoted my life towards come true!!"
PC Japanese (JP): しかし真に魔力ある者はその奇跡を掴み取り、神秘を成就させるのだッ！！　もしも私にその魔力があるならば！　私はその奇跡を掴み取るだろう、生涯を費やした願いを実現できるだろうッ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「しかし真に魔力ある者はその奇跡を掴み取り、神秘を成就させるのだッ！！　もしも私にその魔力があるならば！　私はその奇跡を掴み取るだろう、生涯を費やした願いを実現できるだろうッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Те же, кто действительно имеет магическую силу, творят чудо и воплощают таинство! А если такая сила есть во мне! Я сотворю чудо и заставлю сбыться желание, которому я посвятил всю свою жизнь!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "No entanto, aqueles que realmente possuem algum poder mágico, podem alcançar esse milagre e dar existência ao enigma!! E se esse poder existe dentro de mim! Eu vou aproveitar esse milagre, e serei capaz de fazer o meu desejo, ao qual eu devotei a minha vida inteira, se tornar realidade!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「可是真正有魔力的人就會抓住奇跡，成就神秘！！如果我有這魔力的話！我就能抓住這個奇跡，實現費盡一生的願望了吧！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「可是真正有魔力的人就会抓住奇迹，成就神秘！！如果我有这魔力的话！我就能抓住这个奇迹，实现费尽一生的愿望了吧！！」
Indonesian (IDN): "Namun, mereka yang benar-benar memiliki kekuatan magis dapat meraih keajaiban itu dan membuat teka-teki itu menjadi kenyataan!! Dan jika kekuatan itu ada dalam diriku! Aku akan merebut keajaiban itu, aku akan bisa mewujudkan keinginan yang kudedikasikan seumur hidupku!!"
Italian (IT): "Ma quei miracoli vengono agguantati dalle persone che detengono davvero il potere magico, e che ne comprendono i loro segreti!! E se quel potere magico esistesse dentro di me, io...! Agguanterò quel miracolo, e potrò rendere realtà il desiderio per cui ho dato la mia vita!!"
Turkish (TR): "Ancak, gerçekten büyülü güce sahip olanlar bu mucizeyi kavrayabilir ve muammanın gerçekleşmesini sağlayabilir!! Ve eğer bu güç benim içimde varsa! O mucizeyi yakalayacağım, hayatımı adadığım dileği gerçekleştirebileceğim!!!"

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo looked up to the sky outside the window.{n}He spread his arms as if appealing to someone up in the skies.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kinzo looked up to the sky outside the window. He spread his arms as if appealing to someone up in the skies.

PC Japanese (JP): どれほどの月日を経ようとも、お前の面影が消えることはない…。ただお前の微笑が見たい…、それだけだ…！　お前から授かったものを全て返そう！　あの日からの栄光を全てお前に返そうッ！　富も名誉も黄金もいらぬ！！　お前に授かった全てを返そうッ！！

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Apparently, even though Rudolf seemed to resent the way his father did whatever he pleased...he'd rather avoid seeing his father's face if he could help it.

Russian (RU): Похоже, хоть Рудольфа и возмущало то, что его отец поступал так, как ему вздумается... он по возможности старался избегать встреч с ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente, mesmo que Rudolf parecesse se ressentir da forma como seu pai agia como bem entendesse, ele particularmente evitaria ver o rosto de seu pai se possível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這看起來就像在說…雖然對任性的父親感到憤慨，但是不用見面那也挺好的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这看起来就像在说…虽然对任性的父亲感到愤慨，但是不用见面那也挺好的。
Indonesian (IDN): Tampaknya, meskipun Rudolf tampak kesal dengan cara ayahnya melakukan apa pun yang dia inginkan, dia lebih suka menghindari melihat wajahnya jika bisa.
Italian (IT): A quanto pareva, anche se era infuriato per l'egoismo di suo padre, se poteva evitare un faccia a faccia... ne avrebbe approfittato volentieri.
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre Rudolf babasının canı ne isterse onu yapmasına içerliyor gibi görünse de, elinden gelse onun yüzünü görmekten kaçınmayı tercih ediyordu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rosa
Umineko Project (UP): "Does it seem like his mood will improve before dinner? Krauss nii‐san?"
Steam (ST): "Does it seem like his mood will improve before dinner, Krauss nii-san?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Does it seem like his mood will improve before dinner? Krauss nii-san?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「夕食までにはその機嫌、直りそうなの？　蔵臼兄さん。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「夕食までにはその機嫌、直りそうなの？　蔵臼兄さん」
Russian (RU): "Какова вероятность, что его настроение улучшится до ужина? Краусс нии‐сан?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Será que ele vai melhorar o seu humor antes do jantar? Krauss nii‐san?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那到了晚飯的時候，心情會不會變好些呢？藏臼哥。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那到了晚饭的时候，心情会不会变好些呢？藏臼哥。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Apakah suasana hatinya akan membaik sebelum makan malam? Krauss nii-san?"
Italian (IT): "Credi che il suo umore migliorerà per l'ora di cena... oppure no, Klaus-san?"
Turkish (TR): "Akşam yemeğinden önce ruh hali düzelecek gibi görünüyor mu? Krauss nii-san?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "I have no idea. You can try to ask Father directly. ...Although, I think his mood will improve faster if we don't bother him."
Steam (ST): "I have no idea. If you want to know that, you should ask him directly. ...Although, I think his mood will improve faster if we don't bother him."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I have no idea. You can try and ask Father directly. ...Although, I think his mood will improve faster if we don't bother him."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そんなことは知らんよ。親父殿に直接聞いてみるといい。…もっとも、声を掛けない方が機嫌の直りは早いと思うがね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そんなことは知らんよ。親父殿に直接聞いてみるといい。…もっとも、声を掛けない方が機嫌の直りは早いと思うがね」
Russian (RU): "Понятия не имею. Можешь сходить и спросить отца напрямую. ...Однако, как мне кажется, его настроение улучшится быстрее, если мы не будем докучать ему."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não tem como eu saber isso. Você pode tentar perguntar diretamente para ele. ...Apesar de que eu acho que o humor dele pode melhorar mais rápido se não o incomodarmos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「天知道。你直接去問他本人好了。…我倒覺得別去理他，他反而心情會好得快一些。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「天知道。你直接去问他本人好了。…我倒觉得别去理他，他反而心情会好得快一些。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Aku tidak tahu. Kau bisa mencoba bertanya langsung pada Ayah. ...Meskipun, kupikir suasana hatinya akan membaik lebih cepat jika kita tidak mengganggunya."
Italian (IT): "Non ne ho idea. Prova pure a chiedere a nostro padre... Ma d'altronde, credo che il suo umore migliorerebbe più in fretta se non lo disturbassimo."
Turkish (TR): "Hiçbir fikrim yok. Doğrudan babama sormayı deneyebilirsin. ...Yine de, onu rahatsız etmezsek ruh halinin daha hızlı düzeleceğini düşünüyorum."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Jessica
Umineko Project (UP): "The only one who can bring Grandfather's temper under control is Genji‐san. Pretty damn pathetic when you have to have a servant to deal with your own parent's bad mood."
Steam (ST): "Genji-san's the only one who can get Grandfather out of a funk. It's pretty pathetic though, making the servants deal with your own parent's bad mood."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The only one who can get Grandfather better is Genji-san. It sucks though, making the servants deal with your own parent's bad mood."
PC Japanese (JP): 「源次さんだけだよ、祖父さまの機嫌を直せるのは。情けないぜ、自分の親の機嫌を使用人に直させるんだからよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「源次さんだけだよ、祖父さまの機嫌を直せるのは。情けないぜ、自分の親の機嫌を使用人に直させるんだからよ」
Russian (RU): "Единственный, кто способен поднять ему настроение — это Генджи‐сан. Хотя, конечно, это фигово, когда плохим настроением собственных родителей приходится заниматься слугам."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O único que pode deixar o temperamento dele sob controle é o Genji‐san.{n}É extremamente patético quando você precisa deixar que um empregado cuide do mau humor do seu pai."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「能讓爺爺的心情變好的，也只有源次了。真是沒面子嘞，自己的爸爸居然要靠傭人來哄開心。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「能让爷爷的心情变好的，也只有源次了。真是没面子嘞，自己的爸爸居然要靠佣人来哄开心。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Satu-satunya yang bisa mengendalikan kemarahan Kakek adalah Genji-san. Sangat menyedihkan ketika kau harus memiliki pelayan untuk menangani suasana hati buruk orang tua sendiri."
Italian (IT): "Solo Genji-san può migliorare l'umore del nonno. È triste che un domestico riesca a sollevare l'umore di un genitore."
Turkish (TR): "Büyükbabanın öfkesini kontrol altına alabilecek tek kişi Genji-san. Kendi ebeveyninizin kötü ruh haliyle başa çıkmak için bir hizmetkâra sahip olmanız oldukça acınası."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Jessica. Don't speak out of turn."
Steam (ST): "Jessica. Don't speak out of turn."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「朱志香。余計なことは言わなくていい」
Russian (RU): "Джессика, не перебивай."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Jessica. Não fale coisas desnecessárias."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「朱志香。不用你多嘴。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Indonesian (IDN): "Jessica. Jangan bicara sembarangan."
Italian (IT): "Jessica. Non parlare a sproposito."
Turkish (TR): "Jessica. Yersiz konuşma."

Umineko Project (UP): She'd planned for her complaint to be heard only by her cousins, but it had reached even Krauss's ears.
Steam (ST): She'd planned for her complaint to be heard only by her cousins, but it had reached even Krauss's ears.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): いとこたちだけに聞こえるようぼやいたつもりだったが、しっかり蔵臼の耳にも届いてた。
Russian (RU): Она хотела, чтобы её недовольство дошло лишь до ушей её кузенов, однако оно достигло даже ушей Краусса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela planejava que suas reclamações chegassem aos ouvidos de seus primos, mas chegou até os ouvidos de Krauss.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然朱志香本打算只讓堂兄妹聽到，所以只是小聲嘟噥，但還是清清楚楚地傳到了藏臼的耳朵裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然朱志香本打算只让堂兄妹听到，所以只是小声嘟哝，但还是清清楚楚地传到了藏臼的耳朵里。
Indonesian (IDN): Dia berencana untuk keluhannya hanya didengar oleh sepupu-sepupunya, tetapi itu bahkan sampai ke telinga Krauss.
Italian (IT): Lei voleva che la propria lamentela fosse sentita solo dai cugini, ma questa aveva raggiunto anche le orecchie di Klaus.
Turkish (TR): Şikâyetinin sadece kuzenleri tarafından duyulmasını planlamıştı ama Krauss'un kulaklarına bile ulaşmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): Scolded, Jessica scowled and turned away, sulking.
Steam (ST): Scolded, Jessica scowled and turned away, sulking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Scolded, Jessica scowled and turned away, sulking.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Repreendida, Jessica fez uma careta e se virou emburrada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 被罵了的朱志香露出一副不服氣的表情，轉過頭去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 被骂了的朱志香露出一副不服气的表情，转过头去。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "......His condition can't be that bad, can it, with that kinda temper? I mean, if they were saying he's not feeling well that'd be one thing, but if it's his mood that's bad, at least it's proof he's got some fight in him."
Steam (ST): "...If he's as cranky as they make him sound, he can't be that terribly sick, right? I mean, they're saying he's in a bad mood, not that he's got no energy, which at least proves he's got his wits about him."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......His disease can't be that bad, can it, with that kinda temper? I mean, if he's not healthy, and his mood is bad, at least it's proof he's still hanging on."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……機嫌が云々ってことは、病状はそんな悪くないんじゃねぇの？　元気がないってんならともかく、機嫌が悪いってのは、少なくとも気はしっかりしてる証拠だぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……機嫌が云々ってことは、病状はそんな悪くないんじゃねぇの？　元気がないってんならともかく、機嫌が悪いってのは、少なくとも気はしっかりしてる証拠だぜ」
Russian (RU): "......Думаю, его болезнь не так уж и тяжела при такой‐то вспыльчивости. Я имею в виду, что если он нездоров и в плохом настроении, то это как минимум доказательство, что он ещё держится."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......As condições dele não vão piorar por causa do temperamento dele, vão? Digo, ele dizer que não está se sentindo bem é uma coisa, mas, se apenas o humor dele não está bom, ao menos isso é uma prova de que ele está lutando contra algo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……還能說心情如何如何這種話，證明病情還沒那麼壞吧？要是人沒精神的話那當然不好辦，可他現在心情不好，那至少證明精氣神很足啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……还能说心情如何如何这种话，证明病情还没那么坏吧？要是人没精神的话那当然不好办，可他现在心情不好，那至少证明精气神很足啊。」
Indonesian (IDN): "......Kondisinya tidak bisa seburuk itu, kan, dengan temperamen seperti itu? Maksudku, jika mereka mengatakan dia tidak enak badan itu satu hal, tapi jika suasana hatinya yang buruk, setidaknya itu bukti dia masih punya semangat."
Italian (IT): "...Se il suo umore è così, le sue condizioni di salute non possono essere così gravi, no? Se non sta bene ma è di malumore, perlomeno è la prova che la sua mente è salda."
Turkish (TR): "......Bu kadar sinirliyken durumu o kadar da kötü olamaz, değil mi? Yani, eğer kendini iyi hissetmediğini söyleseydi bu bir şey olurdu, ama kötü olan ruh hali ise, en azından içinde biraz mücadele olduğunun kanıtı."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, Grandfather does have especially strong willpower. ...But, it doesn't mean that his body will always follow that. Since last year, they keep saying that he has three months left."
Steam (ST): "It's because Grandfather has especially strong willpower. ...However, that doesn't necessarily mean his body will be able to keep up. Since last year, they keep saying that he has three months left.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's because Grandfather has especially strong willpower. ...But, it doesn't mean that his body will always follow that. Since last year, they keep saying that he has three months left.
PC Japanese (JP): 「お祖父さまは特に強い気力をお持ちだからね。…でも、体が必ずしもそれに伴えるとは限らないよ。去年からずっと、余命３ヶ月って言われ続けてる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お祖父さまは特に強い気力をお持ちだからね。…でも、体が必ずしもそれに伴えるとは限らないよ。去年からずっと、余命３ヶ月って言われ続けてる」
Russian (RU): "Просто дедушка обладает особенно сильной волей. ...Но это ещё не значит, что его тело может всегда работать на ней. В прошлом году сказали, что ему осталось три месяца."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, ele tem uma força de vontade excepcional. ...Mas isso não significa que o seu corpo sempre vai obedecê‐lo. Desde o ano passado, ele continua dizendo que só tem mais três meses de vida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爺爺的精神力特別強。…但是，身體就不一定也這麼強了。從去年開始，他就一直被告知只剩三個月的壽命。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爷爷的精神力特别强。…但是，身体就不一定也这么强了。从去年开始，他就一直被告知只剩三个月的寿命。」
Indonesian (IDN): "Yah, Kakek memang memiliki kemauan yang sangat kuat. ...Tapi, itu tidak berarti bahwa tubuhnya akan selalu mengikuti itu. Sejak tahun lalu, mereka terus mengatakan bahwa dia hanya punya tiga bulan lagi."
Italian (IT): "È dovuto specialmente alla grande forza di volontà del nonno... Ma ciò non vuol dire che il suo corpo riesca a stare al passo. È dall'anno scorso che si è continuato a dire che gli rimangono tre mesi di vita..."
Turkish (TR): "Büyükbabanın özel bir güçlü iradesi var. ...Ama bu vücudunun her zaman bunu takip edeceği anlamına gelmiyor. Geçen yıldan beri, üç ayı kaldığını söyleyip duruyorlar."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "...If the initial diagnosis was correct, Grandfather has been prolonging his life by willpower alone. ......We have to be concerned for him."
Steam (ST): ...If the initial diagnosis was correct, Grandfather has been prolonging his life by willpower alone. ......It's right for us to worry about him."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If the initial diagnosis was correct, Grandfather has been prolonging his life by willpower alone. ......It should be a cause for concern."
PC Japanese (JP): …最初の診断が正しいなら、お祖父さまは気力だけで永らえてるってことになる。……気遣ってあげないといけないよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…最初の診断が正しいなら、お祖父さまは気力だけで永らえてるってことになる。……気遣ってあげないといけないよ」
Russian (RU): "...Если начальный диагноз был верен, то дедушка ещё жив благодаря одной лишь силе воли. ......Вот на этот счет следует побеспокоиться."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Se o diagnóstico inicial estiver correto, ele tem prolongado a sua vida apenas com a sua força de vontade. ......Você não precisa ficar tão preocupado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…如果最早的診斷是正確的話，那爺爺現在就是光靠著精神力在延長壽命。……必須要去多關心關心他了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…如果最早的诊断是正确的话，那爷爷现在就是光靠着精神力在延长寿命。……必须要去多关心关心他了。」
Indonesian (IDN): "...Jika diagnosis awal benar, Kakek telah memperpanjang hidupnya hanya dengan kemauan. ......Kita harus mengkhawatirkannya."
Italian (IT): "Se la diagnosi iniziale era corretta, il nonno ha prolungato la sua vita solo grazie alla sua forza di volontà... È naturale essere preoccupati per lui."
Turkish (TR): "...Eğer ilk teşhis doğruysa, Büyükbaba sadece iradesiyle ömrünü uzatıyor. ......Onun için endişelenmeliyiz."

Umineko Project (UP): Lunch started with the family head's seat still empty.
Steam (ST): Lunch started with the Family Head's seat still empty.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 当主の席を空席のまま始まる昼食。
Russian (RU): Ланч начался при пустующем месте главы семьи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O almoço começou com o assento do chefe da família vazio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 午飯就在當主的座位空著的情況下開始了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 午饭就在当主的座位空着的情况下开始了。

Italian (IT): Con la sedia del capofamiglia ancora vuota, il pranzo ebbe inizio...

Umineko Project (UP): ...The man who should have been sitting there was already old, and the brilliant glory which had rebuilt the Ushiromiya family in a single lifetime was slowly being forgotten.
Steam (ST): ...The man who should be sitting there had already grown old, and the brilliant glory which had rebuilt the Ushiromiya family in the span of a single lifetime was being forgotten.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The man who should be sitting there was already old, and the brilliant glory which had rebuilt the Ushiromiya family in a single lifetime was being forgotten.
PC Japanese (JP): …そこに座るべき人物はすでに老い、右代宮家を一代にして復興させた輝かしき栄光は忘れ去られつつある。
Russian (RU): ...Человек, которому полагалось там сидеть, был уже стар, и ослепительный триумф, с которым он восстановил семью Уширомия сроком в одну жизнь, был забыт.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...O homem que deveria sentar lá já estava velho, e a brilhante glória, com qual ele reconstruiu a família Ushiromiya em uma única vida, estava lentamente sendo esquecida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …應當坐在那裡的人早已老去，復興了右代宮一家的榮耀也被漸漸忘卻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …应当坐在那里的人早已老去，复兴了右代宫一家的荣耀也被渐渐忘却。
Indonesian (IDN): ...Pria yang seharusnya duduk di sana sudah tua, dan kemuliaan cemerlang yang membangun kembali keluarga Ushiromiya dalam satu masa hidup perlahan dilupakan.
Italian (IT): L'uomo che avrebbe dovuto sedersi lì era ormai vecchio, e la grande gloria che gli aveva permesso di ricostruire nell'arco di una sola vita il ramo principale degli Ushiromiya, stava venendo dimenticata.
Turkish (TR): ...Orada oturması gereken adam çoktan yaşlanmıştı, ve Ushiromiya ailesini tek bir yaşamda yeniden inşa eden parlak ihtişam yavaş yavaş unutuluyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): Nobody seemed to feel uncomfortable when the meal began with that seat still empty...
Steam (ST): Even though they were beginning the meal with that seat still empty, no one felt it was that odd anymore...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nobody seemed to feel uncomfortable when the meal began with that seat still empty...
PC Japanese (JP): その席が空白のまま食事が始まることに、もう誰も違和感を感じないように…。
Russian (RU): Когда все принялись за еду, никто не испытывал дискомфорта от того, что главное место пустует...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ninguém parecia estar se sentindo desconfortável quando o jantar começou com um dos assentos vazio...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即使是空著那個座位開始用餐，也不會有任何人感到奇怪了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即使是空着那个座位开始用餐，也不会有任何人感到奇怪了…。

Italian (IT): Quando il pranzo cominciò con quella sedia ancora vuota, nessuno sembrava essere turbato...
Turkish (TR): O koltuk hâlâ boşken yemek başladığında kimse rahatsız olmuş gibi görünmüyordu...
